Sense.DEF: the 18th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十八个字母

Sense.DEF: used to describe a film that has been officially approved as only suitable for people over 17
Sense.TRAN: R级电影〔指经官方审看批准仅适合17岁以上观众观看的电影〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Republican, used after a politician’s name to show that he or she belongs to the Republican Party in the US 〔美国〕共和党人﹐共和党党员〔用于人名后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve Gunderson (R)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫•冈德森（共和党人）

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=regina(=queen), used after the name of the queen of the United Kingdom 女王〔用于英国女王姓名后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elizabeth R
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白女王

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=river, used especially on maps 河﹐江〔尤用于地图上〕

Sense.DEF: a style of popular music that is a mixture of blues and jazz
Sense.TRAN: 节奏布鲁斯﹐节奏蓝调〔流行乐的一种﹐融合了布鲁斯和爵士乐的音乐风格〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a business concerned with studying new ideas and planning new products
a holiday, especially one given to people in the army, navy etc after a long period of hard work or during a war
Sense.TRAN: 休整假期〔尤指军人在长期执勤后或战争期间得到的假期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was enjoying a few hard-earned days of R and R.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在享受辛苦挣来的几天休假。

Sense.DEF: a Jewish priest
rabbis considered together as a group
relating to the writings or teaching of rabbis
a small animal with long ears and soft fur, that lives in a hole in the ground
the fur or meat of a rabbit
to talk for a long time in an uninteresting or annoying way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kept rabbiting on about the environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没完没了地唠叨环境问题。

Sense.DEF: a quick hit on the back of the neck, done with the side of your hand
an area under the ground where a lot of wild rabbits live
Sense.TRAN: 野兔群居地﹐野兔洞穴多的地方

Sense.DEF: a building with a lot of narrow passages, or a place with a lot of narrow streets, where you can easily get lost
a noisy crowd of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rabble of angry youths
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群吵嚷﹑愤怒的年轻人

Sense.DEF: when someone deliberately makes a crowd of people angry and violent, especially in order to achieve political aims
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指出于政治目的的〕煽动﹐蛊惑民众
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused union leaders of rabble-rousing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责工会领导人煽动民众。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a rabble-rousing speech

Sense.DEF: having very extreme and unreasonable opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of rabid right-wing fanatics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群极端的右翼狂热分子

Sense.DEF: a rabid animal is suffering from rabies
a very dangerous disease that affects dogs and other animals, and that you can catch if you are bitten by an infected animal
a small North American animal with black fur around its eyes and black and grey rings on its tail
the skin and thick fur of a raccoon
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raccoon coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浣熊皮大衣

Sense.DEF: a competition in which people or animals compete to run, drive etc fastest and finish first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will be the youngest runner in the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将是比赛中最年轻的选手。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over 80 cars will take part in the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将有80多辆汽车参加比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the annual boat race between Oxford and Cambridge Universities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛津大学与剑桥大学之间一年一度的划船赛

Subsense.DEF: one of the main groups that humans can be divided into according to the colour of their skin and other physical features
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The school welcomes children of all races .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校欢迎各种族的学生就读。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a person of mixed race
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混血儿
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The law forbids discrimination on the grounds of race or religion.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律禁止以种族或宗教信仰为由歧视他人。

Subsense.DEF: a group of people who are similar in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 1960s produced a new race of young novelists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪60年代产生了一批新的年轻小说家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are schools breeding producing a race of children incapable of making decisions for themselves?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校是否正在培养一批没有自主能力的孩子？

Sense.DEF: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More and more drug companies are joining the race to beat cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正有越来越多的医药公司加入攻克癌症的竞赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have to do something very quickly because you have very little time available

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is now a race to find the killer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在正加紧寻找凶手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pilot then began a desperate race against time to land the plane before it ran out of fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是飞行员开始争分夺秒﹐力争在燃油耗尽前着陆。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people are competing with each other to win a prize or obtain a position of power
Sense.TRAN: 〔为获奖或得到权力的〕竞争﹐角逐

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Bird has now officially joined the race for the White House.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯德先生现已正式参加入主白宫的角逐。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is no longer in the race for academic awards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经无缘学术奖的角逐了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the race to host the next Olympic Games
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一届奥运会主办权的角逐

Sense.DEF: an occasion when horse races are held

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We spent a day at the races.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看了一天赛马。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is competing in his first race this year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年他将首次参赛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s have a race!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们比比看！

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The race will be held on February 25th.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛将于2月25日举行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He did not win another race that season.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个赛季﹐他没有再赢过。

Collocate.COLLOC: come first/last etc in a race

Variant.LEXVAR: finish first/last etc in a race

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 比赛获得第一名/最后一名等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She came third in the race.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跑了第三名。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be ahead of everyone else

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He said he expected the race to be tough.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他预计比赛会很艰苦。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an important race
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are only three days to go until the big race.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 距离大赛只有3天时间了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He finished first in the 100 metres race.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在100米赛跑中获得第一。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people run, cycle etc on ordinary roads

Subsense.DEF: to compete against someone or something in a race

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’ll be racing against some of the world’s top athletes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将与一些世界顶尖运动员一决高下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stevens will not be racing in the final due to a knee injury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文斯由于膝伤将不能参加决赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll race you to the end of the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和你比﹐看谁先跑到路的尽头。

Subsense.DEF: to use an animal or a vehicle to compete in a race
Subsense.TRAN: 使〔动物或车辆〕参加比赛
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He will be racing a Ferrari in this year’s Formula One championships.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将驾驶法拉利参加今年的一级方程式锦标赛。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly or take someone or something to a place very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速移动﹔把…急送〔到某处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raced into the village on his bike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骑着自行车飞快地进了村。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to race home for my bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不飞奔回家取我的包。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was raced to hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被迅速送往医院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He raced to meet her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他飞奔过去迎她。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something very quickly because you want to be the first to do it, or because there is very little time available

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investors are racing to buy shares in the new hi-tech companies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者争相购买这些新兴高科技公司的股份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The astronauts are racing against time to repair the spaceship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇航员正在抓紧抢修宇宙飞船。

Sense.DEF: if your heart or mind races, it works harder and faster than usual, for example because you are afraid or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏〕急速跳动﹔〔头脑〕快速运转
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart was racing and my knees shook uncontrollably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的心跳加速﹐膝盖也不由自主地打起战来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mind was racing, trying to think where I had seen him before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脑子飞速转动﹐努力回想以前在哪儿见过他。

Sense.DEF: if an engine races, it runs too fast
a racing car
a list of the races that will happen at a horse racing event, and the horses that will take part in each race
a grass track on which horses race
someone who goes regularly to watch horse races
a horse specially bred and trained for racing
an occasion when horse races are held at a particular place
someone who competes in a race
the relationship that exists between people from different countries, religions etc who are now living in the same place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to do more to promote good race relations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要有更多的行动来促进种族之间形成良好关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Community leaders are working to improve race relations in the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区领导人正努力改善该市的种族关系。

Sense.DEF: violent fighting between people of different countries, religions etc who now live in the same country
a track on which runners or cars race
a grass track on which horses race
relating to the relationships between different races of people who now live in the same country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a victim of racial discrimination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族歧视的受害者
Sense.EXAMPLE: This part of the community needs to be protected from racial prejudice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需保护社区里的这一部分人﹐使其免受种族偏见的伤害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: evidence of racial harassment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族骚扰的证据
Sense.EXAMPLE: the campaign for racial equality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取种族平等的运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need for tolerance and racial harmony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包容与种族融洽的必要性

Sense.DEF: relating to the various races that humans can be divided into
Sense.EXAMPLE: a broad range of racial and ethnic groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形形色色的种族和民族群体
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of different racial origin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同种族背景的人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They live in a racially mixed area.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们居住在一个种族混杂的地区。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: Police officers believe the attack was racially motivated.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这次袭击事件是出于种族原因。

Sense.TRAN: 种族歧视﹔种族暴力﹔种族主义

Sense.DEF: the sport of racing horses
Sense.EXAMPLE: watching the racing on television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在电视上看赛马
Sense.EXAMPLE: today’s racing results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的赛马结果

Sense.DEF: the sport of racing cars etc
designed or bred to go very fast and be used for racing
Sense.EXAMPLE: racing pigeons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛鸽
Sense.EXAMPLE: a racing yacht
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛艇

Sense.DEF: a very fast car that is specially designed for races
unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of racism in schools
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里的种族歧视问题

Sense.DEF: the belief that some races of people are better than other races
someone who believes that people of their own race are better than others, and who treats people from other races unfairly and sometimes violently – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: He denied being a racist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他否认自己是种族主义者。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the victim of a racist attack
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族主义袭击的受害者
RunOn.EXAMPLE: racist violence
racist remarks

Sense.DEF: a frame or shelf that has bars or hooks on which you can put things
Sense.TRAN: 〔带有横档或钩子的〕架子﹐搁物架
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wine rack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒架
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine rack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂志架

PIC.HEADING: RACKS 架子
PIC.PICCONTENT: clothes rack 衣服架；spice rack 调料架

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that was used in the past to make people suffer severe pain by stretching their bodies
Sense.TRAN: 拉肢刑架〔旧时一种酷刑刑具〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people were tortured on the rack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾有数千人受过拉肢酷刑。

Sense.DEF: in a very difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is now well and truly on the rack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司现在彻底陷入危机。

Sense.DEF: if a building goes to rack and ruin, it gradually gets into a very bad condition because no one has looked after it
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑因缺乏维护而〕破损﹐毁坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house had been left to go to rack and ruin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子已无人看管﹐日渐破败。

Sense.DEF: a three-sided frame used for arranging the balls at the start of a game of snooker or pool
Sense.TRAN: 〔斯诺克台球或落袋台球开局时用于排列球的〕三角框

Sense.DEF: a fairly large piece of meat from the side of an animal, that contains several rib bones
if you can buy something off the rack, you can buy it in a shop rather than having it specially made
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of designer clothes are now available off the rack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在很多名牌服装都有成品卖了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suffer great mental or physical pain
Sense.TRAN: 使〔精神或肉体〕遭受巨大痛苦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Great sobs racked her body .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她哭得全身抽搐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face was racked with pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛得脸都变形了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liza was racked by guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莎深感内疚。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to remember or think of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I racked my brains, trying to remember his name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绞尽脑汁想记起他的名字。

Sense.DEF: to get a number or amount of something, especially a number of points in a competition
Sense.TRAN: 取得〔数目或数量〕﹔〔尤指比赛〕得〔分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He racked up 41 points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得了41分。

Sense.DEF: a loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old machine used to make an awful racket .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台旧机器以前噪音大得吓人。

Sense.DEF: a dishonest way of obtaining money, such as by threatening people or selling them illegal goods

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police believe he is involved in an international smuggling racket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为他参与了国际走私的勾当。

Sense.DEF: a specially shaped piece of wood or metal that you use for hitting the ball in games such as tennis, that has a circle filled with tight strings at one end
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tennis racket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网球拍

Sense.DEF: someone who earns money through crime and illegal activities
Sense.TRAN: 诈骗者﹔非法获取钱财者

Sense.DEF: when someone earns money through crime and illegal activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: people involved in smuggling and racketeering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参与走私和非法勾当的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has been arrested on racketeering charges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因被控诈骗而遭逮捕。

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at telling stories in an interesting and amusing way
another spelling of raccoon
another spelling of racket3
an indoor game in which two or four players hit a small ball against the four walls of the court
racy writing is exciting and entertaining and often about sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: a racy novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺激的小说

Sense.DEF: exciting or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you guys seen Wendy’s new place? It’s so rad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们看过温迪的新房子吗？棒极了。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

Sense.DEF: if something is on your radar, you have noticed it and are giving it some attention
Sense.TRAN: 受某人关注的/受关注的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is one of the issues on our radar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们所关注的事件之一。

Sense.DEF: to not be noticed by someone
Sense.TRAN: 没被某人注意/没被注意
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did this band slip under the radar?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队怎么会没受到关注？

Sense.DEF: a small piece of radar equipment that is used to find out how fast things, especially cars, are going
Sense.TRAN: 雷达测速器〔尤用于汽车测速〕

Sense.DEF: a place on a road where police wait with radar equipment in order to catch drivers who are going too fast
someone who looks raddled looks old or tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: her raddled face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她憔悴的脸庞

Sense.DEF: arranged in a circular shape with bars or lines coming from the centre
Sense.EXAMPLE: radial roads leading out of the city centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从市中心向外辐射的道路

Sense.DEF: a car tyre with wires inside the rubber that go completely around the wheel to make it stronger and safer
great happiness that shows in someone’s face and makes them look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young face full of radiance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张光彩照人的年轻脸庞

Sense.DEF: a soft gentle light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moon’s radiance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光

Sense.DEF: full of happiness and love, in a way that shows in your face and makes you look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked radiant in a white silk dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身穿白色真丝礼服﹐看上去光彩照人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radiant smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灿烂的笑容

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were both radiant with happiness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两人都喜气洋洋。

Sense.DEF: very bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovely day with clear blue skies and radiant sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碧空如洗﹑阳光灿烂的一天

Sense.DEF: radiant heat or energy is sent out in the form of waves

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She looked radiantly beautiful.

Sense.DEF: if someone radiates a feeling, or if it radiates from them, it is very easy to see that this is how they feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: He radiated calm confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身上散发着沉稳自信的气质。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kindness radiated from her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身上透着友善。

Sense.DEF: if something radiates light or heat, or if light or heat radiates from something, the light or heat is sent out in all directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The log fire radiated a warm cosy glow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃烧的原木发出温暖舒适的红光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Heat radiated from the glowing coals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃烧的煤块散发出热量。

Sense.DEF: if things radiate from a central point, they spread out in different directions from that point

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were tiny lines radiating from the corners of her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 细细的皱纹从她眼角蔓延开来。

Sense.DEF: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lethal dose of radiation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命剂量的辐射

Sense.DEF: energy in the form of heat or light that is sent out as waves that you cannot see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

Sense.DEF: an illness that is caused when your body receives too much radiation
a thin metal container that is fastened to a wall and through which hot water passes to provide heat for a room
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间内借由热水循环供热的〕暖气设备

Sense.DEF: the part of a car or aircraft which stops the engine from getting too hot
a radical change or difference is very big and important
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radical reform of the tax system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税收制度的彻底改革
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

Sense.DEF: radical ideas are very new and different, and are against what most people think or believe
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has put forward some very radical ideas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了一些非常激进的观点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shocked by her radical views.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的激进观点让我震惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radical approach to education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有创见的教育方法

Sense.DEF: someone who is radical has ideas that are very new and different, and against what most people think or believe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radical left-wing politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进的左翼政客
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radical feminist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进的女权主义者

Sense.DEF: very good or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was one radical party last night!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚的聚会太棒了！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a radically different method of production
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种截然不同的生产方式
RunOn.EXAMPLE: a radically new approach to the problem

Sense.DEF: someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

Sense.EXAMPLE: radicals on the extreme left wing of the party

Sense.DEF: to make people accept new and different ideas, especially ideas about complete social and political change
Sense.TRAN: 使激进﹔使接受全新观念

Sense.DEF:
a type of plant used in
salad s
that is red and has a bitter taste
the plural of radius

Subsense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment which you use to listen to programmes that are broadcast, such as music and news

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sat down and turned on the radio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来打开收音机。

Subsense.DEF: programmes that are broadcast on the radio
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really listen to the radio very much.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不怎么听广播。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you hear the interview with the Prime Minister on the radio this morning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天早上有没有听广播里对首相的访谈？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s got his own radio show now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在有自己的广播节目了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works for a local radio station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在当地一家电台工作。

Subsense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment, for example on a plane or ship, which can send and receive spoken messages

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We received a call for help over the ship’s radio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通过船上的无线电收到一个求救呼叫。

Subsense.DEF: when messages are sent or received in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should be able to reach them by radio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该能够通过无线电联系到他们。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve lost radio contact with the plane.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和这架飞机失去了无线电联络。

Sense.DEF: to send a message using a radio

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship radioed for help.

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通过无线电请求伦敦准予降落。

Sense.DEF: using radio waves

the taking of

the study and medical use of

the treatment of illnesses using

an area that covers a particular distance in all directions from a central point

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。

a

gas that is used in the treatment of diseases such as

. It is a chemical element: symbol Rn

the British
air force

a soft substance like string that comes from the leaves of a

Sense.DEF: behaving or dressing in a way which is not respected by many people but which is still confident and attractive

Sense.DEF: a competition or game in which people buy numbered tickets and can win prizes

Sense.DEF: a flat floating structure that you can sit on, jump from etc when you are swimming
Sense.TRAN: 〔可供游泳者坐于其上﹑跳水等的〕浮台

Sense.DEF: a small flat rubber boat filled with air, used for example if a boat sinks
one of the large sloping pieces of wood that form the structure of a roof
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club was packed to the rafters very full .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部里挤满了人。

Sense.DEF: the activity of travelling on a raft, especially as a sport

Sense.DEF: a small piece of old cloth, for example one used for cleaning things

Sense.EXAMPLE: an oily rag

Sense.DEF: a newspaper, especially one that you think is not particularly important or of good quality

Sense.DEF: wearing old torn clothes

Sense.DEF: becoming very rich after starting your life very poor

Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes to tell people of his rise from rags to riches.

a piece of
ragtime
music

Sense.DEF:
a soft
doll
made of cloth
a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭﹐被送往医院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam became quite frightening when he was in a rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆发火的时候很吓人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just then, she heard Mr Evan’s bellow of rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐她听到埃文先生一声怒吼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His face was red with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气得满脸通红。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forester stared at his car, trembling with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 福里斯特盯着他的汽车﹐气得浑身发抖。

GramExa.GLOSS: as angry as a person can possibly be
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Animal rights supporters were incandescent with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物权利保护者怒不可遏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

Sense.DEF: to be very popular or fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: DiCaprio became all the rage after starring in the film ‘Titanic’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪卡普里奥主演了电影《泰坦尼克号》之后迅速走红。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is very popular or fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rage for mobile phones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移动电话的流行

Sense.DEF: to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sorry he had raged at her earlier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后悔之前对她发了火。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was I to know!’ Jenny raged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我怎么会知道！”珍妮怒道。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a battle, a disagreement, or a storm rages, it continues with great violence or strong emotions
Sense.TRAN: 〔战斗﹑争论〕激烈进行﹔〔暴风雨〕肆虐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Civil war has been raging in the country for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国内战已持续多年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A debate is raging about what form pensions should take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于养老金应采用何种形式﹐正在进行一场激辩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside, a storm was raging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋外﹐暴风雨肆虐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The battle raged on continued .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗仍在激烈进行。

Sense.DEF: if a fire or illness rages, it spreads fast and is hard to control
Sense.TRAN: 〔火灾或疾病〕迅速蔓延﹐快速扩散
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire raged for twelve hours and fifteen people died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火肆虐了12个小时﹐造成15人死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great cholera epidemic raged across Europe in 1831.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1831 年欧洲各地霍乱肆虐。

Sense.DEF: to have fun with a group of people in a wild and uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We couldn’t wait to go out and rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等不及要出去狂欢。

Sense.DEF: when someone becomes extremely angry and violent while they are driving, on a plane etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was attacked in a road-rage incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一宗公路暴怒事件中遭到袭击。

Sense.DEF: a form of popular music from the West Indies
Sense.TRAN: 雷戈乐〔西印度群岛的一种流行音乐〕

Sense.DEF: torn and in bad condition

Sense.EXAMPLE: a raggedy hat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶破旧的帽子

Sense.DEF: wearing clothes that are old and torn

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群群破衣烂衫的孩子在岩石间玩耍。

Sense.DEF: having a rough uneven edge or surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔边缘〕参差不齐的﹔〔表面〕凹凸不平的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张旧相片的边缘有点磨破了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ragged hole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边缘粗糙的洞
Sense.EXAMPLE: raggedy hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参差不齐的头发

Sense.DEF: not regular or together

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群中发出了零零落落的欢呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ragged breathing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不均匀的呼吸

Sense.DEF: tired after using a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked ragged, so I told him to go to bed.

Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran United’s defence ragged made them do a lot of work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让联队的防守队员疲于奔命。

Sense.DEF: to be feeling very tired or upset

RunOn.EXAMPLE: raggedly dressed

Sense.DEF: very great and hard to control

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极强的食欲
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in a raging temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常愤怒。

Sense.DEF: continuing strongly and showing no signs of ending

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的辩论
Sense.EXAMPLE: raging inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断加剧的通货膨胀
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was a raging success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目获得了巨大的成功。

Sense.DEF: a raging headache etc is very painful

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德头痛得厉害﹐不得不躺下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raging fever a very high body temperature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高烧

Sense.DEF: continuing or moving with great natural force
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raging storm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风暴雨
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raging sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汹涌的大海

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火熊熊燃烧起来。

Sense.TRAN: 〔外套﹑毛衣等衣袖〕连肩的﹐插肩的

Sense.DEF: a mixture of vegetables and meat boiled together
a rags-to-riches story is about someone who becomes very rich after starting life very poor
Sense.TRAN: 从赤贫到巨富的﹐从一贫如洗到家财万贯的

Sense.DEF: a ragtag group is not tidy or properly organized

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织散漫的战斗部队

Sense.DEF: a type of music and dancing that has a strong beat and was popular in the US in the early part of the 20th century

Sense.DEF: the business of making and selling clothes, especially women’s clothes

a North American plant that produces a substance which causes

Sense.DEF: a common plant with yellow flowers, and leaves with uneven edges

Sense.DEF: a style of Algerian popular music
Sense.TRAN: 拉埃乐〔一种阿尔及利亚的流行音乐〕

Sense.DEF: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bombing raid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸
Sense.EXAMPLE: an air raid warning siren
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空袭警报

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The colonel led a successful raid against a rebel base.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上校成功指挥了对叛军基地的一次袭击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The army launched several cross-border raids last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚军队发动了数次越境袭击。

Sense.DEF: a surprise visit made to a place by the police to search for something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police raid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的突击搜查
Sense.EXAMPLE: an FBI raid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国联邦调查局的突击搜查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Four people were arrested during a raid on a house in London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方突击搜查了伦敦的一所房子﹐逮捕四人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a dawn raid one made very early in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拂晓搜查

Sense.DEF: an attack by criminals on a building where they believe they can steal money or drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bank raid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行抢劫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an armed raid on a shop in Glasgow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对格拉斯哥一家商店的持枪抢劫

Sense.DEF:
an attempt by a company to buy enough
share s
in another company to take control of it
Sense.TRAN: 突袭收购〔指为控制某公司而大量购入其股票〕

Sense.DEF: if police raid a place, they make a surprise visit to search for something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police found weapons when they raided his home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方突击搜查他家时发现了武器。

Sense.DEF: to make a sudden military attack on a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: air bases on the mainland from which the island could be raided
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以对该岛发动袭击的本土空军基地

GramExa.GLOSS: a group taking part in an attack

Sense.DEF: to go into a place and steal things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gang raided three homes in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪团伙洗劫了这个地区的三户人家。

Sense.DEF: to go to a place that has supplies of food or drink and take some because you are hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter went into the kitchen to raid the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得走进厨房扫荡冰箱。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes into a place and steals things
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armed raider
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装抢劫者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Masked raiders carried out a bank robbery today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天有蒙面劫匪抢劫了一家银行。

Sense.DEF: the railway system
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American rail system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国铁路系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-speed rail network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个高速铁路网络
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passengers want a better rail service .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We continued our journey by rail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘火车继续旅行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to buy a rail ticket .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要买一张火车票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheap rail fares
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 便宜的火车票价

Sense.DEF: one of the two long metal tracks fastened to the ground that trains move along
a bar that is fastened along or around something, especially to stop you from going somewhere or from falling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several passengers were leaning against the ship’s rail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名乘客斜靠在轮船的栏杆上。

Sense.DEF: a bar that you use to hang things on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a towel rail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛巾杆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a curtain rail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘杆

Sense.DEF: to start behaving in a strange or socially unacceptable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 17 he suddenly went off the rails and started stealing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17 岁那年﹐他突然走上歪路﹐开始偷窃。

Sense.DEF: happening or functioning normally again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coach was credited with putting the team back on the rails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队能重回正轨﹐是教练的功劳。

PIC.HEADING: RAILS 横杆﹔栏杆﹔铁路路轨
PIC.PICCONTENT: curtain rail 窗帘杆；towel rail 毛巾杆；handrail 扶手；picture rail 挂画的横杆；railway line BrE【英】/railroad track AmE【美】铁路路轨；guardrail AmE【美】/crash barrier BrE【英】防撞护栏

Sense.DEF: to enclose or separate an area with rails

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police railed off the area where the accident happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察用围栏把事故现场隔开。

Sense.DEF: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Consumers rail against the way companies fix prices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者谴责公司的定价方式。

Sense.DEF: the end of a railway line
a metal fence that is made of a series of upright bars
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small park surrounded by railings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 围有栏杆的小公园

Sense.DEF: one of the bars in some railings
friendly joking about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: affectionate raillery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲切的玩笑

Sense.DEF: a railway or the railway
Sense.EXAMPLE: The supplies were sent on the railroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补给经由铁路运送。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a railroad station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车站

Sense.DEF: to force or persuade someone to do something without giving them enough time to think about it
Sense.TRAN: 迫使[劝服]〔某人〕仓促行事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The workers were railroaded into signing the agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们被迫匆匆签下这个协议。

Sense.DEF:
a
level crossing
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路和铁路的〕平交道口﹐平面交叉点

Sense.DEF: a path that used to be a railway track but that has been covered with a hard surface for people to walk, run, or ride bicycles on
Sense.TRAN: 铁轨路〔在旧铁路上铺设硬路面以便步行或骑车通行的路〕

Sense.DEF: a system of tracks along which trains run, or a system of trains
Sense.EXAMPLE: a railway company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路公司

Sense.DEF: the two metal tracks fixed to the ground that trains move along
a part of the railway system that connects two places
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old disused railway line
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废弃的旧铁路

Sense.DEF: someone who works on a train or railway
a place where trains stop for passengers to get on and off
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you outside the main railway station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在火车总站外面接你。

Sense.DEF: clothes
water that falls in small drops from clouds in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: a night of wind and rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风雨交加的夜晚
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be heavy rain in most parts of the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国大部分地区将有大雨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left my bicycle out in the rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把自行车放在外边雨地里了。

Sense.DEF: heavy rain that falls during a particular period in the year in tropical countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year, the rains came on time in April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年﹐雨季在4月准时到来。

Sense.DEF: a large number of things falling or moving through the air together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The archers sent a rain of arrows towards the enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弓箭手的箭如雨点般飞向敌人。

Sense.DEF: whatever happens or whatever the weather is like
Sense.TRAN: 在任何情况下﹔不论天气好坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. We’ll be there - rain or shine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我们会去的——风雨无阻。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a lot of water coming down
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rain became more heavy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得更大了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with little water coming down
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A light rain began to fall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始下起了小雨。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very heavy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I woke to the sound of torrential rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在滂沱大雨声中醒来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very heavy rain
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He left us standing in the pouring rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我们站在倾盆大雨里不管了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: heavy rain that is falling fast or being blown along
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They struggled to walk against driving rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们顶着狂风暴雨艰难前行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely cold rain
very gentle rain
which contains pollution from factories

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rain was still falling steadily.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨依然下个不停。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it falls
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If the rain starts coming down, we can always go inside.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是下雨了，我们总还可以进屋去。
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The monsoon rain comes down in sheets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 季风雨瓢泼而下。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They went into a cafe and waited for the rain to stop.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走进一家咖啡馆等雨停。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it starts to rain less
a lot of rain comes down
it falls or hits something with a lot of force
drops of rain hit something and make a sound
be outside when it starts raining
a lot of rain is falling
Collocate.EXAMPLE: When we went outside it was pouring with rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出门时大雨倾盆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: rain appears likely because there are dark clouds in the sky
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We ate indoors because it looked like rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在室内吃饭﹐因为天看上去要下雨了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Robert felt a drop of rain on his face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特觉得有一滴雨落在脸上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Two inches of rain fell in twelve hours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 12小时雨量为两英寸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: short periods of rain – used in weather forecasts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Outbreaks of rain will spread across northern parts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阵雨将覆盖北部地区。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a short period of rain
large moving masses of heavy rain

Exponent.DEF: water that falls in small drops from clouds in the sky
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rain has stopped at last.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨终于停了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There had been heavy rain during the night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上下了倾盆大雨。

Exponent.DEF: light rain with very small drops of water
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A light drizzle was falling as I left the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走出屋子时正下着毛毛细雨。

Exponent.DEF: a short period of rain that can be heavy or light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More heavy showers are forecast for tonight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 预报今晚还会有阵雨。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a light shower of rain
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵小雨

Exponent.DEF: a short period of very heavy rain that starts suddenly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A sudden downpour sent us running for shelter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然下起倾盆大雨﹐我们只得跑着去躲雨。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a torrential downpour
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 倾盆大雨

Exponent.DEF:
frozen rain that falls in the form of
hailstone s small balls of ice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hail and high winds have destroyed many of the county’s crops.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰雹和狂风毁坏了该县大量庄稼。

Exponent.DEF: a mixture of snow and rain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rain had turned to sleet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨变成了雨夹雪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sleet and snow fell.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下起了雨夹雪和雪。

Exponent.DEF: heavy rain that falls during a particular period in the year in tropical countries
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The farmers are waiting for the rains to come.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民在等待雨季来临。

Exponent.DEF: the heavy rain that falls between April and October in India and other southern Asian countries
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The monsoon is late this year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年季风雨来晚了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the monsoon season
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨季

Sense.DEF: if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside it was still raining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面仍在下雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s starting to rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始下雨了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must have rained quite hard last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚一定下了很大的雨。

GramExa.GLOSS: it is raining very hard

Sense.DEF: if you rain blows onto someone, you hit them many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: She attacked the man, raining blows on his head and shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对那个男人大打出手﹐拳头雨点般落在他头上和肩上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it never rains but it pours
Sense.DEF: used to say that as soon as one thing goes wrong, a lot of other things go wrong as well

Exponent.DEF: drops of water are falling from the sky
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s raining – you’d better take an umbrella.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在下雨呢——你最好带把伞。

Exponent.DEF: it is raining very heavily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We stayed at home because it was pouring down all day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们待在家里﹐因为倾盆大雨下了一整天。

Exponent.DEF: it is raining very heavily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Outside it was chucking it down and the streets were deserted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 室外大雨如注﹐街上空无一人。

Exponent.DEF: very gentle rain is falling
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s only drizzling – let’s go for a walk anyway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只是在下毛毛雨﹐我们还是去散步吧。

Exponent.DEF: frozen rain in the form of small balls of ice are falling
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been hailing and the roads were still slippery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直在下冰雹﹐道路还很滑。

Sense.DEF: to fall in large quantities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bombs rained down on the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹如雨点般落向这座城市。

Sense.DEF: if an event or activity is rained off or rained out, it has to stop because there is too much rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match was rained off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛因为下雨而中断。

Sense.DEF: a large curve of different colours that can appear in the sky when there is both sun and rain
used to say that you will do something in the future but not now
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Care for a drink?’ ‘I’ll take a rain check, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想喝一杯吗？”“下次吧﹐谢谢。”

Sense.DEF: a ticket for an outdoor event, such as a sports game, that you can use again if it rains and the action stops
Sense.TRAN: 〔户外体育比赛等活动因雨改期再次举办时〕可再次使用的票根

Sense.DEF: a coat that you wear to protect yourself from rain
a single drop of rain
the amount of rain that falls on an area in a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had a long period of low rainfall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已有很长一段时间雨量偏低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city has received only half its average rainfall of four inches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市目前的降雨只有往常四英寸平均雨量的一半。

Sense.DEF: a tropical forest with tall trees that are very close together, growing in an area where it rains a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: the destruction of the rain forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带雨林的破坏

Sense.DEF: an instrument that is used for measuring the amount of rain that falls somewhere
able to keep rain out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rainproof jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防雨短上衣

Sense.DEF: a sudden heavy fall of rain
water that has fallen as rain
a rainy period of time is one when it rains a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold rainy day in October
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十月里一个寒冷的雨天
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate rainy weather .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌雨天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rainy season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨季

Sense.LEXUNIT: save sth for a rainy day
Sense.DEF: to save something, especially money, for a time when you will need it
Sense.TRAN: 留着某物以备不时之需〔尤指钱〕﹔未雨绸缪

Sense.DEF: to move or lift something to a higher position, place, or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you raise the lamp so I can see?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把灯举高点好让我看清吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: William raised his hat and smiled at her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉抬一抬帽子﹐朝她笑了笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raise your hand if you know the right answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道正确答案的话﹐请举手。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say lift something up rather than raise something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐人们一般说 lift something up﹐而不说 raise something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can you lift up the lamp a bit?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 把灯抬起一点好吗？
F2NBox.EXPL: British English speakers usually say put up your hand rather than raise your hand .
F2NBox.TRAN: 讲英国英语的人一般说 put up your hand﹐而不说 raise your hand
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Put your hand up if you know the right answer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道正确答案的话﹐请举手。

Sense.DEF: to increase an amount, number, or level
Sense.TRAN: 增加﹐提高〔数量﹑数字或水平〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many shops have raised their prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多商店都提价了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The university is working to raise the number of students from state schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学正在努力增加公立学校学生的入学人数。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to raise awareness of meningitis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增强脑膜炎防治意识的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Hayward intends to raise the museum’s profile make it more well-known .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海沃德博士想提高博物馆的知名度。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say put up an amount, a price etc rather than raise it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐提高数量﹑价格等人们一般用 put﹐而不用 raise
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They’ve put the price of fuel up again.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们再次调高了油价。

Sense.DEF: to collect money that you can use to do a particular job or help people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Trust hopes to raise $1 million to buy land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家信托机构希望能筹集到一百万美元购置土地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are raising funds to help needy youngsters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在筹款帮助贫困青少年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a concert to raise money for charity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筹募善款的音乐会

Sense.DEF: to improve the quality or standard of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Changing the law cannot raise standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修改法律并不能提高道德标准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team need to raise their game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队需要提高球技。

Sense.DEF: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not raise the subject again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他再也没有提起这个话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想提一提宣传问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题﹐就是将由谁来负责。

Sense.DEF: to cause a particular emotion or reaction
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐激起〔某种情感或反应〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This attack raises fears of increased violence against foreigners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次袭击使人们对针对外国人的暴力事件日渐增多感到担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way the research was carried out raises doubts about the results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究的操作方式令人们对研究结果产生怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to move your eyes, head, or face so that you are looking up
Sense.EXAMPLE: Albert raised his eyes and stared at Ruth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伯特抬起眼睛盯着露丝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No,’ he said without raising his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不。”他头也不抬地说道。

Sense.DEF: to move or lift yourself into an upright position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Adele raised herself from the pillows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿黛尔从一堆枕头中直起身子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He raised himself up on one elbow to watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用一只胳膊肘支起身来看。

Sense.DEF: to look after your children and help them grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stan’s dad died, leaving his mother to raise three sons alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦的父亲去世了﹐留下他母亲独自抚养三个儿子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was time for Dean to settle down and raise a family .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是迪安安顿下来生儿育女的时候了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne married a Jew, despite being raised a Catholic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮在天主教家庭长大﹐但她嫁给了一个犹太人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new generation was the first to be raised on processed food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新成长起来的这一代人是第一批吃加工食品长大的一代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Camus was born and raised in Algeria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加缪在阿尔及利亚出生并长大。

Sense.DEF: to look after animals or grow plants so that they can be sold or used as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised cattle in Nebraska when he was young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时在内布拉斯加州养过牛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim retired to raise raspberries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆退休后种植山莓。

Sense.DEF: to collect together a large group of people, especially soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels quickly raised an army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子很快就召集起一支人马。

Sense.DEF: to smile when you are not feeling happy, or to make someone smile when they are not feeling happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t raise a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我笑不出来。

Sense.DEF:
to show surprise, doubt, disapproval etc by moving your
eyebrow s
upwards
Sense.TRAN: 扬起眉毛〔表示吃惊﹑怀疑﹑反对等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blanche raised her eyebrows in surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布兰奇吃惊地扬起眉毛。

Sense.DEF: if something raises eyebrows, it surprises people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band’s new sound will raise some eyebrows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队的新曲风将令一些人吃惊。

Sense.DEF: to speak loudly or shout because you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never raised his voice to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不会冲着我嚷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear raised voices in the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以听到隔壁房间有人在大声嚷嚷。

Sense.DEF: to celebrate someone’s happiness or success by holding up your glass and drinking from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ladies and gentlemen, will you raise your glasses to the bride and groom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女士们﹑先生们﹐请大家举杯祝贺新娘和新郎。

Sense.DEF: to warn people about a danger so that they can take action
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam stayed with his injured friend while a passing motorist raised the alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆陪着他受伤的朋友﹐一名过路司机则发出了警报。

Sense.DEF: to make people feel afraid that something frightening might soon happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The violence has raised the spectre of civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力事件引起了人们对内战的恐慌。

Sense.DEF: if a question or problem raises its head, it appears and has to be dealt with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another problem then raised its ugly head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 之后又有一个问题出现了。

Sense.DEF: to do, produce, or be something better than anyone has done or produced before, so that other people then feel they have to do better themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has raised the bar for other filmmakers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为其他电影制作人树立了更高的标准。

Sense.DEF:
to make a higher
bid
than an opponent in a card game
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll raise you $100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我加你100美元。

Sense.DEF: to complain in a very angry way about something you think is not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll raise hell with whoever is responsible for this mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管是谁惹下这麻烦﹐我都跟他没完。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a wild, noisy way that upsets other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids next door were raising hell last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁那些孩子昨天夜里闹翻天了。

Sense.DEF: to make a very loud noise when singing, celebrating etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在唱歌﹑欢庆作乐等时〕高声喧闹

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone on a piece of radio equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: They finally managed to raise him at Miller’s sheep farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于通过无线电在米勒的养羊场联系到他。

Sense.DEF: to wake someone who is difficult to wake
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try as he might he could not raise her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想尽办法﹐仍然无法唤醒她。

Sense.DEF: to make someone who has died live again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesus raised Lazarus from the grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣使拉撒路死而复生。

Sense.DEF: to allow goods to go in and out of a place again after they have been stopped by force or by a law

to build something such as a
monument

Sense.LEXUNIT: raise 2/4/10 etc to the power of 2/3/4 etc
Sense.DEF: to multiply a number by itself a particular number of times
Sense.EXAMPLE: 2 raised to the power of 3 is 8.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2 的三次方是8。

Sense.DEF: an increase in the money you earn
higher than the surrounding area or surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raised platform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凸起的平台

Sense.DEF:
a dried
grape
the reason why something exists, why someone does something etc
Sense.TRAN: 存在的理由﹔做某事的目的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Commerce was the town’s raison d’être.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业就是这个镇存在的理由。

Sense.DEF: the king or ruler of an Indian state
a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a garden rake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 园艺耙

Sense.DEF: a man who has many sexual relationships, drinks too much alcohol etc
the angle of a slope
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rake of the stage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞台的坡度

Sense.DEF: to move a rake across a surface in order to make the soil level, gather dead leaves etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She raked the soil over to loosen the weeds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用耙子翻土﹐把杂草弄松。

Sense.DEF: to search a place very carefully for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been raking through my drawers looking for those tickets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在翻抽屉找那些票。

Sense.DEF: to point something such as a gun, camera, or strong light, and keep moving it across an area
Sense.TRAN: 〔用枪﹑照相机﹑强光等〕扫射﹐横扫
Sense.EXAMPLE: The searchlight raked the open ground around the prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 探照灯在监狱周围的空地上来回扫射。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They raked the room with gunfire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开枪扫射房间。

Sense.DEF:
to push a stick backwards and forwards in a fire in order to remove
ash es
to keep talking about something that happened in the past that people would prefer you not to mention
Sense.TRAN: 重提〔别人不愿提起的〕往事

Sense.DEF: to pull your fingers through something or across a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken raked his fingers through his hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯用手指拢头发。

Sense.DEF: to earn a lot of money without trying very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lou’s been raking in the dollars since he opened his business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从生意开张以来﹐洛乌就财源滚滚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If someone opened a burger bar, they’d really rake it in .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果谁开一家汉堡包店﹐一定会发大财的。

Sense.DEF: to talk about something from the past that people would prefer you not to mention
Sense.TRAN: 重提﹐翻出〔别人不愿提起的往事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It upsets Dad when that story is raked up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重提那件事父亲会难过。

Sense.DEF: to collect things or people together for a purpose, but with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: They could only rake up $300.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只能凑到300美元。

Sense.DEF: a dishonest share of profits
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taxi driver gets a rake-off from the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个出租车司机从宾馆拿回扣。

Sense.DEF: if a man looks rakish, or wears rakish clothes, he dresses nicely and looks confident and relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rakish uniform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帅气的制服

Sense.DEF: if you wear a hat at a rakish angle, you do not wear it straight, and this makes you look relaxed and confident
a rakish man has a lot of sexual relationships, wastes money, and drinks too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 放荡挥霍的﹐纵情酒色的

Sense.DEF: a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc
Sense.TRAN: 大型公众集会〔尤指为支持某政治观点﹑抗议等在户外举行的集会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: About 1,000 people attended the rally in Hyde Park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有1,000人参加了海德公园的集会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to hold a rally to put pressure on the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定举行集会来对政府施压。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mass rally large rally in support of the pay claim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持加薪要求的大型集会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was shot dead while addressing an election rally.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一个竞选集会上发表演讲时中枪身亡。

Sense.DEF: a car race on public roads
Sense.TRAN: 汽车拉力赛﹐公路汽车赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rally driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车拉力赛选手

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something, especially the value of shares, becomes stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a late rally in the Tokyo stock market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近东京股市的回暖

Sense.DEF: a continuous series of hits of the ball between players in a game such as tennis
to come together, or to bring people together, to support an idea, a political party etc
Sense.TRAN: 集合﹔召集〔以支持某个观点﹑政党等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fellow Republicans rallied to the President’s defense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党党员都团结起来支持总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Surely the local business community could have rallied to raise the cash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐当地的商界是可以联合起来筹集这笔款项的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to rally support for the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为政党争取支持的努力

Sense.DEF: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然开局不顺﹐但他振作精神﹐最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people rally round, they all try to help you when you are in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 齐心协力帮助（处于困境的人）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her friends all rallied round when she was ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她患病期间﹐朋友们都来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase used to unite people in support of an idea
Sense.TRAN: 口号〔用于团结众人支持某观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Land and Liberty’ was the rallying cry of revolutionary Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “土地和自由”是墨西哥革命的口号。

Sense.DEF: an idea, event, person etc that makes people come together to support something they believe in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rallying point for the struggle against apartheid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对种族隔离制度的号召者

Sense.DEF: to run or drive into something very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the latest raid, thieves used his van to ram a police car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最近一宗劫案中﹐窃贼开着他的小型货车猛撞一辆警车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lost control of his truck and rammed into a van, killing two people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的卡车失控﹐撞上一辆小型货车﹐撞死了两个人。

Sense.DEF: to push something into a position, using great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: First, you’ll have to ram the posts into the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐你必须把桩打进地里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I rammed my foot down on the brake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猛踩刹车。

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone accept an idea or opinion by repeating it many times, especially when they are not interested
Sense.TRAN: 向某人反复灌输某事〔尤指某人不感兴趣的观点或意见〕

Sense.DEF: to make sure someone fully understands something by emphasizing it and by providing a lot of examples, proof etc
Sense.TRAN: 一再强调某事﹐充分说明某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police video ramming home the dangers of driving fast in fog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一再强调在雾中开快车危险的警方录像带

Sense.DEF: an adult male sheep

a
battering ram
a machine that hits something again and again to force it into a position
the part of a computer that acts as a temporary store for information so that it can be used immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: a model with 128 MB of RAM
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个RAM内存为128兆字节的型号

Sense.DEF: the ninth month of the Muslim year, during which Muslims do not eat or drink anything during the day while it is light
Sense.TRAN: 斋月〔伊斯兰历的第九个月﹐教徒从日出到日落期间禁饮食〕

Sense.DEF: to talk for a long time in a way that does not seem clearly organized, so that other people find it difficult to understand you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s getting old and she tends to ramble a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上年纪了﹐说话有点颠三倒四的。

Sense.DEF: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty to discover as you ramble around this little island.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫步这个小岛﹐你会有很多新发现。

Sense.DEF: a plant that rambles grows in all directions
to talk or write for a long time in a way that other people find boring

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father kept rambling on about the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲一直在喋喋不休地谈论那场战争。

Sense.DEF: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得找个周末去乡下走走这个主意不错。

Sense.DEF: a speech or piece of writing that is very long and does not seem to be clearly organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a ten-page ramble, Barre explains why he wrote the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴雷用了十页的篇幅东拉西扯地讲他为什么要写这本书。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes for walks in the countryside for pleasure
a plant, especially a rose, that grows in all directions
a rambling building has an irregular shape and covers a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rambling old farmhouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格局凌乱的旧农舍

Sense.DEF: rambling speech or writing is very long and does not seem to have any clear organization or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话或文章〕杂乱无章的﹐漫无边际的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long rambling letter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一封东拉西扯的长信

Sense.DEF: the activity of going for walks in the countryside for pleasure
speech or writing that goes on for a long time and does not seem to have any clear organization or purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to listen to their mad ramblings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝听他们疯狂的胡言乱语。

Sense.DEF: a character played by Sylvester Stallone in several US films, called First Blood, Rambo: First Blood II etc. Rambo was a strong, very violent soldier who fought against the US’s enemies. His name is often used to describe anyone who thinks fighting and violence are the only ways of settling disagreements.
Sense.TRAN: 兰博〔西尔维斯特·史泰龙在《第一滴血》﹑《第一滴血续集》等多部美国影片中扮演的一名勇猛好斗的军人﹐常用于形容那些认为打斗与暴力是解决争端唯一方法的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several European politicians condemned America’s Rambo-style approach to Saddam Hussein.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数位欧洲政治家谴责美国对付萨达姆·侯赛因所采用的兰博式以暴制暴的方法。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Ramboesque violence

Sense.DEF: noisy, full of energy, and behaving in a way that cannot be controlled
Sense.TRAN: 爱吵闹的﹔喧闹的﹔不受管束的
Sense.EXAMPLE: three rambunctious kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个爱吵闹的孩子

Sense.DEF: a small dish in which food for one person can be baked and served
an additional result of something you do, which may not have been clear when you first decided to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agreement which was to have significant ramifications for British politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来对英国政治产生重大影响的一个协议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the practical ramifications of taking on a new job
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事新工作产生的实际影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the environmental ramifications of the road-building program
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 筑路工程对环境的影响

Sense.DEF: a slope that has been built to connect two places that are at different levels
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ramps are needed at exits and entrances for wheelchair users.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出入口处需有坡道供坐轮椅者使用。

Sense.DEF: a road for driving onto or off a large main road
Sense.TRAN: 〔进出主干道的〕支路﹐岔道﹐匝道
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the Lake Drive ramp at Charles Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到查尔斯街时上湖滨大道支路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They missed the off-ramp to Manhattan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们错过了去曼哈顿的出口匝道。

Sense.DEF:
to try to persuade people that a company’s
share s
are worth more than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: To ramp up a share price during a takeover bid is unacceptable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在要约收购期间抬高股价是不可接受的。

Sense.DEF: if a company ramps up an activity, it increases it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Producers can quickly ramp up production.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厂商可以迅速增加产量。

Sense.DEF: to rush about in groups, acting in a wild or violent way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drunken football fans rampaged through the streets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝醉酒的足球迷在街上横冲直撞。

Sense.DEF: rushing about in a wild and violent way, often causing damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: gangs of youths on the rampage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一伙伙横冲直撞的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioters went on the rampage through the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒在镇上横冲直撞。

Sense.DEF: if something bad, such as crime or disease, is rampant, there is a lot of it and it is very difficult to control
Sense.TRAN: 〔犯罪﹑疾病等〕猖獗的﹐泛滥的﹐失控的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pickpocketing is rampant in the downtown area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闹市区扒窃活动猖獗。
失控的通货膨胀

Sense.DEF: a plant that is rampant grows and spreads quickly, in a way that is difficult to control
a wide pile of earth or a stone wall built to protect a castle or city in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时城堡或城市周围的〕护城墙﹐土垒

Sense.DEF: the crime of driving car into a shop window in order to steal goods from the shop

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a ram-raid on a jeweller’s shop

Sense.DEF: sitting or standing with your back straight and your body stiff

a stick for cleaning a gun or pushing
gunpowder
into an old-fashioned gun
a ramshackle building or vehicle is in bad condition and in need of repair
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或汽车〕破败的﹐破烂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ramshackle old cottage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢摇摇欲坠的旧村舍

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
run
a very large farm in the western US and Canada where sheep, cattle, or horses are bred
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国西部和加拿大的〕大牧场

Sense.DEF:
a
ranch house
someone who owns or works on a ranch
a house built on one level, usually with a roof that does not slope very much
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般屋顶坡度不大的〕平房﹐牧场式住宅

Sense.DEF: a house on a ranch in which the rancher lives
the activity or business of operating a ranch
Sense.EXAMPLE: cattle ranching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧牛场的经营

Sense.DEF: oily or fatty food that is rancid smells or tastes unpleasant because it is no longer fresh
Sense.EXAMPLE: rancid butter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变质黄油

Sense.DEF: a feeling of hatred and anger towards someone you cannot forgive because they harmed you in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spoke openly about the war without a trace of rancour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不带丝毫怨恨地坦然谈论这场战争。

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in South Africa
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few random shots were fired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡乱放了几枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We looked at a random sample of 120 families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们研究了随机抽样的120个家庭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a random selection of women who were in the shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对店内女性的随机选择

Sense.DEF: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gang picked their victims at random.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: seven randomly chosen numbers

Sense.DEF: to choose things in a way that is not carefully controlled or planned in order to do a scientific test
Sense.TRAN: 〔为进行科学实验而〕随机选择
Sense.EXAMPLE: The numbers have been randomized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字是随机选择的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a randomized trial of a new drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新药的随机试验

Sense.DEF: full of sexual desire
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was feeling very randy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到强烈的性冲动。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
ring
a number of people or things that are all different, but are all of the same general type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a range of services
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列服务
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug is effective against a range of bacteria.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药对一系列细菌有效。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: students from a wide range of backgrounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背景各不相同的学生
GramExa.EXAMPLE: advice on a whole range of subjects
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对各类科目的建议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fairly narrow range of people are responsible for key decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数人负责重大决定。

Sense.DEF: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: toys suitable for children in the pre-school age range
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合学龄前儿童的玩具

Sense.EXAMPLE: a temperature range of 72-85˚
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your blood pressure’s well within the normal range.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的血压完全在正常范围内。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the range (of) sth to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a salary in the range of $25,000 to $30,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 处于2.5万美元到3万美元之间的薪水

Sense.EXAMPLE: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range too expensive for us .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

Sense.DEF: a set of similar products made by a particular company or available in a particular shop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new range of kitchenware
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的系列厨具
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A company from Darlington has just launched its latest range of fashion jewellery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达灵顿的一家公司刚刚推出了他们最新的时尚珠宝系列。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The watches in this range are priced at £24.50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系列手表的价格是24.50英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a very large product range .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的产品范围很广。

Subsense.DEF: the distance over which a particular weapon can hit things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: missiles with a range of 3,000 km
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 射程为3,000公里的导弹

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We waited until the enemy was within range.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等到敌人进入我们的射程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ducked down to get out of range of the gunshots.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我俯身躲开子弹。

GramExa.GLOSS: from very close
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both men had been shot at point-blank range.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个人都是被近距离射杀的。

Subsense.DEF: the distance within which something can be seen or heard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a handsome man who drew admiring glances from any female within range
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引周围每一个女性投来赞赏目光的英俊男子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: any spot within range of your radio signal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你的无线电信号范围内的任何地点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joan hoped that the others were out of range of her mother’s voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼希望其他人听不到她母亲的话。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: One way to see birds at close range is to attract them into your own garden.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近距离看鸟的一个办法是吸引它们到你的花园里来。

Subsense.DEF:
the distance which a vehicle such as an aircraft can travel before it needs more
fuel
etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔飞机等交通工具的〕续航里程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane has a range of 3,600 miles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机的续航里程是3,600英里。

Sense.DEF: all the musical notes that a particular singer or musical instrument can make
Sense.EXAMPLE: His vocal range is amazing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音域令人惊叹。

Sense.DEF: a group of mountains or hills, usually in a line
Sense.EXAMPLE: a land of high mountain ranges and deep valleys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片有高山深谷的土地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the longest range of hills in the Lake District
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖区最长的山脉

Sense.DEF: an area of land where you can practise shooting or where weapons can be tested
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rifle range
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步枪射击场
Sense.EXAMPLE: the police shooting range
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警用靶场

Sense.DEF: the number of different things that someone, especially an actor or actress, does well
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actor of extraordinary range and intensity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏路之宽﹑入戏之深均非同一般的演员

Sense.DEF: a large area of land covered with grass, on which cattle are kept

Subsense.DEF:
a
cooker
a large piece of kitchen equipment in which you make a fire and use this heat to cook food
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a coal-fired kitchen range
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧煤炭的炉灶

Subsense.DEF: to include a variety of different things or people in addition to those mentioned
Subsense.TRAN: 包括〔各种不同的人或物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The show had a massive audience, ranging from children to grandparents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目拥有庞大的观众群﹐从小孩子到爷爷奶奶都爱看。

Subsense.DEF: if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between
Subsense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑水平﹑温度等〕在某范围内变化〔包括上下限〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有120名学生﹐年龄在10至18岁之间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The population of these cities ranges between 3 and 5 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些城市的人口在300万到500万之间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shoes range in price from $25 to $100.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鞋的价格从25美元至100美元不等。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a wide range of subjects or ideas in a book, speech, conversation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在书籍﹑演讲﹑交谈等中〕涉及﹐涵盖〔大量话题或想法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conversation had ranged over a variety of topics, from sport to current affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话内容广泛﹐从体育运动到时事都有涉及。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The discussion ranged widely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨论涉及的内容很广。

Sense.DEF: to move around in an area without aiming for a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cattle ranged over the pastures in search of food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛群在牧场里四下觅食。

Sense.DEF: to publicly state your agreement with, or opposition to, a particular group’s beliefs and ideas
Sense.TRAN: 公开赞同/反对某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: individuals who had ranged themselves against the authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公开反对当局的人

Sense.DEF: to put things in a particular order or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the dining room, team photographs were ranged along the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐厅里﹐球队的照片排列在墙上。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after a forest or area of countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a park ranger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园管理员

Sense.DEF: a girl who belongs to a part of the Guide Association in Britain, for girls between the ages of 14 and 19
with long thin strong legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, rangy boy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个长腿高个男孩

Sense.DEF: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: officers below the rank of Colonel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上校军衔以下的军官
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He held had the rank of Chief Inspector.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的警衔是总督察。

GramExa.PROPFORM: rise to/be promoted to/attain the rank of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the war Harold had risen to the rank of major.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间哈罗德晋升为少校。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an officer of junior rank
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低级军阶军官

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sentenced to prison and stripped of his rank had his rank taken from him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判入狱﹐并且被剥夺了军衔。

Subsense.DEF: the people who belong to a particular organization or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were splits in the party ranks on this issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上党内成员意见不一。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Democrats now face opposition from within their own ranks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党现在面临党内成员的反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most are recruited from the ranks of people who studied Latin and Greek at university.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 招来的人大多在大学里修读过拉丁文和希腊语。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That summer I left school and joined the ranks of became one of the unemployed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那年夏天﹐我从学校毕业﹐加入了失业者的行列。

Subsense.DEF: all the members of the army, navy etc who are not officers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He rose from the ranks to become a Field Marshal he became an officer after starting as an ordinary soldier .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从普通士兵升到了陆军元帅。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way which is different from other members of a group, especially when they expect your support

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the first to break ranks with Ceausescu and publicly criticise his policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一个和齐奥塞斯库决裂﹐公开批评他的政策。

Sense.DEF: a rank of people or things is a line or row of them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Silently, ranks of police edged closer to the crowds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一队队警察悄无声息地向人群靠近。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone lines up in ranks, all facing the instructor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都一排排站好﹐面朝教练。

GramExa.GLOSS: a lot of things or people in a row
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the shelves were rank after rank of liquor bottles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子上是一排排的酒瓶。

Sense.DEF: to use your authority over someone to make them do what you want, especially unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不公正地〕（对某人）运用权势
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may just have to pull rank and tell them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许就得用你的权威去让他们知道。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which something or someone is of high quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: While none of these pictures is of the first rank of the highest quality , some are of interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管这些都不是一流的照片﹐但有些还是很有趣的。

Sense.DEF: someone’s position in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of all ranks in society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会各阶层的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came from a family of rank one from a high social class .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来自上层家庭。

Sense.DEF: a place where taxis wait in a line to be hired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I called a taxi from the rank outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在外面的出租车站叫了一辆出租车。

Subsense.GRAM: I always + adv/prep, not in progressive
Subsense.DEF: to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today’s match ranks as one of the most exciting games that these two have ever played.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的比赛是双方打得最精彩的比赛之一。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: We rank among the safest countries in the world.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是世界上最安全的国家之一。

GramExa.GLOSS: be of the same importance or quality
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 与…同样重要﹔与…品质相当
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cuvier wanted to turn natural history into a science that would rank with physics and chemistry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 居维叶想把自然史变成和物理化学一样重要的科学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ranked high among the pioneers of 20th century chemical technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是20世纪化学技术先驱中极重要的一位。

Subsense.DEF: to decide the position of someone or something on a list based on quality or importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Agassi was at that time ranked sixth in the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿加西当时排名世界第六。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: It is not always easy to rank the students in order of ability.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把学生按能力排名并非总是容易的。

Sense.DEF: to have a higher rank than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: A general ranks a captain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上将的级别高于上尉。

Sense.DEF: to arrange objects in a line or row
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

Sense.DEF: if something is rank, it has a very strong unpleasant smell

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rank odour of sweat and urine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汗水和尿液的难闻味道

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a bad or undesirable quality
Sense.TRAN: 十足的﹐完全的〔强调质量糟糕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an example of this government’s rank stupidity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本届政府极端愚蠢的实例
Sense.EXAMPLE: They make us look like rank amateurs not at all good or professional .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们使我们看起来像是完完全全的外行。

Sense.DEF: rank plants are too thick and have spread everywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: rank grass and weeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔓生的杂草

Sense.DEF: the ordinary members of an organization rather than the leaders
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rank and file of the party had lost confidence in the leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通党员已对领导层失去了信任。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the rank-and-file members of the trade union

Sense.DEF: a position on a scale that shows how good someone or something is when compared with others
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is now fifth in the world rankings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在世界排名第五。

Sense.DEF: a ranking person has a high, or the highest, position in an organization or is one of the best at an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the panel’s ranking Democrat, William Clay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家小组里的资深民主党党员威廉·克莱
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the ship’s ranking officer the one with the highest rank .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是船上级别最高的船员。

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone or something is on a scale that shows how good they are, or what position they have, compared with other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a top-ranking tennis player
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一流的网球运动员

Sense.DEF: if something rankles, you still remember it angrily because it upset you or annoyed you a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: His comments still rankled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的言论仍令人耿耿于怀。

Sense.DEF: to go through a place, stealing things and causing damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole flat had been ransacked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整间公寓都遭到洗劫。

Sense.DEF: to search a place very thoroughly, often making it untidy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ransacked the wardrobe for something to wear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为了找可以穿的衣服﹐把衣柜翻得乱七八糟。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使被囚者获释而支付的〕赎金
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kidnappers were demanding a ransom of $250,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绑匪索取25万美元的赎金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government refused to pay the ransom .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府拒绝交付赎金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has still been no ransom demand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在还没有人索要赎金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got the ransom money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到了赎金。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone prisoner until money is paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: His daughter was kidnapped and held for ransom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的女儿遭绑架索要赎金。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a situation where they have no choice and are forced to agree to your demands
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has accused the nurses of holding the government to ransom by threatening to strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责护士以罢工来要挟政府。

Sense.DEF: to pay an amount of money so that someone who is being held as a prisoner is set free
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were all ransomed and returned unharmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 付了赎金之后﹐他们都毫发无损地回来了。

Sense.DEF: to talk or complain in a loud excited and rather confused way because you feel strongly about something
Sense.TRAN: 大声激昂地说﹔怒气冲冲地抱怨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was still ranting about the unfairness of it all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍在怒气冲冲地抱怨这件事不公平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you stop ranting and raving for a minute and listen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别大喊大叫的﹐稍停一会儿﹐仔细听好吗？

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a 15-minute rant about the evils of modern society
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对现代社会的种种弊端长达15分钟的愤怒声讨

Sense.DEF: a long speech in which someone complains about something in a loud excited and rather confused way
a type of popular music in which the words of a song are not sung, but spoken in time to music with a steady beat
Sense.TRAN: 说唱乐〔歌词按固定音乐节奏念出的流行音乐〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular rap song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首流行说唱乐歌曲

Sense.DEF: a series of quick sharp hits or knocks
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was woken by a sharp rap on the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被一阵急促的敲门声惊醒。

Sense.DEF: a statement by the police saying that someone is responsible for a serious crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kid’s been cited twice on drunk-driving raps.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个年轻人已经两次因醉酒驾车被传讯了。

Sense.DEF: to be blamed or punished for a mistake or crime, especially unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不公正地〕（因某事）受到责罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bo was left to take the rap for Victor’s murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克托被杀一案最后是让波顶了罪。

Sense.DEF: to avoid being punished for a crime

Subsense.DEF: a punishment or criticism that is not very severe
Subsense.TRAN: 不十分严厉的惩罚[批评]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The New York Post received an official rap over the knuckles for the way it reported the story.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《纽约邮报》因对该事件报道方式不当而受到官方批评。

Subsense.DEF: if someone gives a child a rap on the knuckles, they hit them on the back of their hand as a punishment

Sense.DEF: unfair treatment or punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cleveland always gets a bum rap in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利夫兰总是受到新闻界不公正的对待。

Sense.DEF: to hit or knock something quickly several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rapped the table with her pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用笔笃笃地敲桌子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Angrily she rapped on his window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生气地敲他的窗户。

Sense.DEF: to say the words of a rap song
to criticize someone angrily – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 严厉批评﹐猛烈抨击〔尤用于新闻报道〕
