Sense.EXAMPLE: a film rapped by critics for its excessive violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部因过分渲染暴力而受到评论家严厉抨击的电影

Sense.DEF: to say something loudly, suddenly, and in a way that sounds angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Come on,’ he rapped impatiently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “得了吧。”他不耐烦地厉声说道。

Subsense.DEF: to punish or criticize someone for something, but not very severely
Subsense.TRAN: 〔不十分严厉地〕惩罚[批评]某人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had his knuckles rapped sharply for meddling in foreign policy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因干涉对外政策而受到严厉批评。

Subsense.DEF: to punish a child by hitting them on the back of their hand

Sense.DEF: always wanting more money, goods etc than you need or have a right to
Sense.EXAMPLE: rapacious landlords
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贪婪的房东

Sense.DEF: to force someone to have sex, especially by using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been raped and stabbed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遭到强奸﹐还被刀捅了。

Sense.DEF: the crime of forcing someone to have sex, especially by using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are investigating a series of violent rapes in the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在调查镇上发生的一连串暴力强奸案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested and charged with rape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被捕并被控强奸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always denied that he was guilty of rape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直否认自己犯有强奸罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rape victim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭强奸者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gang rape of a 17-year-old girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一个17岁少女的轮奸
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was convicted of attempted rape .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判犯有强奸未遂罪。

Sense.DEF: a European plant with yellow flowers, grown as animal food and for its oil
the unnecessary destruction of something, especially the environment
Sense.TRAN: 对某物的肆意破坏〔尤指对环境的破坏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: companies which profit from the rape of the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以破坏环境为代价牟利的公司

Sense.DEF: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient made a rapid recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人迅速康复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rapid population growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口的快速增长

Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of rapid decline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迅速衰退期
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fired three times in rapid succession one after another .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接连开了三枪。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Their debts mounted with alarming rapidity.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的债务以惊人的速度增长。

Sense.DEF: rapid-fire questions, jokes etc are said quickly, one after another
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题﹑笑话等〕连珠炮般说出的

Sense.DEF: a rapid-fire gun fires shots quickly, one after another
very quickly and in a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rapidly changing world of technology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日新月异的科技领域

Sense.DEF: relating to a person or group of people whose job is to react quickly to a dangerous or important situation, such as a military attack, and find a solution to the problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或团体对危险或重要情况〕快速反应的

Sense.DEF: relating to something which allows someone to react quickly to information they have received
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rapid-response system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速反应机制

Sense.DEF: part of a river where the water looks white because it is moving very fast over rocks
a system for moving people quickly around a city using trains
a long thin sword with two sharp edges

a person who has
rape d
someone forced them to have sex, especially using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: She later found out that he was a convicted rapist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她后来发现他是个已被定罪的强奸犯。

Sense.DEF: to go down a cliff or rock by sliding down a rope and touching the rock or cliff with your feet

someone who speaks the words of a
rap
song
friendly agreement and understanding between people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had an excellent rapport with his patients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他病人的关系极为融洽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He built up a good rapport with the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和孩子们建立了融洽的关系。

Sense.DEF: the establishment of a good relationship between two countries or groups of people, after a period of unfriendly relations

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope for a rapprochement between our two countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我们两国能恢复友好关系。

Sense.DEF: a list kept by the police of someone’s criminal activities
so interested in something that you do not notice anything else
Sense.TRAN: 全神贯注的﹐专心致志的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They listened with rapt attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全神贯注地听着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rapt expression on his face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上专注的表情

Sense.DEF: great excitement and happiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys gazed up at him in rapture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们欣喜若狂地抬头注视着他。

Sense.DEF: to express or feel great pleasure and happiness about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She went into raptures about the climate, the food, the spring flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她陶醉于那里的气候﹑美食和春天的花儿。

Sense.DEF: expressing great happiness or admiration – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 狂喜的﹐狂热的〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was greeted with rapturous applause .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了热烈的掌声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was given a rapturous welcome.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到热烈欢迎。

Sense.DEF: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often
Sense.TRAN: 稀有的﹐罕见的﹔不常发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物越来越罕见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is rare (for sb/sth) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is rare to find such an interesting group of people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难得碰到这样有趣的一群人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

Sense.DEF: meat that is rare has only been cooked for a short time and is still red
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like my steak rare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我做半熟的牛排。

Sense.DEF: very good or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a rare old time at the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在聚会上玩得高兴极了。

Sense.DEF: a rarefied place, organization, or type of activity is only available to or understood by a small group of people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方﹑组织﹑活动〕只限于小圈子内的﹔曲高和寡的﹔玄妙的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rarefied atmosphere of academia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曲高和寡的学术界氛围

Sense.DEF: rarefied air is the air in high places, which has less oxygen than usual
not often
Sense.EXAMPLE: She very rarely complains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她极少抱怨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This method is rarely used in modern laboratories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代实验室里很少使用这种方法。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal or literary writing, rarely can be put first, followed by an auxiliary and the subject, to emphasize that something does not often happen.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在正式文体或文学作品中﹐rarely可以置于句首﹐后跟助动词及主语﹐强调某事不常发生
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Rarely is the customer consulted on the changes.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 调价极少会与顾客商议。

Exponent.DEF: not often
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These geese are rarely found on inland waters.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鹅在内陆水域很罕见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 50% of Britons say they rarely eat meat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 50%的英国人称自己很少吃肉。

Exponent.DEF: often used in everyday English instead of saying rarely
Exponent.TRAN: 不常〔常用于日常英语﹐而不用rarely〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tina’s not often late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂娜不常迟到。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t go there very often.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不常去那里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s not often that you get a chance like this.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的机会并不常有。

Exponent.DEF: rarely. Seldom is more formal than rarely and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 很少〔较rarely更正式﹐尤用于英语书面语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He seldom slept well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他难得睡得安稳。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They seldom went out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们极少外出。

Exponent.DEF: almost never
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ben’s nineteen and he’s hardly ever at home these days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本十九岁了﹐这些天几乎不着家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For some reason, her name was scarcely ever mentioned.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于某种原因﹐她的名字几乎没有被提起过。

Exponent.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that something only happens a few times over a long period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Very occasionally the temperature drops to below 30.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 极少数情况下气温会降至30度以下。

Sense.DEF: very eager to start an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: They woke up early and were raring to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很早就醒来﹐急着想开始。

Sense.DEF: very eager to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were raring to get outdoors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们急着要到外面去。

Sense.DEF: to not happen or exist very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visitors were a rarity in the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里极少有外人来。

Sense.DEF: something that is valuable or interesting because it is rare
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these plants are national rarities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物中有些是国家珍品。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being rare
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such stamps are expensive because of their rarity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些邮票因为罕见而价格昂贵。

Sense.DEF: a child who behaves badly but whom you still like
a dishonest man
if you are rash, you do things too quickly, without thinking carefully about whether they are sensible or not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please Jessie, don’t do anything rash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 求你了﹐杰西﹐不要草率行事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go making any rash decisions about your future!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要对你的未来贸然作决定！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was rather rash of you to lend them your car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把汽车借给他们实在有欠考虑。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I rashly agreed to look after the children.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没多想就答应照看那些孩子。

Sense.DEF: a lot of red spots on someone’s skin, caused by an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a nasty rash on her arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的胳膊上起了严重的皮疹。

GramExa.GLOSS: get a rash
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother comes out in a rash if she eats seafood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲一吃海鲜就起皮疹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most babies get nappy rash at some stage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数婴儿都会在某个阶段得尿布疹。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a heat rash a rash caused by heat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痱子

Sense.DEF: a large number of unpleasant events, changes etc within a short time
Sense.TRAN: 大量的某事物〔指短时间内出现的令人不快的事件﹑变化等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a rash of car thefts in the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心盗车案频发。

Sense.DEF:
a thin piece of
bacon
or
ham

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rasher of bacon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片培根

Sense.DEF: to make a rough unpleasant sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: my father’s rasping voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲刺耳的嗓音
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Stop!’ he rasped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “停下来！”他尖声喊道。

Sense.DEF: to rub a surface with something rough
a rough unpleasant sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the harsh rasp of her breathing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她粗重的呼吸声

Sense.DEF: a metal tool with a rough surface that is used for shaping wood or metal
a soft sweet red berry, or the bush that this berry grows on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bowl of fresh raspberries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一碗新鲜的山莓
Sense.EXAMPLE: raspberry jam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山莓酱

Sense.DEF: a rude sound that you make by putting your tongue out and blowing
Sense.TRAN: 〔吐舌并吹气而发出的〕呸呸声﹔嘘声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She blew a raspberry at him as he drove off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车走的时候﹐她朝他呸了一声。

Sense.DEF: a Rastafarian
someone who believes in a religion that is popular in Jamaica, which has Haile Selassie as its religious leader, and has the belief that one day black people will return to Africa
Sense.TRAN: 拉斯塔法里教徒〔牙买加一教派成员﹐该教派尊海尔·塞拉西为宗教领袖﹐认为黑人终将返回非洲〕

Sense.DEF: a male Rastafarian
an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail
someone who has been disloyal to you or deceived you
Sense.EXAMPLE: But you promised to help us, you rat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可你答应过要帮我们的﹐你这小人！

Sense.DEF: to look very wet and uncomfortable
used to describe people who leave a company, organization etc when it is in trouble
Sense.TRAN: （就像）老鼠逃离沉船一样〔形容人们在公司﹑组织等有麻烦时纷纷离去〕

Sense.DEF: if someone rats on you, they tell someone in authority about something wrong that you have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ll kill you if they find out you’ve ratted on them!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如他们发现是你告发了他们﹐会杀掉你的！

Sense.DEF: to not do what you had promised to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He accused the government of ratting on its promises to the disabled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责政府没有履行对残疾人所作的承诺。

Sense.DEF: if someone rats you out, they are disloyal to you, especially by telling someone in authority about something wrong that you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t rat out your teammates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能告发队友。

Sense.DEF: extremely drunk
the sound of knocking, especially on a door
Sense.TRAN: 敲击声﹔〔尤指敲门的〕砰砰声

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant person
a machine part consisting of a wheel or bar with teeth on it, which allows movement in only one direction
to increase something by a small amount, especially after a series of increases, or to increase in this way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在连续数次提高之后〕（使）小幅增加[提高]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Raising the minimum wage would ratchet up real incomes in general.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高最低工资将普遍提高实际收入。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The debate will ratchet up a notch on Wednesday when the Commission publishes its report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期三委员会发表报告后﹐辩论还将升级。

Sense.DEF: the number of times something happens, or the number of examples of something within a certain period

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Australia’s unemployment rate rose to 6.5% in February.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2月份﹐澳大利亚的失业率上升到了6.5%。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rapid increase in the divorce rate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚率的迅速攀升

GramExa.EXAMPLE: areas with high rates of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高犯罪率地区

GramExa.GLOSS: the number of times that something succeeds or fails
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a new technique and the failure rate is quite high.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一项新技术﹐失败率很高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Immediately his heart rate the number of beats per minute increased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的心率立即加快了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Asylum seekers were entering Britain at a rate of 1,600 per day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻求避难者正以每天1,600人的速度进入英国。

Sense.DEF: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who pay tax at the highest rate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以最高税率纳税的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They only pay tax at a rate of 5%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只按5%的税率纳税。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: another reduction in the mortgage rate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按揭贷款利率的再一次降低

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nurses are demanding higher rates of pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士在要求提高工资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some hotels offer special rates for children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些宾馆为儿童提供特价。

GramExa.GLOSS: the amount someone is paid per hour or week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the hourly rate for cleaning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清洁工时薪多少？

Sense.EXAMPLE: $20 an hour is the going rate the usual amount paid for private tuition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

Sense.DEF: the speed at which something happens over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to slow down the rate of economic growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放慢经济增速的努力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children learn at different rates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩学东西有快有慢。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our money was running out at an alarming rate .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的钱耗费速度惊人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Iceland is getting wider at a rate of about 0.5 cm per year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰岛正以每年约0.5厘米的速度变宽。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are stating one definite fact in a situation that is uncertain or unsatisfactory
Subsense.TRAN: 反正﹐不管怎样〔用于提出在不确定或令人不满意情况中的确定因素〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They’ve had technical problems – at any rate that’s what they told me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遇到了技术问题——反正他们是这么跟我说的。

Subsense.DEF: used to introduce a statement that is more important than what was said before
Subsense.TRAN: 无论如何﹐不管怎样〔用于提出比刚才所说更为重要的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, at any rate, the next meeting will be on Wednesday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐不管怎样﹐下次会议将在星期三召开。

Sense.DEF: used to say what will happen if things continue to happen in the same way as now
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this rate we won’t ever be able to afford a holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照这样下去﹐我们永远也不会有钱去度假。

Sense.DEF: of good, bad, or very bad quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheap third-rate motel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 便宜的三流汽车旅馆

Sense.DEF: very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack’s getting through the ironing at a rate of knots!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克熨衣服熨得飞快！

Sense.DEF: a local tax, paid before 1990 by owners of buildings in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国地方政府1990年以前向房主征收的〕房地产税

Subsense.DEF: to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company seems to rate him very highly think he is very good .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rhodes is currently rated the top junior player in the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗兹目前被认为是国内水平最高的青少年选手。

Subsense.DEF: to be considered as having a particular quality, value, or standard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That rates as one of the best meals I’ve ever had.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那可以说是我吃过的最好的一顿饭之一。

Sense.DEF: if you rate someone or something, you think they are very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never rated him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都不认为他好。

Sense.DEF: if you do not rate someone’s chances of achieving something, you do not think that it is likely that they will achieve it
Sense.TRAN: 看好某人（有可能做某事）﹔认为某人有可能（做成某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t rate your chances of getting a ticket for the Leeds game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看你是搞不到利兹队球赛门票的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you rate your chances tomorrow? do you think you will be successful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天的事情你有多大把握？

Sense.DEF: to deserve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rate a big thank-you for all their hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的努力值得好好感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a local incident that didn’t rate a mention in the national press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不值得在全国性报刊上报道的地方小事

Sense.DEF: if a film is rated G, U etc, it is officially judged to be suitable or unsuitable for people of a particular age to see

the
exchange rate

a company’s profit for a year, expressed as a
percentage
of the money that the company has spent during the year
someone who pays taxes that are used to provide local services
fairly or to some degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was rather surprised to see him with his ex-wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他和前妻在一起﹐感到相当惊讶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was limping rather badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他腿跛得挺厉害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My own position is rather different .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己的处境则很不一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abigail’s always been rather a difficult child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿比盖尔一向是个挺难管的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isn’t it rather late a little too late to start changing all the arrangements?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在改变所有安排是不是有点晚了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Actually I rather like the new style of architecture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实上我很喜欢这种新建筑风格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a nice house, but rather too small for a family of four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子很好﹐但对于四口之家来说太小了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The task proved to be rather more difficult than I had expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作其实比我想象的要难很多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would prefer to do or have something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could eat later if you would rather do that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意的话﹐我们可以晚点再吃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think you’d better ask her.’‘ I’d rather not I do not want to .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想你最好去问问她。”“我不想问。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d rather die than apologize to Helen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁可死也不会向海伦道歉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather you didn’t go back I do not want you to go .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让你回去。

Sense.DEF: instead of
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’d call it a lecture rather than a talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说啊﹐这是训斥﹐不是谈话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rather than go straight on to university why not get some work experience first?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与其直接上大学﹐为什么不先取得一点工作经验呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bryson decided to quit rather than accept the new rules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖森决定辞职而不接受新规定。

Sense.DEF: used before correcting something that you have said, or giving more specific information
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all went in Vic’s car, or rather his father’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都是坐维克的车走的﹐确切地说﹐是他父亲的车。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one thing is not true but a different thing is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is not their lack of funding, but rather their lack of planning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题不在于他们缺少资金﹐而在于缺乏计划。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are glad that you are not going to be doing something that someone else will be doing
Sense.TRAN: 还好是你/他/她/他们而不是我〔用于表示不想做别人要去做的事〕

Sense.DEF: used to agree with someone
to make a written agreement official by signing it

GramExa.PROPFORM: ratify a treaty/an agreement/a decision etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hope that the republics will be willing to ratify the treaty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望各共和国愿意签署这个条约。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an attempt to delay ratification of the treaty

Sense.DEF: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the year the Prime Minister’s approval rating how many people agreed with his policies had fallen as low as 12 percent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到年底时﹐首相的支持率跌到了12%的低点。

Sense.DEF: a list that shows which films, television programmes etc are the most popular
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑电视节目等的〕收视率排行榜
Sense.EXAMPLE: CBS will end the series if it continues to drop in the ratings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电视连续剧如果收视率排名继续下降﹐哥伦比亚广播公司就会停播该剧。

Sense.DEF: a letter that shows whether or not a film is suitable for children
Sense.TRAN: 〔标示电影是否适合儿童的〕级别
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Godfather’ had an X-rating when it was first shown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《教父》在刚上映时属于X级。

Sense.DEF:
a
sailor
in the navy who is not an officer
a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个数量之间的〕比﹐比例﹐比率

GramExa.PROPFORM: the ratio of sth to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ratio of nursing staff to doctors is 2:1.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护理人员与医生的比例为2比1。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ratio between profits and incomes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润和收入之比

Sense.DEF: a fixed amount of something that people are allowed to have when there is not enough, for example during a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物在短缺时的〕配给量﹐定量配给

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the weekly meat ration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉类的每周配给量
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a coal ration of 4 kg a month
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月4公斤的煤配给量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even wool was on ration in the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战时甚至毛线都是定量配给的。

Sense.DEF: a fixed amount of food given to a soldier or member of a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: emergency food rations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急食物配给
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were queuing for their meagre rations small rations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人排队领取他们微薄的口粮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were on short rations given a smaller amount than usual .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的口粮不足。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that you think is reasonable or normal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: holidaymakers who like a generous ration of open-air activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢有大量户外活动的度假者

Sense.DEF: to control the supply of something because there is not enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fuel was rationed during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间﹐燃油定量供应。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone only a small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need to ration health care resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制医疗保健资源分配的必要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: diets which ration fat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制脂肪摄入量的膳食

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rationed himself to 4 cigarettes a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他限定自己每天只抽4支烟。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try to ration the children’s television viewing to an hour a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图把孩子们每天的看电视时间限制在一小时。

Sense.DEF: rational thoughts, decisions etc are based on reasons rather than emotions
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑决定等〕合理的﹐基于理性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母需要充分了解情况﹐这样才可以作出合理的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

Sense.DEF: a rational person is able to think calmly and sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Culley was quite rational at the time of her baby’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡莉在她孩子死去时相当理智。

Sense.DEF: able to make sensible judgments
Sense.TRAN: 能作出理智决定的﹐理性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man is a rational animal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类是理性动物。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We were too shocked to think rationally .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们太过震惊﹐难以理智地思考。

Sense.DEF: the reasons for a decision, belief etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rationale behind the changes is not at all evident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本看不出这些变革依据何在。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rationale for using this teaching method is to encourage student confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用这种教学方法的理由是要激发学生的自信心。

Sense.DEF: the belief that your actions should be based on scientific thinking rather than emotions or religious beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: philosophers who accept scientific rationalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受科学唯理论的哲学家们

Sense.DEF: someone who bases their actions on rationalism
if you rationalize behaviour that is wrong, you invent an explanation for it so that it does not seem as bad
Sense.TRAN: 为〔不当行为〕找出辩解理由
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he fouls up, Glen always finds a way to rationalize what he’s done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格伦把事情搞砸的时候﹐总能找出辩解理由。

Sense.DEF: to make a business more effective by removing unnecessary workers, equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 对〔企业〕进行合理化改革〔指裁减冗员﹑处理闲置设备等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our systems will be rationalized over the coming months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在未来的几个月里﹐我们的体制将进行合理化改革。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a major rationalization of the aircraft industry
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对飞机制造业的一项重大的合理化改革

Sense.DEF: when the amount of food, petrol etc that people are allowed to have is limited by the government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: News of bread rationing created panic buying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面包将定量配给的消息引发了恐慌性购买。

Sense.DEF:
the unpleasant situation experienced by people working in big cities, when they continuously compete for success and have a lot of
stress
in their lives
Sense.TRAN: 〔大城市里的〕永无休止的激烈竞争﹐你死我活的竞争

GramExa.PROPFORM: get out of/quit the rat race
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the story of a couple who quit the rat race
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对夫妻放弃名利追逐的故事

Sense.DEF: a quiet street that drivers use as a quick way of getting to a place, rather than using a main road
Sense.TRAN: 〔驾车者快速前往某处的〕小路﹐捷径
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road has become a rat run for traffic avoiding the town centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路已经成了车辆避开市中心的捷径。

Sense.DEF: used to show annoyance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rats! I forgot to buy any bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真烦人！我忘记买面包了。

Sense.DEF: if your hair is in rats’ tails, it hangs down in separate pieces because it is wet or dirty
Sense.TRAN: 像老鼠尾巴一样〔指头发因为湿或脏而一缕缕地垂下来〕

Sense.DEF:
the plant used to make
wicker
furniture
Sense.EXAMPLE: rattan chairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 藤椅

Sense.DEF: if you rattle something, or if it rattles, it shakes and makes a quick series of short sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan banged on her door and rattled the handle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹砰砰地敲她的门﹐还把门把手拽得咯吱作响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window rattled in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户被风吹得咯吱作响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bottles rattled as he stacked the beer crates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把啤酒箱摞起来﹐酒瓶咣当咣当地响。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle rattles somewhere, it travels there while making a rattling sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cart rattled along the stony road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马车沿着碎石路嘎啦嘎啦往前走。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: An old blue van rattled into view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆蓝色旧货车咔嗒咔嗒地驶入我们的视线。

Sense.DEF: to make someone lose confidence or become nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mocking smile rattled her more than his anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那种嘲讽的微笑比他的愤怒更让她慌乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hard not to get rattled when the work piled up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作积了一大堆﹐哪能不着急呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His confidence was rattled by the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场事故动摇了他的自信。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone - used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who rattled your cage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是谁惹你了？

Sense.DEF: to live in a building that is much too big for you
Sense.TRAN: 居住〔在空荡荡的大房子里〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad and I rattled around miserably in the house after Mum died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈死后﹐我和爸爸住在这空荡荡的房子里﹐非常凄惨。

Sense.DEF: to say several pieces of information or a list quickly and easily from memory
Sense.TRAN: 快速背诵﹔不假思索地说出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris rattled off some statistics about the teams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯脱口说出了那些球队的一些数据。

Sense.DEF: to talk quickly for a long time about boring things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nancy would rattle on for hours about her grandchildren.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希会几个小时喋喋不休地讲她的孙子孙女。

Sense.DEF: to do something quickly because you want to finish it
if a sports player rattles up a number of points, they get that number of points very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The West Indies had rattled up 411 for 5 when rain stopped play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛因雨停止时﹐西印度群岛队已经在5局里拿下了411分。

Sense.DEF: a short repeated sound, made when something shakes
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体晃动发出的〕嘎嘎声﹐咯吱声
Sense.EXAMPLE: They listened anxiously to every rattle and creak in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们紧张地听着房子里的每一声响动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rattle of chains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锁链的当啷声
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the faint rattle of distant gunfire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处隐约的隆隆炮声

Sense.DEF: a baby’s toy that makes a noise when it is shaken
an object that people shake to make a loud noise and show excitement or encouragement, for example at ceremonies or sports games
Sense.TRAN: 〔仪式或体育比赛中表示兴奋或助威用的〕响板

Sense.DEF: a rattlesnake
a poisonous American snake that shakes its tail to make a noise when it is angry
a rattletrap vehicle is old and in bad condition
a good exciting story
Sense.TRAN: 非常好[刺激]的故事/读物

Sense.DEF: becoming annoyed quickly or easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel guilty about getting ratty with the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动不动就对孩子们发脾气﹐心里很内疚。

Sense.DEF: dirty and in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ratty old sofa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张破旧的沙发
Sense.EXAMPLE: ratty hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱蓬蓬的头发

Sense.DEF: sounding unpleasantly loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: He burst into raucous laughter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然发出沙哑的笑声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: raucous cheers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳的欢呼声

Sense.DEF: impolite, noisy, and violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: A group of raucous students spilled out of the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群吵闹的学生从酒吧里蜂拥而出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The atmosphere became increasingly raucous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气氛越来越喧闹。

Sense.DEF: intended to be sexually exciting, in a way that seems immoral or shocking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raunchy magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情杂志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was quite raunchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目很下流。

Sense.DEF: to damage something very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country ravaged by civil war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭受内战重创的国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: His health was gradually ravaged by drink and drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒和吸毒渐渐毁了他的健康。

Sense.DEF: the damage caused by something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物造成的破坏[损害]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a building that has survived the ravages of time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座历久不衰的建筑物
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ravages of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争造成的破坏

Sense.DEF: to talk about something you enjoy or admire in an excited way
Sense.TRAN: 极力夸奖某事物﹐对某事物赞不绝口
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now I understand why travelers rave about Lapland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在明白为什么游客会对拉普兰交口称赞了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The customers were raving over our homemade chili.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客对我们自制的辣椒粉赞不绝口。

Sense.DEF: to talk in an angry, uncontrolled, or crazy way
Sense.TRAN: 咆哮﹔胡言乱语﹔语无伦次

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started raving at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始对我胡言乱语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lisa raved on about how awful it all was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨气愤地诉说着这一切是多么糟糕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still ranting and raving the next morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天上午他仍在大叫大嚷。

Sense.DEF: a big event where people dance to loud music with a strong beat and often take drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: an all-night rave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通宵狂欢晚会
Sense.EXAMPLE: rave music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂欢舞会音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: rave parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂欢派对

Sense.DEF: strong praise for a new play, book etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play got raves from the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏得到了评论家的热情褒扬。

Sense.DEF: strong praise for a new play, book etc, especially in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在报纸或杂志上对新剧﹑新书等作的〕高度评价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The performance earned them rave reviews from critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次表演使他们赢得了评论家的盛赞。

Sense.DEF: a large shiny black bird
raven hair is black and shiny
ravening animals are hungry and dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pack of ravening wolves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群饿狼

Sense.DEF: very hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely ravenous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ravenous appetite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极大的胃口

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I was ravenously hungry.

Sense.DEF:
someone who goes to a
rave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police believe many of the ravers were on drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为许多参加狂欢舞会的人都吸毒。

Sense.DEF: someone who has an exciting social life and goes to a lot of parties
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢社交活动的人﹔喜欢寻欢作乐的人

Sense.DEF: a deep narrow valley with steep sides
talking or behaving in a crazy way
Sense.TRAN: 语无伦次的﹔疯疯癫癫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raving lunatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡言乱语的疯子

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something has a lot of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 绝对的〔强调某人或某事物颇具某种品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was no raving beauty , but at least she looked smart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不是绝色美女﹐但至少看上去很时尚。

Sense.DEF: completely crazy
crazy things that someone says

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ravings of a demented man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个疯子的胡言乱语

Sense.DEF:
small
pasta
squares filled with meat or cheese
to force a woman to have sex
to badly harm something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a landscape ravished by drought
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭受严重旱灾的景象

Sense.DEF: very beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 非常美丽的﹐十分标致的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked ravishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去美艳绝伦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ravishing smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: not cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: raw meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: grated raw carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨碎的生胡萝卜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋白菜可以生吃。

Sense.DEF: raw substances are in a natural state and not treated or prepared for use
Sense.TRAN: 未经加工的﹐自然状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: raw silk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生丝
Sense.EXAMPLE: In its raw state, cocoa is very bitter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经加工的可可豆味道很苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raw sewage had been dumped in the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经处理的污水被排到河里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of our raw materials has risen significantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的原材料价格涨了很多。

Sense.DEF: raw information is collected but not organized, examined, or developed
Sense.TRAN: 原始的﹔未经整理的﹔未经分析的
Sense.EXAMPLE: software to convert raw data into usable information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把原始数据转变成可用信息的软件
Sense.EXAMPLE: His time here provided the raw material for his novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这里的经历为他的小说提供了素材。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Warhol used everyday items as the raw ingredients of his art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃霍尔将日常物品用作艺术作品的素材。

Sense.DEF: raw feelings are strong and natural, but not fully controlled
Sense.EXAMPLE: raw passion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 质朴的激情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Linda didn’t want to see Roy while her emotions were still raw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳达不想在情绪尚未平复时见罗伊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took raw courage to admit she was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她承认自己错了需要极大的勇气。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body is raw, the skin there is red and painful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin on my feet was rubbed raw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脚上的皮肤被磨得又红又痛。

Sense.DEF: not experienced or not fully trained
Sense.TRAN: 没有经验的﹔未经充分训练的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of our soldiers are raw recruits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的士兵大多数都是新兵。

Sense.DEF: to upset someone by something you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing his face, Joanne realized she’d touched a raw nerve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他的脸色﹐乔安娜意识到自己触到了他的痛处。

Sense.DEF: unfair treatment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers are getting a raw deal and are rightly angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客受到委屈﹐生气是理所当然的。

Sense.DEF: very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shivered in the raw morning air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨的寒气冻得她发抖。

Sense.DEF: music, art, language etc that is raw is simple, direct, and powerful, but not fully developed
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐﹑艺术﹑语言等〕质朴的﹐未经琢磨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice has a raw poetic beauty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的嗓音有一种质朴﹑诗意的美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His early sketches are raw and unpretentious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早期的素描质朴而不做作。

Sense.DEF: someone with raw talent is naturally good at something, but has not developed their ability yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has the raw talent to become a star.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有当明星的潜质。

Sense.DEF: the edge of a piece of material before it has been sewn
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn over the raw edges and stitch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把毛边卷起来缝上。

Subsense.DEF: seen in a way that does not hide cruelty and violence
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He went on the streets to experience life in the raw .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走街串巷﹐体验真实生活。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was my first exposure to India in the raw.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我第一次接触真实的印度。

Subsense.DEF: not wearing any clothes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: sunbathing in the raw
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裸体晒日光浴

Sense.DEF: to say or do something that upsets someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话或做事〕触及某人的痛处
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flinched, caught on the raw by his question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被他问到了痛处﹐退缩了。

Sense.DEF: leather that is in its natural state
a straight narrow beam of light from the sun or moon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room darkened as a cloud hid the sun’s rays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一朵云挡住了阳光﹐房间暗了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rays of light filtered through the trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一束束光线透过树丛照射下来。

Sense.DEF: a beam of heat, electricity, or other form of energy
something that provides a small amount of hope or happiness in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a treatment that offers a ray of hope for cancer sufferers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给癌症患者一线希望的治疗方法

Sense.DEF: someone who is happy and makes a difficult situation seem better
to sit or lie in the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go out and catch a few rays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去晒晒太阳吧。

Sense.DEF: a large flat sea fish with a long pointed tail
Sense.TRAN: 魟；鳐〔一种体形扁平的大海鱼﹐尾巴长而尖〕

Sense.DEF: a smooth artificial cloth used for making clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rayon shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造丝衬衫

Sense.DEF: to completely destroy a town or building
Sense.TRAN: 彻底破坏〔城镇或建筑物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1162 Milan was razed to the ground by imperial troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1162年米兰被帝国军队夷为平地。

Sense.DEF: a tool with a sharp blade, used to remove hair from your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric razor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动剃须刀
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disposable razor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次性剃刀

Sense.DEF: to be in a difficult position where a mistake could be dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politically we are on a razor edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在政治上处于险境。

Sense.DEF: a small flat blade with a very sharp edge, used in a razor
very sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: razor-sharp teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锋利的牙齿

Sense.DEF: intelligent and able to think quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a razor-sharp mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头脑敏锐。

Sense.DEF: in an election, a razor-thin victory is won by only a small number of votes
strong wire with sharp edges, used to keep people out of a building, area of land etc
Sense.TRAN: 有尖锐刺条的铁丝网﹐刺钢丝

Sense.DEF: to make jokes that insult or embarrass someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eddie was razzed by his teammates after the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛后埃迪遭到队友的嘲笑。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere such as a party, bar etc to enjoy yourself
noisy exciting activity that is intended to attract people’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了吸引人的〕令人眼花缭乱的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: the razzmatazz of show business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演艺界的缤纷喧闹

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Roman Catholic（罗马）天主教的

Sense.DEF:
used with
ordinal
numbers ending in 3, except 13
Sense.TRAN: 〔除了13外以3结尾的序数词写法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 3rd third of June
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6月3日
Sense.EXAMPLE: his 53rd birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的53岁生日

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Road, used in addresses 路〔用于地址〕

Sense.DEF: the postal system for country areas

the amount of substances such as
vitamin s
that you should have every day
Sense.TRAN: 〔维生素等的〕建议每日摄入量

Sense.DEF: used in business letters to introduce the subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: re your enquiry of the 19th October
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于您10月19日的咨询

Sense.DEF:
the second note in a musical
scale
again
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re rebroadcasting the play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在重播该剧。

Sense.DEF: again in a better way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked me to redo the essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要求我重写论文。

Sense.DEF: back to a former state
Sense.EXAMPLE: After years of separation they were finally reunited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离别多年以后﹐他们终于又相聚了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘are’

Sense.DEF: a subject taught in schools
if someone or something reaches a particular point in their development or in a process or competition, they get to that point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had reached the point where I was earning a good salary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经能挣到高薪了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids have reached the age when they can care for themselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们已经到了能照顾自己的年龄。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use get to rather than reach.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常用 get to而不用 reach
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The kids have got to the age where they can care for themselves.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们已经到了能照顾自己的年龄。

Sense.DEF: if something reaches a particular rate, amount etc, it increases until it is at that rate or amount
Sense.TRAN: 提升到﹐增加到〔某一速度﹑数量等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 2008, that figure is expected to reach 7 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到2008年﹐那个数字有望达到700万。
Sense.EXAMPLE: wind speeds reaching up to 180 mph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高达每小时180英里的风速
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices rose steadily to reach record levels .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物价持续攀升﹐达到创纪录水平。

Sense.DEF: to agree on something or decide something after a lot of discussion or thought
Sense.TRAN: 〔经大量讨论或深入考虑后〕实现﹔达成

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The theatre has reached an agreement with striking actors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院已经和罢演的演员达成了协议。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took the jury three days to reach a verdict .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团用了三天时间才作出裁决。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The talks will continue until a conclusion is reached .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈将一直进行下去﹐直到得出结论。

Sense.DEF: to achieve what you wanted to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope to reach our £1 million target by the autumn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望到秋天时实现100万英镑的目标。

Subsense.DEF: to move your arm in order to touch or lift something with your hand
Subsense.TRAN: 伸﹔伸手〔以碰触或提起某物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He reached down to help her to her feet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯身扶她站起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kelly reached for his gun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯利伸手拿枪。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Luisa reached out her hand to stroke the cat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易莎伸手去抚摸猫。

Subsense.DEF: to touch something by stretching out your arm
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s no good – I can’t reach.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有用﹐我够不到。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s too small to reach the table.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她个子太小﹐够不到桌子。

Subsense.DEF: to get something from a high place by stretching up your arm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fell while reaching down a vase from the top shelf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伸手到架子顶层拿花瓶时摔倒了。

Sense.GRAM: I always + adv/prep, T not in progressive
Sense.DEF: to be big enough, long enough etc to get to a particular point
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone lead isn’t long enough to reach the bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话线不够长﹐接不到卧室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skirt that reaches halfway down her legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长度到她膝盖的裙子

GramExa.PROPFORM: reach as far as sth/reach down to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her hair reaches down to her waist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发垂到了腰部。

Sense.DEF: to arrive at a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We reached London late at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们深夜到达伦敦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pyramids can be reached by public transport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以乘坐公共交通工具到达金字塔。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use get to rather than reach .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常用 get to 而不用 reach
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We got to the airport just in time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正好及时赶到了机场。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can get to the pyramids by public transport.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以乘坐公共交通工具到达金字塔。

Sense.DEF: if you reach someone, you succeed in speaking to them on the telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can probably reach him on his mobile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也许可以打他手机联系上他。

Sense.DEF: if a message, television programme etc reaches a lot of people, they hear it or see it
Sense.TRAN: 〔信息﹑电视节目等〕被…听到[看到]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cable TV reaches a huge audience .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有大量观众收看有线电视。

Sense.DEF: if information reaches you, you hear about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news reached us in Lahore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在拉合尔得知了这个消息。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in making someone understand or accept what you tell them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just can’t seem to reach Ed anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像再也不能让埃德明白了。

Sense.DEF: to aim for something that is very difficult to achieve
Sense.TRAN: 有九天揽月之志﹐想摘天上的星星〔指追求难以实现的东西〕

Sense.DEF: to show people that you are interested in them and want to listen to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far, his administration has failed to reach out to hard line Republicans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政府至今没有向强硬的共和党人表示出愿意倾听的姿态。

Sense.DEF: the distance that you can stretch out your arm to touch something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep chemicals out of the reach of children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学品要放在儿童够不到的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep a glass of water within reach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手边放一杯水。

Sense.DEF: close to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beach is within easy reach of the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩离酒店很近。

Sense.DEF: the limit of someone’s power or ability to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lives in Paraguay, well beyond the reach of the British authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在巴拉圭﹐英国当局鞭长莫及。

Subsense.DEF: the parts of a place that are furthest from the centre

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the further reaches of the jungle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丛林的边缘地带

Subsense.DEF: the straight part of a river between two bends
Subsense.TRAN: 〔两个弯道之间的〕笔直河段﹔直水道
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the upper reaches of the Nile
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼罗河的上游

Sense.DEF: the high or low levels of an organization or system
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或体制的〕高层/下层领域
Sense.EXAMPLE: They lingered in the lower reaches of the Football League.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们徘徊在足球联赛的下游位置。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How did Wilson react to your idea?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊对你的想法有什么反应？

Sense.EXAMPLE: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说他撒谎﹐他非常生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She reacted very badly was very upset when her parents split up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚的时候﹐她非常难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government reacted by declaring all strikes illegal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府作出反应﹐宣布所有罢工行动都是非法的。

Sense.DEF: if a chemical substance reacts, it changes when it is mixed with another chemical substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The calcium reacts with sulphur in the atmosphere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钙和硫在空气中会发生化学反应。

Sense.DEF: if prices or financial markets react to something that happens, they increase or decrease in value because of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oil prices reacted sharply reacted a lot to news of the crisis in the Middle East.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格对中东危机的消息反应强烈。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The market reacted favourably to the announcement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场对这则公告反响良好。

Sense.DEF: to become ill when a chemical or drug goes into your body, or when you eat a particular kind of food
Sense.TRAN: 〔因使用某种化学品﹑药物或食用某种食物〕产生不良反应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Quite a lot of children react badly to antibiotics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多儿童对抗生素有不良反应。

Sense.DEF: to show that you dislike someone else’s ideas or ways of doing something, by deliberately doing the opposite
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reacted strongly against his religious upbringing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强烈反对从小所受的宗教教育。

Sense.DEF: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时﹐他是什么反应？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s reaction to the fuel crisis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对燃料危机的反应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An emergency fund was set up in reaction to the famine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对这次饥荒设立了一个应急基金。

Sense.DEF: your ability to move quickly when something dangerous happens suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skilled driver with very quick reactions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反应很快的熟练司机

Sense.DEF: if you have a reaction to a drug or to something you have eaten, it makes you ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔药物或食物引起的〕不良反应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reaction to the immunization
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对注射疫苗的不良反应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a severe allergic reaction to the drug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这种药产生了严重的过敏反应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Certain foods are more likely than others to cause allergic reactions .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些食物比其他食物更容易引起过敏反应。

Subsense.DEF: a chemical change that happens when two or more substances are mixed together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a chemical reaction in the soil
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土壤里的化学反应

Subsense.DEF: a physical force that is the result of an equally strong physical force in the opposite direction

Sense.DEF: a change in people’s attitudes, behaviour, fashions etc that happens because they disapprove of the way in which things were done in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔对过去的态度﹑行为﹑时尚等的〕抗拒﹔改变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reaction against the traditional values of the nineteenth century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对19世纪传统价值观的反抗

Sense.DEF: strong and unreasonable opposition to all social and political changes
Sense.TRAN: 〔对一切社会政治变革的〕反对﹐反动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The revolutionary movement was crushed by the forces of reaction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场革命运动被反动势力镇压了。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的第一/最初/即时反应
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His first reaction was to laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一反应是大笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what they feel or decide immediately, before thinking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You must trust your gut reactions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须相信自己的直觉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what they do immediately, before thinking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Often your instinctive reaction is to blame someone else.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的本能反应往往就是责怪别人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Anger is a natural reaction if you feel undervalued.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 若感觉被人看轻﹐生气是自然反应。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an immediate reaction that happens without sensible thinking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists have a knee-jerk reaction against any development.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保主义者总是不假思索地反对任何开发。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing strong emotion, especially by crying
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 情绪化的反应〔尤指哭泣〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was surprised by her emotional reaction to the news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这消息的情绪化反应令我很吃惊。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing that someone agrees or likes something
showing that someone disagrees or dislikes something
some positive and some negative reactions
a reaction that comes some time after an event
what the public think about something that happens

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 激起/产生/带来某种反应
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The decision provoked an angry reaction from the local tourist industry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定激起当地旅游业界的愤怒。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We didn’t know what kind of reaction we would get.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不知道会得到何种反应。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: judge or find out someone’s reaction

Sense.DEF: very strongly opposed to any social or political change - used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: reactionary attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反动的态度

Sense.DEF: someone who strongly opposes any social or political change - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 反动分子﹔反对社会[政治]变革者〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to make something start working again
Sense.TRAN: 使重新开动﹔使恢复活动

Sense.DEF: reacting to events or situations rather than starting or doing new things yourself
Sense.TRAN: 反应的﹐回应的〔而非主动创新的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reactive foreign policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回应式的外交政策

Sense.DEF: a reactive substance changes when it is mixed with another substance
Sense.TRAN: 〔物质〕能起反应的﹐化学性质活泼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly reactive chemical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很容易起反应的化学品

Sense.DEF:
a
nuclear reactor
to look at written words and understand what they mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t read your writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看不懂你写的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked up the letter and read it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起信读了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Read the instructions carefully before you start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始前要仔细阅读说明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: children who are just learning to read and write
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚刚开始学习读和写的儿童
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her books are quite widely read read by a lot of people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书读者很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I was young, I read every one of his books from cover to cover read all of something because you are very interested .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候﹐他的每一本书我都从头到尾一页不落地看过。

Sense.DEF: to find out information from books, newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t believe everything you read in the papers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上看到的东西﹐你不能全都相信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you read about what happened to that guy in Florida?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到佛罗里达州那个家伙的事了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was shocked when I read of his death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他的死讯﹐我十分震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I read last week that the disease is on the increase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周我在报纸上看到说患这种病的人越来越多。

Sense.DEF: to say the words in a book, newspaper etc so that people can hear them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Daddy, will you read me a story?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸﹐给我念个故事好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our mother reads to us every evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈每天晚上都给我们读点东西。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers should read more poetry to children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师应该多读点诗给孩子听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He glanced at the letter and began to read it aloud .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看了一下信﹐大声地念起来。

Sense.DEF: to look at signs or pictures and understand what they mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays the violin very well but can’t actually read music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小提琴拉得很好﹐但其实他不识谱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you any good at map reading?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你查地图在行吗？

Sense.DEF:
if a computer can read a
disk
, it can take the information that is on the disk and put it into its memory

Sense.SIGNPOST: UNDERSTAND STH IN A PARTICULAR WAY
Sense.DEF: to understand a situation, remark etc in one of several possible ways
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure how to read his silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该如何解读他的沉默。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shook her head, and I read this as a refusal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摇摇头﹐我以为这就是拒绝。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The poem can be read as a protest against war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗可以理解为对战争的抗议。

GramExa.GLOSS: understand something correctly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had accurately read the mood of the nation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他准确解读了国民的情绪。

Sense.DEF: used to say what words are on a sign, in a letter etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sign on the outer door read: ‘No Entry’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外边的门上有一块牌子﹐写着“禁止入内”。

Sense.DEF: if something reads well, badly etc, it has been written well, badly etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think in general the report reads well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这个报告总体上读起来不错。

Sense.DEF: to replace one word or number with another one, usually with the correct one
Sense.TRAN: 将…改作…/用…替换…〔用于订正讹误〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please read £50 as £15.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把50英镑改为15英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For ‘November’ instead of November on line 6, read ‘September’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第6行的November应为September。

Subsense.DEF: to look at the number or amount shown on a measuring instrument
Subsense.TRAN: 看〔度量仪器显示的数字〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Someone should be coming to read the gas meter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该会有人来查煤气表。

Subsense.DEF: if a measuring instrument reads a particular number, it shows that number
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The thermometer read 46 degrees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度计显示46度。

Sense.DEF: to study a subject at a university
Sense.EXAMPLE: I read history at Cambridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在剑桥大学攻读历史。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wants to read for a law degree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想去读一个法学学位。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say that someone does a subject at university.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐人们表达某人在大学读某一课程时﹐一般用 does
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I did history at Cambridge.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾在剑桥读历史。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He wants to do a law degree.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想去读一个法律学位。

Sense.DEF: to feel certain that something is true although no one has told you it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can take it as read that we will support the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以认为我们会支持这个项目。

Sense.DEF: to accept that a report or statement is correct without reading it or discussing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔未经阅读或讨论而〕相信某事物是正确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll take the secretary’s report as read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会认为秘书的报告不会有错。

Sense.DEF: to guess someone’s real feelings from something they say or write, when they do not tell you directly
Sense.TRAN: 看出字里行间的意思﹔听出真实意思
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading between the lines, I’d say Robert’s not very happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听言外之意﹐我看罗伯特不是很快乐。

Sense.DEF: to guess what someone else is thinking
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Want some coffee?’ ‘You read my mind.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想来点咖啡吗？”“你真了解我啊。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: can read sb like a book
Sense.DEF: if you can read someone like a book, you know them so well that you immediately know what they are thinking or feeling
to look carefully at someone’s hand, in order to find out about their future
to understand what someone is saying by watching the way their lips move. People who cannot hear do this.
used to tell someone that you really mean what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Read my lips: I will not let you down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说话算数﹐我不会让你失望的。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone whether they can hear you when you are speaking to them by radio
Sense.TRAN: 听到没有？〔用于无线电通话时〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-read has read a lot of books and knows a lot about many subjects
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is intelligent and extremely well-read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很聪明﹐而且极为博学。

Exponent.DEF: to look at and understand the words in a book, magazine, letter etc for interest, enjoyment, or study
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What book are you reading at the moment?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在在读什么书？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I usually read the newspaper on the way to work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般在上班途中看报纸。

Exponent.DEF: to turn the pages of a book, magazine etc quickly, looking for things that might interest you
Exponent.TRAN: 快速翻阅/浏览某物〔以寻找有趣的东西〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: While I was waiting, I flicked through a magazine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一边等一边翻看一本杂志。

Exponent.DEF: to spend time looking through a book, magazine etc without any clear purpose, looking for things that might interest you
Exponent.TRAN: 随意翻阅某物〔以寻找有趣的东西〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Would you like to browse through our holiday brochure?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想看看我们的度假小册子吗？

Exponent.DEF: to read something quickly to get the main ideas or find a particular piece of information
Exponent.TRAN: 快速浏览某物〔以了解主要内容或寻找某些信息〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want you to skim through the article and write a short summary of it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你们迅速浏览这篇文章﹐然后写一篇简短的摘要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tony scanned the menu for a vegetarian option.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼浏览菜单找素食。

Exponent.DEF: to read something very carefully for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They spent weeks poring over guidebooks and planning their holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们花了几个星期的时间研读旅游指南﹐安排度假。

Exponent.DEF: to read something quickly and eagerly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her young fans devour her books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些年轻粉丝如饥似渴地阅读她的作品。

Exponent.DEF: to read short parts of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a book you can dip into rather than read from cover to cover.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书你随便翻翻就行了﹐没必要从头读到尾。

Exponent.DEF: to read something long and boring
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s upstairs ploughing through financial reports.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在楼上苦读财务报告。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t possibly wade through all this.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可能读完那么多无聊的东西。

Exponent.DEF: to look quickly through information on the Internet, stopping to read what interests you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was surfing the Net, trying to find my ideal job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在网上浏览信息﹐想找一份理想的工作。

Sense.DEF: to read out loud something that you have just written down
Sense.TRAN: 大声读出〔刚才记下的内容〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you read that last bit back to me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把最后一点给我重复一遍好吗？

Sense.DEF: to say some of the words that are said by a particular character in a play, as a test of your ability to act
to think that a situation, action etc has a meaning or importance that it does not really have
Sense.TRAN: 把〔原本没有的意思〕加进去理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only a casual remark. I think you’re reading too much into it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不过是随便说说﹐我觉得你是多心了。

Sense.DEF: to read and say words that are written down, so that people can hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you read out the name of the winner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不宣读获胜者的名字呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He read the last few sentences out to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把最后几句话读出来给我听。

Sense.DEF: to read something carefully from beginning to end in order to check details or find mistakes
Sense.TRAN: 通读﹐从头到尾仔细阅读
Sense.EXAMPLE: Read the contract over carefully before you sign it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细阅读合同之后再签字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spend a couple of minutes just reading through your essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花几分钟时间通读一遍你的文章。

Sense.DEF: to read a lot about something because you will need to know about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll enjoy traveling more if you read up on the history of the countries you’ll be visiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你事先多读点东西﹐了解你要去的国家的历史﹐旅行就会更加有趣。

Sense.DEF: if you have a read, you spend time reading
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat down to have a nice quiet read .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来安静地看一会儿书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a quick read of the report before I left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走之前很快地看了一遍报告。

Sense.DEF: something that you enjoy reading
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought his last book was a really good read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他最新的那本书非常精彩。

Sense.DEF: interesting and enjoyable to read, and easy to understand
Sense.TRAN: 可读性强的﹐读起来有趣的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is informative and highly readable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书内容丰富﹐读来饶有趣味。

Sense.DEF: writing or print that is readable is clear and easy to read
Sense.TRAN: 〔文字﹑印刷物〕清晰的﹐易于识读的

Sense.DEF: someone who reads books, or who reads in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 读者﹔〔以某种方式〕阅读的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book will appeal to young readers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书会吸引年轻读者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been an avid reader someone who reads a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来是一个嗜书如命的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s a great reader of crime fiction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个犯罪小说迷。

Sense.DEF: someone who reads a particular newspaper or magazine regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspaper gradually lost readers during the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪80年代这份报纸逐渐失去了读者。

Sense.DEF: an easy book for children who are learning to read or for people who are learning a foreign language
an important teacher in a British university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Reader in Sociology at Bristol University
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里斯托尔大学社会学高级讲师

Sense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment that can read information that is stored or recorded somewhere, for example on a card
all the people who read a particular newspaper or magazine regularly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a magazine with a readership of 60,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有6万名读者的杂志

Sense.EXAMPLE: They are hoping that the paper will have quite a wide readership .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望这份报纸会有很多读者。

Sense.DEF: the job that a Reader has in a British university
Sense.EXAMPLE: a readership in linguistics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学高级讲师职位

Sense.DEF: a company that produces a magazine called Reader’s Digest, which contains short articles and stories on many different subjects. Reader’s Digest is also known for its ‘Prize Draw’, a competition held every year in which prize numbers are sent to a lot of people.
Sense.TRAN: 读者文摘公司〔《读者文摘》杂志的出版商﹔该杂志登载短篇文章及小说﹐涉及不同主题〕

Sense.DEF: quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boats are readily available to visitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

Sense.DEF: quickly, willingly, and without complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack readily agreed to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克爽快地答应帮忙。

Sense.DEF: when you are prepared for something, or when something is ready to be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They stacked the firewood in readiness for the evening campfire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们堆起木柴﹐准备好了傍晚生营火。

Sense.DEF: willingness to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stressed the government’s readiness to take tough action against terrorists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强调政府愿意采取强硬措施来对付恐怖分子。

Sense.DEF: the activity or skill of understanding written words
Sense.EXAMPLE: She loves reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢看书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading is taught using a combination of several methods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 综合运用多种方法进行阅读教学。

Sense.DEF: books and other things that you can read
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her main reading seems to be mystery novels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像主要就是看悬疑小说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bit of light reading things that are easy and enjoyable to read for my holiday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为我的假期准备的一些轻松读物
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a list of further reading other things you can read at the end of each chapter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一章后面都列有延伸阅读书目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supply of interesting reading material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供一些有趣的阅读材料

Sense.DEF: when you read something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is quite difficult on first reading .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书第一次阅读时很难懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a close reading of the text when you read it very carefully
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文本细读

Sense.DEF: your way of understanding what a particular statement, situation, event etc means
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某说法﹑情形﹑事件等的〕理解﹐解读

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your reading of the government’s response to this crisis?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么看待政府对这次危机所作出的反应？

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when a piece of literature is read to a group of people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a poetry reading at the bookstore
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在书店里举行的诗歌朗诵会

Subsense.DEF: a piece of writing, especially from the Bible, that is read to a group of people
Subsense.TRAN: 朗读的文章〔尤指《圣经》章节〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The first reading is from Corinthians I, Chapter 3.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一篇朗读的经文选自《哥林多前书》第三章。

Sense.DEF: to be interesting etc to read
Sense.TRAN: 读起来有趣的/吸引人的/令人激动的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your report made fascinating reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的报告读起来引人入胜。

Sense.DEF: a number or amount shown on a measuring instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: We take temperature readings every two hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每两小时读取一次温度。

Sense.DEF: one of the occasions in the British Parliament or the US Congress when a suggested new law is discussed
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会或美国国会中的〕议案宣读
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second reading of the Reform Bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《改革法案》的二读

Sense.DEF: to get used to a new situation, job, or way of life
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes time to readjust after a divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚后需要时间重新适应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Former soldiers often struggle to readjust to life outside the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 退伍军人往往要努力去重新适应部队外的生活。

Sense.DEF: to make a small change to something or to its position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He readjusted his glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他重新调了调眼镜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We may need to readjust these figures slightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许需要稍微调整一下这些数字。

Sense.DEF: information that is produced by a computer and shown on a screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a read-out of all the sales figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有销售数字的读出

Sense.DEF: if you are ready, you are prepared for what you are going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐你还没准备好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门铃响的时候﹐他已经准备好在等着了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything’s packed, and we’re ready to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的东西都装好了﹐我们可以走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel that I’m ready for my driving test yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我还没有准备好参加驾驶考试。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt strong, fit, and ready for anything .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到精力充沛﹐身体康健﹐干什么都行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the end of the lecture, I was ready with questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲座结束的时候﹐我已经准备好一些问题要问。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

GramExa.GLOSS: prepare to start doing something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We made ready for our journey home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们准备好返程回家。

GramExa.GLOSS: said to tell someone that you are ready for them to start doing something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 你准备好了就开始〔告诉对方自己已经准备好﹐等他开始做某事〕

GramExa.GLOSS: said to tell someone that you are ready to do what you have arranged to do together
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 我准备好了﹐就等你了〔告诉对方自己随时可以做安排了一起做的事〕

Sense.DEF: if something is ready, someone has prepared it and you can use it immediately
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物〕准备好的﹐可即刻使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When will supper be ready?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭什么时候准备好？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The computer is now set up and ready to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑已安装好﹐随时可用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is everything ready for the exhibition?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览会所需的一切都准备就绪了吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to get a room ready for our guests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得准备好一个房间给客人用。

Sense.DEF: to have something near you so that you can use it if you need to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had my calculator ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已备好计算器。

Sense.DEF: to need or want something as soon as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really ready for a vacation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的需要去度一次假了。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to do something soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked ready to burst into tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看样子就要哭出来了。

Sense.DEF: very willing to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was always ready to help us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是乐意帮助我们。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was ready and willing to work hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她工作积极肯干。

Sense.DEF: available or coming without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need to have ready access to police files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要立即能查到警方的档案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ready supply of drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现成的饮料供应
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no ready answer to his question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的问题我一时想不出答案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intelligent man with a ready wit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个头脑机敏的聪明男人

Sense.DEF: money that you can spend immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is short of ready cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司现金短缺。

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to start a race
Sense.TRAN: 各就各位﹐预备﹐跑！〔用于赛跑发令〕

Exponent.DEF: having done everything that needs to be done in order to prepare for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you ready? The taxi’s here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好了吗？出租车来了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel that I’m ready for the test yet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己还没有准备好参加测验。

Exponent.DEF: ready to deal with a situation, because you are expecting it or have made careful preparations
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police were prepared for trouble.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对于骚乱有所准备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The team looked well-prepared for the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支球队似乎为比赛做了充分准备。

Exponent.DEF: to be ready to start doing something that you have planned to do, and be just about to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We were all set for a barbecue when it started to rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都准备好烧烤了﹐这时天却下起雨来。

Exponent.DEF: be ready to start doing something after completing all the necessary preparations
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We just need to get you a pair of skis and you’re good to go.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只要给你一副滑雪板﹐你就一切搞定可以出发了。

Exponent.DEF: if the arrangements or the equipment for doing something are in place, they are ready to start being used
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The television cameras were in place for the wedding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄像机已就位﹐可以拍摄婚礼了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the arrangements are in place for a new constitution and democratic elections.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 修订宪法和举行民主选举的所有准备工作已安排就绪。

Exponent.DEF: if people are standing by, they are ready to take action and help if they are needed – used especially about medical teams, police, the army etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指医疗小组﹑警察﹑军队等〕待命﹐准备行动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Officers in full riot gear were standing by outside the police station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全副防暴装备的警察在警局外待命。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Several ambulances were standing by.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几辆救护车随时待命。

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone ready for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to ready him for the bad news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法让他有思想准备接受这个坏消息。

Sense.DEF: available to be used immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers stood around with weapons at the ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们在周围站着﹐手里拿着武器。

Sense.DEF: money that you can use immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting a new car as soon as I can scrape together the readies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一凑足现钱就去买一辆新车。

Sense.DEF: already cooked, prepared etc by someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seem to live on ready cooked meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们好像就吃方便餐过日子。

Sense.DEF: ready-made food or goods are already prepared or made, and ready for you to use immediately
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹑商品〕现成的﹐预先准备好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ready-made spaghetti sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现成的意大利面酱汁

Sense.DEF: ready-made ideas or reasons are provided for you, so that you do not have to think of them yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain gave us a ready-made excuse to stay at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场雨给了我们一个待在家里的现成借口。

Sense.DEF: a meal that has already been cooked and is sold ready to eat
ready-to-wear clothes are made in standard sizes, not made specially to fit one person
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕现成的﹐预先做好的﹔成衣的

Sense.DEF: to formally state an opinion, belief, or intention again, especially when someone has questioned you or expressed a doubt
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在某人提出质疑时〕重申﹐再次确定
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party reaffirmed its commitment to nuclear disarmament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党重申其核裁军承诺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has reaffirmed that education is a top priority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府重申教育是重中之重。

Sense.DEF:
a substance that shows that another substance in a
compound
exists, by causing a chemical
reaction
something that is real exists and is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a real danger that the disease might spread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病确实有蔓延的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to tackle the real problems of unemployment and poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要解决失业和贫穷这两个实际问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no real reason to worry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么真正的理由需要担心。

Sense.DEF: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coat made of real fur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真皮大衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Artificial flowers can sometimes look better than the real thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造花有时比真花看起来更漂亮。

Sense.DEF: something that is real actually exists and is not just imagined
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children know that Santa Claus isn’t a real person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们知道圣诞老人不是真实的人物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dreams can sometimes seem very real.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梦境有时显得非常真实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the difficult experience of living and working with other people, rather than being protected at home, at school, or at college
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shock of leaving university and going out into the real world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开大学走进现实世界感受到的冲击

Sense.DEF: actual and true, not invented
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s not her real name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不是她的真名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was the real reason you quit your job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你辞职的真正原因是什么？

Sense.DEF: a real feeling or emotion is one that you actually experience and is strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a look of real hatred in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼神里有一种强烈的仇恨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a real sense of achievement when my work was first published.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的作品第一次发表时﹐我有一种真切的成就感。

Sense.DEF: a real thing has all the qualities you expect something of that type to have
Sense.EXAMPLE: I remember my first real job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还记得我第一份真正的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon was her first real boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙是她第一个真正的男朋友。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how stupid, beautiful, terrible etc someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks – you’ve been a real help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢——你真是帮了大忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was a real mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子真是一团糟。

Sense.DEF: seriously, not just pretending
Sense.EXAMPLE: After two trial runs we did it for real.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试行两次以后﹐我们真正地干了起来。

Sense.DEF: used when you are very surprised or shocked by what someone has done or said
Sense.TRAN: 你是认真的？〔用于对某人的行为或言论表示吃惊或震惊〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are being very silly or unreasonable
to behave in an honest way and not pretend to be different from how you really are
a real increase or decrease in an amount of money is one you calculate by including the general decrease in the value of money over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔钱的增减〕实际的〔已将货币贬值计算在内〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real increase of 6% in average wages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均工资6%的实际增长率
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average value of salaries has fallen in real terms calculated in this way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪水的平均价值实际上下降了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s real cute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常性感迷人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was real nice to see you again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能再次看到你真是太好了。

Sense.DEF: beer that has been made in the traditional way, not in a large factory
Sense.TRAN: 〔古法酿制﹑不在大工厂生产的〕真麦酒﹐传统啤酒

Sense.DEF: property in the form of land or houses
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fall in the value of real estate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产的贬值

Sense.DEF: the business of selling houses or land
someone whose job is to sell houses or land for other people
to change the way in which something is organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is planning to realign its sales operations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在计划重组销售业务。

Sense.DEF: to begin to support and work together with someone again
Sense.TRAN: 再次支持某人﹐再次和某人结盟
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have tried to realign themselves with the communists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图再次站到共产党人这一边。

Sense.DEF: to change the position of something slightly so that it is in the correct position in relation to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to realign your text columns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得重新调整文本栏。

Sense.DEF: when something is changed and organized in a different way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a realignment of the company’s management structure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司管理层结构的重新调整

Sense.DEF: when people stop supporting one group and start to support and work together with a different group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is now a need for a realignment of political parties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在各政治党派需要重新结盟。

Sense.DEF: when the parts of something are arranged so that they return to their correct positions in relation to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the realignment of several major roads
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几条要道的恢复

Sense.DEF: the ability to accept and deal with difficult situations in a practical way, based on what is possible rather than what you would like to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has hope, but also a scientist’s sense of realism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱着希望﹐但同时又有着一个科学家的务实感。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being or seeming real
Sense.EXAMPLE: the realism of the horses on the carousel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旋转木马上各个木马的逼真形态

Sense.DEF: the style of art and literature in which things, especially unpleasant things, are shown or described as they really are in life
Sense.TRAN: 现实主义﹐写实主义〔指艺术和文学作品的风格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tough realism of his early works
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早期作品粗粝的现实主义风格

Sense.DEF: someone who accepts that things are not always perfect, and deals with problems or difficult situations in a practical way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had always been a realist, not a dreamer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向是现实主义者﹐不是梦想家。

Sense.DEF: a writer, painter etc who shows or describes things, especially unpleasant things, as they really are in life
judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen
Sense.TRAN: 现实的﹔实际的﹔实事求是的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is not realistic to do sth
