GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

Sense.DEF: a realistic aim or hope is something that it is possible to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is this a realistic target?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个目标能够实现吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think they have a realistic chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他们没有机会赢。

Sense.DEF: realistic pictures or stories show things as they are in real life
Sense.TRAN: 〔图画﹑故事〕逼真的﹐栩栩如生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a realistic portrayal of life in Victorian Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国维多利亚时代生活的真实写照

Sense.DEF: if you think about something realistically, you think about it in a practical way and according to what is actually possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t realistically expect to win the whole competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你指望场场比赛都赢是不现实的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Realistically, we’re not going to get this finished this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实在的﹐这个星期我们完成不了这事。

Sense.DEF: if you describe or show something realistically, you describe or show it as it is in real life
Sense.EXAMPLE: realistically painted toy soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画得活灵活现的玩具士兵
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel realistically depicts immigrant life at the beginning of the last century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说栩栩如生地描绘了上个世纪初的移民生活。

Sense.DEF: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: the distinction between fantasy and reality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幻想和现实之间的区别
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV is used as an escape from reality .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the government has lost touch with reality no longer understands what is real or true .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: political realities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治现实

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Millions of people live with the harsh realities of unemployment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万人生活在失业的残酷现实中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The reality is that young people will not go into teaching until salaries are higher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况是﹐只有薪水上涨年轻人才会去当教师。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is different from what people think
Sense.EXAMPLE: In reality, violent crimes are still extremely rare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上﹐暴力犯罪还是极罕见的。

Sense.DEF: the fact that something exists or is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had never accepted the reality of her pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直没有接受自己已经怀孕的事实。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you consider the facts of a situation, as opposed to what you would like or what you have imagined
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time for a reality check. The Bears aren’t as good a team as you think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是面对现实的时候了﹐熊队不像你想象的那么棒。

Sense.DEF: television programmes that feature real people doing real things, for example police officers chasing after stolen cars, or people who have been put in different situations and filmed continuously over a period of weeks or months
possible to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is this a realizable goal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个目标实现得了吗？

Sense.DEF: in a form that can be changed into money easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s realizable assets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的可变现资产

Sense.DEF: when you understand something that you had not understood before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was shocked by the realization of what I had done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到自己干了什么后大为震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the realization that she might never recover from her illness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 意识到她或许永远不能康复
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a growing realization that we must manage the earth’s resources more carefully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人认识到我们必须更加谨慎地使用地球资源。

Sense.DEF: when you achieve something that you had planned or hoped for

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the realization of his dreams
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的梦想成真

Sense.DEF: when you change something into money by selling it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the realization of assets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资产变现

Sense.DEF: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suddenly realized that the boy was crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然意识到那男孩在哭。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you realize you’re an hour late?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 知不知道你迟到了一个小时？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I didn’t realize who you were.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我没认出你是谁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that you 不要说 ‘realize about/of something’. Say that you 而要说 realize something.

Sense.DEF: to achieve something that you were hoping to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young singer who has not yet realized her full potential achieved as much as she can achieve
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个尚未充分发挥潜力的年轻歌手

Sense.DEF: used to say that the thing that you were most afraid of has actually happened
Sense.TRAN: 某人最担心的事情发生了
Sense.EXAMPLE: His worst fears were realized when he heard that Chris had been arrested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说克里斯被逮捕﹐他知道自己最害怕的事情发生了。

Subsense.DEF: to obtain or earn an amount of money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The campaign realized $5000.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次活动筹得5000美元。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We realized a small profit on the sale of the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们卖房子小赚了一笔。

Subsense.DEF: to change something that you own into money by selling it

Sense.DEF: actually happening in life, not invented in a book
Sense.TRAN: 真实的﹔实际发生的﹔现实生活中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real-life drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真实生活剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: real-life problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实问题

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: a really good film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常好的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was really cold last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天晚上真冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walks really slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走路真慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really, really sorry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的非常非常抱歉。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Really is especially frequent in spoken English. In writing, people usually prefer to use very or extremely to emphasize an adjective, or very much to emphasize a verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: really 在英语口语中使用频率特别高。而在书面语中﹐人们一般用 very 或 extremely 强调形容词﹐用 very much 强调动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项非常危险的活动
我很喜欢这出戏。

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oliver’s not really her brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never know what he’s really thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开始她似乎并不友善﹐但其实她人很好。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 确实地﹐的确〔用于加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We really need that extra money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的确需要那笔额外的钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really don’t mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的不介意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely fine, Dad – really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好得很﹐爸爸﹐真的。

Sense.DEF: used in questions when you are asking someone if something is true and suggesting that you think it is not true
Sense.TRAN: 真的〔用于疑问句﹐暗示自己不认为所问的事是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you really think she’s doing this for your benefit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的认为她这么做是为了你好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you really expect me to believe that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的以为我会相信吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised by what someone has said
Subsense.TRAN: 是吗？ 真的？〔用于对某人的话表示吃惊〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s Canadian.’ ‘Really?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他是加拿大人。”“真的？”

Subsense.DEF: used in conversation to show that you are listening to or interested in what the other person is saying
Subsense.TRAN: 真的？〔表示正在倾听或对对方的话感兴趣〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘We had a great time in Florida.’ ‘Really? How lovely.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们在佛罗里达玩得很开心。”“真的？太棒了。”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you agree with someone
Subsense.TRAN: 是啊！〔用于表示同意某人的意见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Glen can be such a jerk.’ ‘Yeah, really!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “格伦有时真是个混蛋。”“可不是嘛！”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are angry or disapprove of something
Subsense.TRAN: 真是的！〔用于表示生气或不赞成〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Really, Larry, you might have told me!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是的﹐拉里﹐你怎么不早告诉我呀！

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘no’ or ‘not’ in a less strong way
Sense.TRAN: 不﹔不是〔表示不太强烈的否定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to come along?’ ‘Not really.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想一起去吗？”“不太想。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really know what he’s doing now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太清楚他现在在干什么。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone should do, especially when they are probably not going to do it
Sense.TRAN: 真应该〔用于建议某人做某事﹐尤当某人可能不做时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should really go and see a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真应该去看医生。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement or opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was really and truly a brilliant comedian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真的是个非常出色的喜剧演员。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the adverb really in spoken and written English. 副词really在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: the spiritual realm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神领域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an idea that belongs in the realm of science fiction
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 属于科幻小说领域的构思

Variant.LEXVAR: not beyond the realm(s) of possibility

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to say that something is possible even though you think it is not very likely
Sense.TRAN: 可能的﹐在可能的范围内〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose it’s not beyond the realms of possibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这并非没有可能。

Sense.DEF: a country ruled by a king or queen
politics based on practical situations and needs rather than on moral principles or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 现实政治﹐实用政治〔基于现实情况和需要而非道德原则或思想的政治〕

Sense.DEF: a real-time computer system deals with information as fast as it receives it
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机系统〕即时处理的﹐实时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real-time operating system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实时操作系统

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The images are created in real time.

Sense.DEF:
a
real estate agent
a large amount of writing on paper

GramExa.EXAMPLE: reams of notes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的笔记

Sense.DEF: a standard amount of paper, 500 pieces in the US or 480 pieces in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 令〔纸张的计量单位﹐美国为500张﹐英国为480张〕

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly, especially by cheating
to give new strength to someone or something or the energy to start again
to get something, especially something good, as a result of what you have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Those who do take risks often reap the rewards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些真去冒险的人往往会得到回报。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if you do bad things, bad things will happen to you, and if you do good things, good things will happen to you
Sense.TRAN: 自食其果﹔种瓜得瓜﹐种豆得豆

Sense.DEF: to cut and collect a crop of grain
to appear again after not being seen for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: In March, his cancer reappeared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月份﹐他的癌症又复发了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of these ideas reappear in his later books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些观点有许多都在他后来的书里再次出现。

Sense.DEF: to examine something again in order to consider whether you should change it or your opinion of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: People began to reappraise their values.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们开始重新审视他们的价值观。

Sense.DEF: the back part of an object, vehicle, or building, or a position at the back of an object or area
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体﹑车辆或建筑物的〕后部﹔〔物体或区域的〕后面

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a garden at the rear of the house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋后的花园
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel overlooks the river to the rear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店后面俯视这条河。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a passenger travelling in the rear of a car
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐在汽车后部的乘客

Sense.DEF: the part of your body which you sit on
to be at the back of a line of people or in a race
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carole was left to bring up the rear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡萝尔被落在最后。

Sense.DEF: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown
Sense.TRAN: 养育﹐抚养〔孩子〕﹔饲养〔动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good place to rear young children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟笼养成功。

Sense.DEF: if an animal rears, it rises up to stand on its back legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse reared and threw me off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那匹马扬起前蹄﹐把我摔了下来。

Sense.DEF: if something rears up, it appears in front of you and often seems to be leaning over you in a threatening way
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large rock, almost 200 feet high, reared up in front of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块近200英尺高的巨岩赫然耸立在他们面前。

Sense.DEF: to be given a particular kind of food, books, entertainment etc regularly while you are a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: children reared on TV and video games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看电视﹑玩电子游戏长大的儿童

Sense.DEF: if a problem or difficult situation rears its ugly head, it appears and is impossible to ignore
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem of drug-taking in sport has reared its ugly head again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育界服用药物的问题再次出现。

Sense.DEF: at or near the back of something, especially a vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rear door of the car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的后门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knock at the rear entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敲后门。

Sense.DEF: a high rank in the navy

Subsense.DEF: to make a determined effort to prevent a change that you think is bad, although it seems too late to stop it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They have been fighting a rearguard action to stop a supermarket being built on the land.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了阻止在这块地上建超级市场﹐他们一直在做最后的努力。

Subsense.DEF: if an army fights a rearguard action, it defends itself at the back against an enemy that is chasing it
Subsense.TRAN: 殿后作战﹐后卫战斗〔由后卫部队阻击追兵〕

Sense.DEF: the group of soldiers who defend the back of an army against an enemy that is chasing it
to obtain weapons again or provide someone else with new weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: They returned to base to rearm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们返回基地重新武装。

Sense.DEF: furthest back
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rearmost seats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后面的座位

Sense.DEF: to change the position or order of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She set about rearranging the furniture in the living room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始重新摆放起居室的家具。

Sense.DEF: to change the time of a meeting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: My secretary will phone to rearrange the appointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书会打电话重新预约。

Sense.DEF: a mirror inside a car etc that lets the driver see the area behind the car
in or towards the back of something
Sense.TRAN: 在后面的﹐在后部的﹔向后的

Sense.DEF: why something happens, or why someone does something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People give different reasons for wanting to change jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们想换工作的理由各不相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d like to know the reason why she didn’t accept the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想知道她不接受这份工作的原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The reason I called was to ask about the plans for Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打电话是想问问星期六的计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He explained the reasons behind the decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解释了这一决定背后的理由。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bridge is closed for reasons of safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大桥出于安全原因被封闭了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This work gives me a reason to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作给了我生活的理由。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is no reason to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no reason whatsoever to doubt her story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本没有理由怀疑她的说法。

GramExa.GLOSS: because of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a person disqualified by reason of age
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因年龄原因而被取消资格的一个人

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the reason of’ something. Say 而要说 the reason for something. Do not say 不要说 ‘the reason because’ something happens. Say 而要说 the reason why/that something happens.

Sense.DEF: a fact that makes it right or fair for someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no reason to panic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有理由惊慌。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She has reason to feel guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有理由感到内疚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have reason to believe that the goods were stolen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有理由相信货物是被偷的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know I’m late, but that’s no reason to shout at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我迟到了﹐但也没理由对我大喊大叫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under the circumstances, we had every reason had very good reasons to be suspicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这种情况下﹐我们完全有理由表示怀疑。

GramExa.GLOSS: based on something sensible
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Natalie was alarmed by the news, and with reason.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳塔莉听到消息很惊慌﹐这是合乎情理的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: all the more reason why/to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that what has just been mentioned is an additional reason for doing what you have suggested
Sense.EXAMPLE: But surely that’s all the more reason to act quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过﹐那当然就更有理由立即采取行动了。

Sense.DEF: sensible judgment and understanding
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s reason in what he says.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的话有道理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re not prepared to listen to reason be persuaded by someone’s sensible advice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不想听你讲道理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way of making my grandfather see reason accept advice and make a sensible decision .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爷爷是没有办法说通的。

Sense.DEF: within sensible limits
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can go anywhere you want, within reason.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以想去哪里就去哪里﹐不过要有分寸。

Sense.DEF: to be more than is acceptable or reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their demands go beyond all reason.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的要求太不合理了。

Sense.DEF: the ability to think, understand, and form judgments that are based on facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: the human power of reason
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类的理性

GramExa.GLOSS: become mentally ill

Sense.DEF: used when someone asks you why you are doing something and you do not want to tell them
Sense.TRAN: 不为什么〔用于不想解释自己做某事的原因〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why d’you want to go that way?’ ‘Oh, no reason.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么想要那样？”“噢﹐不为什么。”

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had many reasons to celebrate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有很多理由庆祝。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No reason was given for the change.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有就这一变化说明原因。

Collocate.COLLOC: think of a reason/see a reason
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I see no reason why it shouldn’t work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白这为什么行不通。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Explain the reasons for your choice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请解释一下你那样选的理由。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is usually a good reason why the price is so cheap.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 售价这么低一般都有充分的理由。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The main reason for the decline in the railways is lack of investment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路衰微的主要原因是缺少投资。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His personality was a major reason for his success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的个性是他成功的重要原因。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What do you think was the real reason for their decision?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为他们这一决定的真正原因是什么？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a good and acceptable reason
Collocate.EXAMPLE: An employer can’t fire someone without a valid reason.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主无正当理由不得开除员工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very good reason for doing something
one that is easy to understand

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 出于法律上/政治上/医学上等的原因
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The boy cannot be named for legal reasons.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于法律上的原因﹐不能提及那个男孩的姓名。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The road will be closed for security reasons.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路由于安全原因将被封闭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He resigned for personal reasons.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他辞职是出于个人原因。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: because you like someone or something very much
for no obvious reason
for a reason that you do not know

Collocate.COLLOC: for reasons best known to sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when you do not understand someone’s behaviour
have a secret reason for doing something

Exponent.DEF: why something happens, or why someone does something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What was the reason for the delay?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 延误原因是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t know the reason why he left his last job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他辞去上一份工作的原因。

Exponent.DEF: a set of reasons that helps you to understand why something happens, especially when it seems difficult to understand
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤对难以理解的事情的〕解释
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are various possible explanations for climate change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于气候变化有许多可能的解释。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is there any explanation for his behavior?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为有何解释？

Exponent.DEF: a reason that makes someone decide to do something – often used about crimes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police say that there is no obvious motive for the attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称﹐此次袭击没有明显动机。

Exponent.DEF: a good reason for doing something that seems wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔做似乎错误的事情的〕正当理由
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is never any justification for torture or abuse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 折磨和虐待绝无任何正当理由。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They try to use the situation in the Middle East as a justification for killing innocent civilians.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图把中东局势当作杀害无辜平民的理由。

Exponent.DEF: a reason that makes it right or fair to do something, especially according to legal, official, or moral rules
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指依照法律﹑规章或道德准则的〕充分理由﹐根据
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court will decide if she has grounds for divorce.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭将对她是否有理由离婚作出裁决。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They claim the war is justified on moral grounds because of moral reasons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们声称这场战争合乎道义。

Exponent.DEF: the main ideas or reasons on which something is based
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor makes his decisions purely on the basis of clinical observation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位医生完全凭临床观察来作决定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What do you think is the basis for this advice?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这一建议的依据是什么？

Exponent.DEF: a set of reasons that are used to explain why someone does something in a particular way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rationale behind the government’s economic reforms
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府经济改革背后的理由

Section.SECHEADING: A REASON THAT DOES NOT SEEM BELIEVABLE 不可信的理由

Exponent.DEF: a reason that you give to explain why you have done something bad, or not done something that you should have done – especially one that is not completely true
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指不完全真实的〕托词﹐借口
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She said she couldn’t come because she had to work late, but it was just an excuse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她来不了﹐因为她得工作到很晚﹐但这只是个借口。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a feeble excuse one that is hard to believe
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无力的借口

Exponent.DEF: an untrue reason that you give for doing or not doing something, in order to hide the real reason
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He would often find some pretext to go out in the evening alone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他常常会找个借口﹐晚上一个人出去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They used this as a pretext for taking military action.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们利用此事作为采取军事行动的借口。

Sense.DEF: to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

Sense.DEF: to think and make judgments
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ability to reason
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 判断能力

Sense.DEF: to find an explanation or solution to a problem, by thinking of all the possibilities
to talk to someone in an attempt to persuade them to be more sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to reason with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图和她讲道理。

Sense.DEF: fair and sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reasonable request
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合情合理的要求
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要讲道理﹐你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable completely reasonable question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is reasonable to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems reasonable to assume they’ve been tested.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎有理由认为它们都已经过测试。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had reasonable grounds good reasons but no proof for believing the law had been broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounded like a reasonable enough excuse to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我听来﹐这是个相当合理的借口。

Sense.DEF: fairly good, but not especially good
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a reasonable chance of doing well in the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她考试还是有可能考好的。

Sense.DEF: a reasonable amount is fairly large
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a reasonable amount of money saved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我攒下不少钱了。

Sense.DEF: reasonable prices are not too high
Sense.EXAMPLE: good food at a reasonable price
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格公道的美食

Sense.DEF: if something is proved beyond reasonable doubt, it is shown to be almost certainly true
Sense.TRAN: 排除合理怀疑﹐无合理疑点

Sense.DEF: quite or to a satisfactory degree, but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car is in reasonably good condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车的车况还不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s doing reasonably well at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校表现还算不错。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is right or fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t reasonably be expected to have known that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按理说﹐他是不可能知道那件事的。

Sense.DEF: in a sensible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite her anger, she had behaved very reasonably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虽然生气﹐但表现得很理智。

Sense.DEF: based on careful thought, and therefore sensible
Sense.TRAN: 经过缜密思考的﹐合理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: reasoned argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合乎逻辑的论点

Sense.DEF: a process of thinking carefully about something in order to make a judgment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is the reasoning behind this decision?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作出这个决定的依据是什么？

Sense.DEF: to bring together the different parts of something to make a whole again, after they have been separated
Sense.EXAMPLE: The equipment had to be dismantled and reassembled at each new location.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得把这些设备拆开来﹐到各个新的地方重新组装。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people reassemble, they meet together again after a period apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parliament reassembled after a seven-week break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会休会七周后再次召集。

Sense.DEF: to do or say something to make your position stronger after a period when it seemed weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister aimed to reassert his authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相意在重申他的权威。

Sense.DEF: to state a fact or opinion again, often more strongly or more clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used the opportunity to reassert his position on energy policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他利用这个机会重申他在能源政策方面的立场。

Sense.DEF: if something reasserts itself, it returns or becomes stronger after a period when it was missing or weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last, common sense had reasserted itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐常识占了上风。

Sense.DEF: to think about something again carefully in order to decide whether to change your opinion or judgment about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has caused us to reassess the way we approach our planning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事让我们重新审视了我们的规划方式。

Sense.DEF: something that is said or done which makes someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem
Sense.TRAN: 令人安心的保证﹔能消除疑惧的言行
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents are looking for reassurance about their children’s safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长们在寻找方法保证他们孩子的安全。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are offering practical help and reassurance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在提供切实的帮助和保证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have been given reassurances that the water is safe to drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得到保证说这水可以安全饮用。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation
Sense.TRAN: 使安心﹐使放心﹐使消除疑虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to reassure me that my mother would be okay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图安慰我﹐说我母亲不会有事的。

Sense.DEF: making you feel less worried or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 使人安心的﹐使人放心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reassuring smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人宽心的微笑

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is reassuring (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s reassuring to know that problems are rare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道问题很少﹐这样就能放心了。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is paid back to you when you have paid too much tax, rent etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may be entitled to a tax rebate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许可以享受退税。

Sense.DEF: someone who opposes or fights against people in authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anti-government rebels attacked the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反政府的叛乱分子攻击该镇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rebel leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军首领

Sense.DEF: someone who refuses to do things in the normal way, or in the way that other people want them to
Sense.TRAN: 〔拒绝按常规办事﹑我行我素的〕反叛者﹐叛逆者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex has always been a bit of a rebel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯向来有点叛逆。

Sense.DEF: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: teenage boys rebelling against their parents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不服从父母的青少年

Sense.DEF: if your stomach, legs, mind etc rebel, you cannot do or believe something you think you should
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew he ought to eat, but his stomach rebelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己应该吃点东西﹐但是他的胃在闹别扭。

Sense.DEF: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armed rebellion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装叛乱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rebellion against the military regime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反抗军事政权的叛乱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Bretons rose in rebellion against the King.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布列塔尼人发动起义﹐反对国王。

GramExa.GLOSS: use violence to stop it

Sense.DEF: when someone opposes or fights against people in authority or ideas which they do not agree with
Sense.TRAN: 〔对权威者或不同意见的〕反抗﹐不服从
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rebellion by right-wing members of the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内右翼人士的反对

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rebellion against traditional values
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对传统价值观的反抗

Sense.DEF: deliberately not obeying people in authority or rules of behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: rebellious teenagers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛逆的青少年
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always had a rebellious streak a tendency to rebel .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向来个性叛逆。

Sense.DEF: fighting against the government of your own country
Sense.EXAMPLE: rebellious minorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造反的少数民族

Sense.DEF: when an important idea, feeling, or organization becomes strong or popular again
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑感情或组织的〕再生﹐复兴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rebirth of nationalism in the region
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区民族主义的复兴

Sense.DEF: when something or someone becomes alive again after dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cycle of birth, death and rebirth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生死轮回

Sense.DEF: if you reboot a computer, or if it reboots, you start it up again

Subsense.DEF: to become active or popular again
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the past decade, the city has been reborn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去的十年间﹐这个城市复兴了。

Subsense.DEF: to be born again, especially according to some beliefs, ancient stories etc

Sense.DEF: if a ball or other moving object rebounds, it moves quickly back away from something it has just hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔球或其他运动物体〕弹回﹐反弹﹐跳回

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His shot on goal rebounded off the post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的射门被球门柱弹出。

Sense.DEF: if prices, values etc rebound, they increase again after decreasing
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑价值等下跌后〕回升﹐反弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: Share prices rebounded today after last week’s losses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票价格在上周下跌之后﹐今天出现了反弹。

Sense.DEF:
to catch a
basketball
after a player has tried but failed to get a point
if something bad or unpleasant you have done rebounds on you, it has a bad effect on you
Sense.TRAN: 使自食恶果﹐使自作自受

Subsense.DEF: someone who is on the rebound is upset or confused because their romantic relationship has just ended
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因失恋而〕处于情绪波动的状态
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He first met me when I was on the rebound, after splitting up with Mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一次遇见我时﹐我刚和马克分手﹐心灰意冷。

Subsense.DEF: a ball that is on the rebound has just hit something and is moving back through the air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I caught the ball on the rebound.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接住了弹回的球。

Subsense.DEF: something that is on the rebound is starting to increase or improve again
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The market seems to be on the rebound.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场好像在反弹。

Sense.DEF:
an act of catching a
basketball
after a player has tried but failed to get a point
an unkind or unfriendly answer to a friendly suggestion or offer of help
Sense.TRAN: 〔对善意的建议或帮助作出的〕粗暴回绝﹐断然拒绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received a humiliating rebuff from his manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到经理的断然拒绝﹐十分丢脸。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He rebuffed all her suggestions.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他断然拒绝了她所有的建议。

Sense.DEF: to build something again, after it has been damaged or destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church was completely rebuilt in the last century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂在上个世纪全面重建。

Sense.DEF: to make something strong and successful again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first priority is to rebuild the area’s manufacturing industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当务之急是恢复该地区的制造业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We try to help them rebuild their lives live normally again after something bad has happened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们设法帮助他们重建生活。

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone severely about something they have done wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Members of the jury were sharply rebuked for speaking to the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团成员因向媒体发表言论而受到严厉指责。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a rebuke from the President

Sense.DEF: to prove that a statement or a charge made against you is false

RunOn.EXAMPLE: his firm rebuttal of the accusations
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这些指控的断然驳斥

Sense.DEF: refusing to do what you are told to do, even after you have been punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recalcitrant pupil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名不服管教的学生

Sense.DEF: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I seem to recall I’ve met him before somewhere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像记得以前在哪儿见过他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t recall seeing any cars parked outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不起来看到有车停在外面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t recall who gave me the information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不起是谁告诉我这个信息的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得﹐是你首先提出这个想法的。

Sense.DEF: to officially tell someone to come back to a place or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Ambassador was recalled from Washington.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大使被从华盛顿召回。

Sense.DEF: if a company recalls one of its products, it asks people who have bought it to return it because there may be something wrong with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于发动机缺陷﹐那些汽车必须召回。

Sense.DEF: to bring information back onto the screen of a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔在计算机屏幕上〕重新调出﹐检索〔信息〕

Sense.DEF: if something recalls something else, it makes you think of it because it is very similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: The furnishings recall the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室内陈设让人回想起20世纪60年代。

Sense.DEF: to vote to remove someone from their political position
the ability to remember something that you have learned or experienced
Sense.EXAMPLE: A child’s recall is usually accurate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的记忆力通常很准确。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had total recall remembered everything of every play in the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛中的一招一式他都记得清清楚楚。

Sense.DEF: an official order telling someone to return to a place, especially before they expected to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recall of their ambassador
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将他们的大使召回

Sense.DEF: impossible to bring back or remember
when a company asks people to return a product they have bought because there may be something wrong with it
a vote to remove someone from their political position, or the act of being removed by a vote

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recall of four city council members
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢免四名市政会成员

Sense.DEF: to say publicly that you no longer have a political or religious belief that you had before
Sense.TRAN: 公开宣布放弃（以前的政治观点或宗教信仰）

Sense.DEF: to repeat the main points of something that has just been said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me just recap what’s been discussed so far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来扼要复述一下已讨论过的内容吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: to recap on the previous lecture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对前一节课作一下概括

Sense.DEF: to repeat the main points of something that has just been said
to bring back the same feelings or qualities that you experienced in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film really recaptures the atmosphere of those days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片确实重现了那个年代的氛围。

Sense.DEF: to catch a prisoner or animal that has escaped
Sense.TRAN: 重新抓获〔逃犯或逃脱的动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was recaptured after nearly two weeks on the run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逃亡将近两周后再次被抓获。

Sense.DEF: to take control of a place again by fighting for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to recapture the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收复这座城市的尝试

Sense.DEF: to give something a new shape or a new form of organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to recast the statement in less formal language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不太正式的语言改写声明的尝试

Sense.DEF: to give parts in a play or film to different actors
Sense.TRAN: 更换〔戏剧﹑电影中的〕演员﹐重新安排〔角色〕

Sense.EXAMPLE: a quick recce of the area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该地区进行的快速侦察

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=received收讫

Sense.DEF: if something you can see or hear recedes, it gets further and further away until it disappears
Sense.TRAN: 〔景物﹑声音〕逐渐远去（直至消失）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: footsteps receding into the distance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐渐远去的脚步声

Sense.DEF: if a memory, feeling, or possibility recedes, it gradually goes away
Sense.TRAN: 〔记忆〕逐渐模糊﹔〔感情〕逐渐淡漠﹔〔可能性〕逐渐消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain in his head gradually receded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头痛逐渐缓解。

Sense.DEF: if water recedes, it moves back from an area that it was covering
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flood waters finally began to recede in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 11 月﹐洪水终于开始退去。

Sense.DEF: if your hair recedes, you gradually lose the hair at the front of your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in his mid-forties, with a receding hairline .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他四十五六岁﹐发际线已开始往后移了。

Sense.DEF: a chin that slopes backwards
a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保留收据以备退货之需。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure you get receipts for everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每件东西都一定要拿收据。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a receipt?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我一个收条吗？

Sense.DEF: when someone receives something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the closing date for receipt of applications
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受申请的截止日期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The booking will be made on receipt of a deposit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一收到订金就进行预订。

GramExa.GLOSS: to have received something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某物收讫﹐已经收到某物

Sense.DEF: the money that a business, bank, or government receives
Sense.TRAN: 〔企业﹑银行﹑政府的〕收款﹐进款﹔收入
Sense.EXAMPLE: total revenue receipts of $18.4 million
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1,840万美元的财政总收入

Sense.DEF: needing or waiting to be paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s accounts receivable sales that have been made but not yet paid for
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的应收款项

Sense.DEF: amounts of money that are owed to a company
to be given something
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the children will receive a small gift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She received an honorary degree from Harvard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了哈佛大学的荣誉学位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She received no support from her parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有得到父母的支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They will be entitled to receive unemployment benefit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将有资格领取失业救济金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went up to receive his award from the mayor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上前接受市长颁奖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 16 to 18-year-olds receiving full-time education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受全日制教育的16到18岁青少年

Sense.EXAMPLE: Lee received 324 votes 324 people voted for him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李得到324票。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Receive is a rather formal word, which is used especially in written English. In everyday English, people usually use get .
F2NBox.TRAN: receive 是一个较为正式的单词﹐尤用于英语书面语。在日常英语中﹐人们一般用 get
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What did you get for your birthday?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你生日收到了什么礼物？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She got a degree from York University.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在约克大学取得了学位。

Sense.DEF: to get a letter, message, or telephone call, or something which someone has sent you
Sense.TRAN: 接到﹐收到〔信件﹑消息﹑电话等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He received a letter from his insurance company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到他的保险公司寄来的一封信。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you would like to receive further information , return the attached form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲收到详细资料﹐请交回所附表格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have received numerous complaints about the noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经收到很多对噪音的投诉。

Sense.DEF: if you receive a particular type of medical treatment, it is done to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received hospital treatment for a cut over his eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼部受伤﹐接受了医院的治疗。

Sense.DEF: to react in a particular way to a suggestion, idea, performance etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was well received by critics they said it was good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影评家们对这部电影反响良好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received the news in silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听了这个消息默不作声。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on/at the receiving end (of sth)
Sense.DEF: to be the person who is affected by someone else’s actions, usually in an unpleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 承受〔通常指不愉快之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found herself on the receiving end of racist abuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己遭到种族虐待。

Sense.DEF: to be injured or hit
to officially accept someone as a guest or member of a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She isn’t well enough to receive visitors yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体还不是很好﹐不能见客。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was later received into the Church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她后来被接纳入教。

Subsense.DEF: if a radio or television receives radio waves or other signals, it makes them become sounds or pictures
Subsense.TRAN: 〔收音机﹑电视〕接收到〔无线电或电视信号〕

Subsense.DEF: to be able to hear a radio message that someone is sending
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Receiving you loud and clear!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “听到﹐信号响亮清楚！”

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs receive and get in spoken and written English. 动词receive和get在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
Receive is more formal than get. receive比get正式。

Sense.DEF: accepted or considered to be correct by most people

GramExa.GLOSS: the opinion most people have
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The received wisdom is that he will retire within the next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家普遍认为他将于明年之内退休。

Sense.DEF: the part of a telephone that you hold next to your mouth and ear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She picked up the receiver and dialled his number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起听筒﹐拨了他的电话号码。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is officially in charge of a business or company that is
bankrupt
Sense.TRAN: 〔破产企业或公司的〕管理人﹐接管人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is in the hands of the receivers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司现在由破产管理人接管。

Sense.DEF: someone who buys and sells stolen property
a radio or television, or other equipment which receives signals
Sense.TRAN: 无线电接收机﹔收音机﹔电视机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a satellite receiver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫星信号接收器

Sense.DEF: a player in American football who is in a position to catch the ball
if a business is in receivership, it is controlled by an official receiver because it has no money
Sense.TRAN: 破产管理﹐破产产业接管
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company went into receivership with massive debts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司负债累累﹐已经由破产管理人接管。

Sense.DEF: the crime of buying and selling stolen goods
having happened or started only a short time ago
Sense.TRAN: 最近的﹐不久前的﹐近来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Irving’s most recent book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文最新的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: recent research into the causes of cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来对致癌原因的研究

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The situation has improved in recent years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来形势有所好转。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the recent past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久前

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say in the last/past few weeks/months/years etc rather than in recent weeks/months etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 in the last/past few weeks/months/years﹐而不说 in recent weeks/months/years
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Things have been pretty busy in the last few weeks .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几周事务相当繁忙。

Sense.DEF: not long ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近晋升为经理助理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recently published biography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部最近出版的传记
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近﹐他出演了多部英国电影。

Exponent.DEF: not long ago, especially a few days, weeks, or months ago
Exponent.TRAN: 最近﹐近来〔尤指几天﹑几星期或几个月之前〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The President has recently returned from a tour of South America.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统最近刚出访南美归来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A new species of plant was recently discovered in Brazil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近在巴西发现了一个新的植物物种。

Exponent.DEF: during the recent past, especially during the weeks or days closest to now
Exponent.TRAN: 最近〔尤指在刚过去的几星期或几天之内〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been really busy lately so I haven’t been out much.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近实在很忙﹐所以不大出去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There hasn’t been much in the news lately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近没什么新闻。

Exponent.DEF: a very short time ago, especially only a few minutes, hours, days, or weeks ago
Exponent.TRAN: 刚才﹐刚刚〔尤指几分钟﹑几小时﹑几天或几星期之前〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John’s just gone out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰刚出去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve just had a new baby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们刚生了个孩子。

Exponent.DEF: not long ago – often used when you are not sure exactly when
Exponent.TRAN: 不久前〔常用于表示不确定何时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That house was sold a short while ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子不久前卖掉了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I looked in on her a little while ago and she was fast asleep.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚才我去看她﹐她睡得正熟。

Exponent.DEF: recently, especially only a few days ago
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I met Lucy in town the other day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几天前我在镇上遇到了露西。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’ll never guess what happened to me the other day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你永远也猜不出前几天我碰到了什么事。

Exponent.DEF: made, prepared, done etc not long ago – used especially about food, drink, and also things that have just been painted, washed, or dug
Exponent.TRAN: 新近〔尤用于食品或饮料﹐也用于刚粉刷好﹑洗好或挖好之物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: freshly baked bread
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚出炉的面包
Exponent.EXAMPLE: freshly squeezed orange juice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜榨橙汁
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boat had been freshly painted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船刚漆过。

Exponent.DEF: created, built, married etc not long ago
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the newly created position of Chief Designer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新设的首席设计师一职
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a newly married couple
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新婚夫妻
Exponent.EXAMPLE: their newly elected president
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们新当选的总统

Sense.DEF: a container for putting things in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trash receptacle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾箱

Sense.DEF: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了这些事后﹐她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The delegates gave him a warm reception .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表团热烈欢迎他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His ideas met with a hostile reception.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点遭到强烈反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got a great reception from the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到人群的热烈欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plans received a mixed reception from unions some people liked them, others did not .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

Subsense.DEF: the desk or office where visitors arriving in a hotel or large organization go first
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Please leave your key at the reception desk .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把你的钥匙留在接待处。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I asked the man at reception.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问了接待处的人。

Subsense.DEF: the area around or in front of this desk or office
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll wait for you in reception.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在前厅等你。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the reception area
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接待区

Sense.DEF: a large formal party to celebrate an event or to welcome someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an ideal location for a wedding reception .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里是举办喜宴的理想地点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The occasion was marked by a civic reception .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市里举行招待会庆祝这个特别的时刻。

Sense.DEF: the act of receiving radio, television, or other signals, or the quality of signals you receive
Sense.TRAN: 〔无线电或电视等信号的〕接收（效果）
Sense.EXAMPLE: listeners complaining about poor reception
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱怨接收效果不好的听众

Sense.DEF: the act of catching the ball in American football
a place where people who have no home, especially people who have had to leave their homes, can go for food, help etc and to stay for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔为无家可归者提供临时食宿的〕收容所

Sense.DEF:
the first class of a
primary school
, which children go to aged 4 or 5
Sense.TRAN: 〔4或5岁儿童上的〕学前班﹐小学预备班

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to welcome and deal with people arriving in a hotel or office building, visiting a doctor etc
a room in a private house that is not a kitchen, bedroom, or bathroom – used by people who sell houses
Sense.TRAN: 客厅﹐会客室〔此词为出售房屋者使用〕

Sense.DEF: willing to consider new ideas or listen to someone else’s opinions
Sense.TRAN: 〔对新思想或他人意见〕乐于接受的﹐愿意倾听的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You might find them in a more receptive mood tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他们明天会更乐于接受意见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a receptive audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿意倾听的观众

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a workforce that is receptive to new ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐于接受新观念的员工

Sense.DEF: a nerve ending which receives information about changes in light, heat etc and causes the body to react in particular ways
a time during the day or year when no work is done, especially in parliament, law courts etc
Sense.TRAN: 暂停﹔休息﹔休会（期）﹔休庭（期）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parliament’s summer recess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会的夏季休会期

Sense.DEF: a short period of time between lessons at a school when children can go outdoors and play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her favorite things at school are music and recess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在学校最喜欢的是音乐课和课间休息。

Sense.DEF: a space in the wall of a room, especially for shelves, cupboards etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔墙壁上用以嵌装架子﹑柜等的〕凹进处﹔壁龛

Sense.DEF: the inner hidden parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deep recesses of the cave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洞穴的幽深处
Sense.EXAMPLE: fears hidden away in the darker recesses of her mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐藏在她内心深处的恐惧

Sense.DEF: if a government, law court etc recesses, it officially stops work for a period of time
fitted into a part of a wall that is further back than the rest of the wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recessed bookshelf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌进墙壁的书架

Sense.DEF: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic recession of the early 1980s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is deep recession in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to pull the country out of recession
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 推动国家走出经济衰退的努力

Sense.DEF: relating to a recession or likely to cause one
Sense.EXAMPLE: recessionary pressures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退的压力

Sense.DEF:
a recessive
gene
is passed to children from their parents only if both parents have the gene

to put a new supply of electricity into a
battery
to get back your strength and energy again
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to spend a week in the mountains to recharge my batteries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备去山里待一个星期﹐恢复一下精力。

Sense.DEF:
a machine that recharges a
battery
a recherché subject, idea, word etc is uncommon and has been chosen to make people admire your knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 〔所选的话题﹑观点﹑字眼等〕生僻的﹐罕见的〔以炫耀自己知识渊博〕

Sense.DEF:
to put a new computer
chip
into a piece of electronic equipment such as a
mobile phone
or a computer games machine so that you can use software that you are not supposed to use, or use a service that you have not paid for
Sense.TRAN: 给…装上新的芯[晶]片〔以非法使用某软件或服务〕

Sense.DEF: a criminal who starts doing illegal things again, even after he or she has been punished
a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recipe for tomato soup
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 番茄汤的做法

Sense.EXAMPLE: a recipe book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本烹饪书

Sense.DEF: to be likely to cause a particular result, often a bad one
Sense.TRAN: 可能会造成某事〔常指坏的结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said that five small boys on skis was a recipe for disaster , not a holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说五个来滑雪的小男孩就不是来度假的﹐而是来闯祸的。

Sense.DEF: someone who receives something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺贝尔和平奖得主

Sense.DEF: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke of the necessity for a reciprocal relationship that would be useful for all sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

Sense.DEF: to do or give something, because something similar has been done or given to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he spoke I was expected to reciprocate with some remark of my own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在说话时﹐我也应该说点什么回应他。

Sense.DEF: to feel the same about someone as they feel about you
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a hopeless love that could not possibly be reciprocated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一种无望的爱﹐不可能得到回报。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people, groups, or countries give each other similar kinds of help or special rights
a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one performer
Sense.TRAN: 演奏会﹔演唱会﹔朗诵会〔一般由一个人表演〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piano recital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴独奏会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recital of classical favourites
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经典名曲演奏会

Sense.DEF: a spoken description of a series of events
Sense.TRAN: 〔对一连串事件的〕叙述﹐口头描述

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long recital of her adventures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大谈特谈她的奇遇

Sense.DEF: an act of saying a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: recitations from the great poets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背诵伟大诗人的诗

Sense.DEF: a spoken description of an event or a series of events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went into a recitation of his life from the earliest years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从早年生活开始﹐逐一述说他的经历。

Sense.DEF:
a speech set to music that is sung by one person and continues the story of an
opera musical play
between the songs
to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: She recited a poem that she had learnt at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她背诵了一首学校里学的诗。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone a series or list of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Len recited the breakfast menu - cereal, bacon and eggs, and toast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱恩报出早餐菜单——麦片﹑熏猪肉煎蛋和烤面包片。

Sense.DEF: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions
Sense.TRAN: 轻率的﹔鲁莽的﹔不顾后果的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reckless disregard for safety
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon without caring about the danger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

Sense.DEF: to think or suppose something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you reckon he’ll agree to see us?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为他会同意见我们吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police reckon that whoever killed Dad was with him earlier that day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为杀害爸爸的人那天早些时候就和他在一起。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon used to express doubt or disagreement ?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

Sense.DEF: to guess a number or amount, without calculating it exactly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We reckon that sitting in traffic jams costs us around $9 billion a year in lost output.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们估计﹐交通堵塞造成的延误使我们每年损失90亿美元左右的产值。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The average selling price for flats in the area was reckoned to be around £200,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区公寓房的平均售价估计在20万英镑左右。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone or something is a particular kind of person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Lowsons were reckoned to be very good farmers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛森一家被认为是非常出色的农场主。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moving house is reckoned to be nearly as stressful as divorce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家被认为几乎和离婚一样劳心费神。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An earthquake of magnitude 7 is reckoned as a major quake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 7级地震被认为是大地震。

Sense.DEF: to calculate an amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The expression ‘full moon’ means the fourteenth day of the moon reckoned from its first appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所谓“满月”是指从新月初现算起的第14天。

Sense.DEF: to expect something to happen, when you are making plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were reckoning on a profit of about half a million a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预计每年能赢利约50万。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was reckoning on getting at least 60% of the votes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望能获得至少60%的选票。

Sense.DEF: to add up amounts, costs etc in order to get a total
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pat was reckoning up the cost of everything in her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特在心算全部花销。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is powerful and must be regarded seriously as a possible opponent, competitor, danger etc
Sense.TRAN: 必须认真考虑[对待]的某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barcelona will be a force to be reckoned with this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴塞罗那队将是这个赛季不可忽视的一支球队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The principal was certainly a woman to be reckoned with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长无疑是一个厉害的女人。

Sense.DEF: to not consider a possible problem when you are making plans
Sense.TRAN: 没有考虑到某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had not reckoned with the excitement in the popular press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有料到会在通俗报刊上引起如此轰动。

Sense.DEF: to have to deal with someone or something powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any invader would have the military might of NATO to reckon with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何入侵者都将面对北约的军事力量。

Sense.DEF: if you are reckoning without something, you do not expect it and are not prepared for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They doubted that Fiona could finish the course, but they reckoned without her determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们怀疑菲奥娜能否读完课程﹐但他们没有考虑到她的决心。

Sense.DEF: calculation that is based on a careful guess rather than on exact knowledge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By my reckoning, we have 12,000 clients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我估计﹐我们有1.2万名客户。

Sense.DEF: a time when you are judged or punished for your actions, or when they have results that affect you
Sense.TRAN: 最后审判日﹐算总账﹔报应﹐惩罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: We know that you will not forget their crimes when their day of reckoning comes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道﹐等到审判的日子来临时你不会忘记他们的罪行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the final reckoning , the president failed to achieve his major goals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后算起来﹐总统没有实现他的主要目标。

Sense.DEF: among or not among those who are likely to win or be successful, especially in sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛中〕有/没有获胜的可能
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a knee injury, which put him out of the reckoning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他膝部受伤﹐失去了获胜的可能。

Sense.DEF: to get back an amount of money that you have paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

Sense.DEF: to make an area of desert, wet land etc suitable for farming or building
Sense.EXAMPLE: This land will be reclaimed for a new airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地将被开发用来建新机场。

Sense.DEF: to get back something that you have lost or that has been taken away from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to reclaim the championship that I lost in 1999.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想夺回1999年失去的冠军称号。

Sense.DEF: to obtain useful products from waste material
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can reclaim old boards and use them as shelves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧木板可以废物利用﹐当搁板。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: land reclamation

Sense.DEF: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent Sunday reclining in a deck chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期天一整天都躺在帆布折椅里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A solitary figure was reclining on the grass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个孤零零的人斜躺在草地上。

Sense.DEF: if you recline a seat, or if it reclines, you lower the back of the seat so that you can lean back in it
a chair in which you can lean back at different angles
someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She became a recluse after her two sons were murdered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个儿子被杀后﹐她就一直离群索居。

Sense.DEF: the act of realizing and accepting that something is true or important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’s recognition of the importance of Suzy in his life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐认识到苏济在他生命中的重要性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is general recognition that the study techniques of many students are weak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认识到很多学生学习技巧薄弱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: official recognition of the need for jail reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方承认监狱需要改革

Sense.DEF: public respect and thanks for someone’s work or achievements
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has achieved recognition and respect as a scientist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为科学家﹐他得到人们的赞赏和尊敬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The importance of voluntary organizations in the economy still needs to be given recognition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿组织在经济中的重要性仍有待承认。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was presented with a gold watch in recognition of his service to the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获授一枚金表﹐以嘉奖他为公司效力。

Sense.DEF: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着她看﹐但似乎没认出她来。

GramExa.GLOSS: change completely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bakery business has changed beyond all recognition in the last 10 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烘焙行业在过去十年里发生了彻底的改变。

Sense.DEF: the act of officially accepting that an organization, government, person etc has legal or official authority

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recognition of Latvia as an independent state
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式承认拉脱维亚为一个独立国家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s failure to achieve international recognition
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政府未能得到国际社会的承认

Sense.DEF: the ability of a computer to recognize speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: speech recognition systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语音识别系统

Sense.DEF: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是疟疾﹐但李医生没有认出症状。

Sense.DEF: to officially accept that an organization, government, document etc has legal or official authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: British medical qualifications are recognized in Canada.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的行医资格在加拿大也被认可。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The World Health Organization has recognized alcoholism as a disease since 1951.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界卫生组织从1951年以来就已承认酗酒是一种疾病。

Sense.DEF: to accept or admit that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is important to recognize how little we know about this disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要承认我们对这种疾病知之甚少﹐这很重要。

Sense.DEF: if something is recognized by people, they realize that it is important or very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alexander tried to get his work recognized by the medical profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历山大设法让医学界承认他的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lawrence’s novel was eventually recognized as a work of genius.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦斯的小说终于被认为是天才之作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a recognized authority on Roman pottery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古罗马陶器的公认权威

Sense.DEF: to officially and publicly thank someone for something they have done, by giving them a special honour
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was recognized for having saved many lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为救了很多人的生命而受到嘉奖。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His face was instantly recognizable .

Exponent.DEF: to know who someone is or what something is, especially because you have seen or heard them before
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因以前见过或听过而〕认出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t seen her for ten years, but I recognized her immediately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十年没见她﹐但一下子就认出她了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you recognize this song?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能听出这是哪首歌吗？

Exponent.DEF: to recognize someone or something and say who or what they are
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As they came closer, I was able to identify two of the group.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走近些了﹐我才认出这群人中的两个人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s delicious but I can’t quite identify the taste.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很好吃﹐但我辨不出是什么东西的味道。

Exponent.DEF: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: By this age, kids can usually distinguish between right and wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这个年龄﹐孩子一般能够辨明对错了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s often difficult to distinguish identical twins from each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 同卵双胞胎往往很难分辨。

Exponent.DEF: to be able to see or hear something or someone – used when it is very difficult to do this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the distance, I could just make out the outline of an island.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远远地﹐我仅能辨认出岛的轮廓。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He whispered something but I couldn’t make out what it was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小声说了些什么﹐但我听不清。

Exponent.DEF: to notice or understand something by looking carefully or thinking about it carefully
Exponent.TRAN: 〔仔细察看或思考后〕觉察﹐辨明
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I thought I discerned a faint gleam of hope in his eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我看到他眼中有一丝希望。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A number of differences can be discerned in the data for the three countries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这三个国家的数据中可以看出许多不同。

Exponent.DEF: to recognize someone or something. Know is often used in everyday English instead of recognize .
Exponent.TRAN: 认出〔日常英语中常用know﹐而不用recognize〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you know that it is real gold?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么看得出那是真金？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I know him from somewhere .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在哪儿见过他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember his name, but I know his face .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不得他的名字﹐但我认得他的脸。

Exponent.DEF: to be able to recognize someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I could tell that it was him by his voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 听声音我就知道是他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you tell that it’s not real leather?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看出那不是真皮吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to be able to tell them apart to recognize that they are different .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们很难区分。

Sense.DEF: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She recoiled from his touch as if she had been slapped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一碰她﹐她便往后缩﹐仿佛被打了一巴掌。

Sense.DEF: to feel such a strong dislike of a particular situation that you want to avoid it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因强烈厌恶某情形而〕退缩﹔踌躇不前

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He recoils from everything in life that demands hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活中凡是需要付出努力的事﹐他都踌躇不前。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦﹐我们就会恐惧地退缩。

Sense.DEF: if a gun recoils, it moves backwards very quickly after it has been fired

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The recoil of the gun sent him flying backwards.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那门炮的后坐力使他向后弹了出去。

Sense.DEF: to be able to remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I recollect is a grey sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只记得一片灰色的天空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She recollected sadly that she and Ben used to laugh a lot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤心地回忆起以前她和本经常笑声不断。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you recollect how your brother reacted?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得你弟弟是什么反应吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I recollect seeing Ryder some years ago in Bonn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得几年前在波恩见过赖德。

Sense.DEF: something from the past that you remember
Sense.EXAMPLE: My earliest recollections are of my mother bending over my cot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最早的记忆是母亲俯身站在我的小床前。

Sense.DEF: an act of remembering something

GramExa.GLOSS: not remember
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no recollection of how I found my way there in the dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不记得自己是怎样在黑暗中找到那里的。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you are unsure if you remember correctly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 我记得﹔如果我没有记错的话
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the best of my recollection, she drives a Mercedes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我没有记错的话﹐她开的是一辆梅赛德斯。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one, to my recollection, gave a second thought to the risks involved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我记忆中﹐没有人认真想过其中的风险。

Sense.DEF: to begin something again after it has stopped
to advise someone to do something, especially because you have special knowledge of a situation or subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I recommend that you get some professional advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你咨询专家的意见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors strongly recommend that fathers should be present at their baby’s birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生极力建议孩子出生时父亲应该在场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would never recommend using a sunbed on a regular basis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不建议经常使用太阳灯浴床。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sleeping tablets are not recommended in this case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情况下不建议使用安眠药。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is dangerous to exceed the recommended dose .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过建议剂量很危险。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘recommend (someone) to do something’. Say 而要说 recommend doing something or 或 recommend that someone (should) do something

Sense.DEF: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我推荐黄油焗鸡﹐非常好吃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I recommend this book to anyone with an interest in chemistry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这本书推荐给所有对化学感兴趣的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Which type of oil do you recommend for my car?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你建议我的车使用哪种类型的汽油？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have decided to recommend you for the directorship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定推荐你担任董事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is highly recommended.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人都推荐这家宾馆。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘recommend someone something’. Just say 只需说 recommend something, or say 或是说 recommend something to someone.

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth has much/little/nothing to recommend it
Sense.DEF: used to say that something has many, few, or no good qualities
Sense.TRAN: 某物有很多/少有/毫无可取之处
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town itself has little to recommend it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇本身乏善可陈。

Exponent.DEF: to advise someone to do something, especially when you have special knowledge of a situation or subject
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指对某情况或课题有专门知识的人〕劝告建议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I would strongly recommend buying a good quality bicycle rather than a cheap one.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我强烈建议购买质量好的自行车﹐而不要买便宜的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report recommended stricter supervision of the trade in live animals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告建议对活畜贸易实施更严格的监管。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone that you think they should do something, especially in order to avoid problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve been told that we should start revising early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被告知应尽早开始复习。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I told you not to drink the water here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉过你不要喝这里的水。

Exponent.DEF: to strongly advise someone to do something because you think it is very important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her doctor has urged her to see a specialist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的医生催促她去找专家看看。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police are urging drivers not to come into London this weekend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方力劝驾车者本周末不要来伦敦。

Exponent.DEF: to say publicly that something should be done, often something that a lot of people disagree about
Exponent.TRAN: 倡导﹐鼓吹〔常指许多人不赞同的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1984, he advocated the use of force against Nicaragua.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1984年﹐他主张对尼加拉瓜动武。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I am surprised that dentists don’t advocate the use of fluoride tablets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很奇怪牙医不提倡使用氟化物片剂。

Exponent.DEF: to say in an advertisement that you like a product and think that people should use it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A lot of companies use sports stars to endorse their products.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司用体育明星来为自己的产品做广告。

Sense.DEF: official advice given to someone, especially about what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将审查此案﹐然后向当事人提出建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: recommendations for school reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校改革的建议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main recommendations of the report
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的主要建议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are making no recommendation that children should use Standard English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们并不是建议儿童一定要使用标准英语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recommendation to replace the existing system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 更换现有系统的建议

Sense.DEF: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

Sense.DEF: a formal letter or statement saying that someone would be a suitable person to do a job, take a course of study etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to get letters of recommendation from bosses and colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设法得到老板和同事的推荐信。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a payment for trouble or losses that you have caused them, or a reward for their efforts to help you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The charge recompenses the bank for the costs involved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项收费填补了银行的相关费用。

Sense.DEF: something that you give to someone for trouble or losses that you have caused them, or as a reward for their help

GramExa.EXAMPLE: financial recompense for the victims of violence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对暴力受害者的经济补偿

Sense.DEF: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bevan tried to reconcile British socialism with a wider international vision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比万试图用更广阔的国际视野来协调英国的社会主义。

Sense.DEF: to have a good relationship again with someone after you have quarrelled with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jonah and his youngest son were, on the surface at least, reconciled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔纳和他小儿子和好了﹐至少表面上如此。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that two people make up rather than saying that they are reconciled .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示两人和好一般说 make up﹐而不说 be reconciled
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They had a fight, but they seem to have made up now.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吵过一架﹐不过现在似乎和好了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone able to accept a difficult or unpleasant situation
Sense.TRAN: 使接受〔困难或不愉快的情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to reconcile his father to the idea of the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图让父亲接受他对婚礼的打算。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry had more or less reconciled himself to Don’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利差不多已经接受了唐的死亡。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人或国家等的〕和解﹔修好
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her ex-husband had always hoped for a reconciliation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的前夫一直想和她重归于好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting achieved a reconciliation between the groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议使各团体达成了和解。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: his reconciliation with his brother
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们兄弟俩的重归于好

Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty has brought a new spirit of reconciliation on both sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约使双方产生了新的和解精神。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leadership announced a programme of national reconciliation an attempt by all sides to end a war or trouble in a country .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导层宣布了一个国内各方和解方案。

Sense.DEF: the process of finding a way that two beliefs, facts etc that are opposed to each other can both be true or successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个对立的信念或事实等的〕相互适应﹔和谐﹔一致

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reconciliation between environment and development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境和开发的协调

Sense.DEF: recondite facts or subjects are not known about or understood by many people
to repair something, especially an old machine, so that it works like a new one
Sense.TRAN: 修理﹐修复﹐修整〔尤指旧机器〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reconditioned engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻新的发动机

Sense.DEF: the military activity of sending soldiers and aircraft to find out about the enemy’s forces
Sense.EXAMPLE: reconnaissance aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦察机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reconnaissance mission
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦察任务
Sense.EXAMPLE: wartime roles such as observation and reconnaissance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监视和侦察等战时任务

Sense.DEF: to try to find out the position and size of your enemy’s army, for example by flying planes over land where their soldiers are
to find out information about an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: All morning, the world’s top cyclists have been reconnoitring the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界一流的自行车选手整个早上都在勘察赛道。

Sense.DEF: to think again about something in order to decide if you should change your opinion or do something different
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should reconsider his decision to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他应该重新考虑辞职的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want you to come. Please reconsider.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望你来﹐请你重新考虑一下。

Sense.DEF: to form an organization or a group again in a different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committees will be reconstituted after the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会将在选举后改组。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1832 the firm was reconstituted as Mills and Co.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1832年公司重组﹐改名为米尔斯公司。

Sense.DEF: to change dried food back to its original form by adding water to it
Sense.TRAN: 使〔脱水食物〕恢复原状﹔使复原
Sense.EXAMPLE: reconstituted milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复原乳

Sense.DEF: to produce a complete description or copy of an event by collecting together pieces of information
Sense.TRAN: 〔由零碎的信息〕重现〔事情全貌〕﹐使〔完整的情景〕再现
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police were reconstructing the movements of the murdered couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在重现这对被害夫妇的行为活动。

Sense.DEF: to build something again after it has been destroyed or damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: The task ahead is to reconstruct the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼前的任务是要重建这栋大楼。

Sense.DEF: the work that is done to repair the damage to a city, industry etc, especially after a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the reconstruction of Western Europe after the war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后西欧的重建

Sense.DEF: a description or copy of an event or a place, which you produce by collecting information about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Detectives want to stage a reconstruction of events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探想要再现事件的经过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a reconstruction of a Roman villa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马别墅的重现

Sense.DEF: a reconstructive operation is one done to make a part of someone’s body the right shape, for example after a bad injury or a previous operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s recovering well from reconstructive surgery on his nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鼻子整形后恢复得很好。

Sense.DEF: if a meeting, a court etc reconvenes, or if you reconvene it, it meets again after a break
Sense.TRAN: 重新集合﹔重新召集[召开]

Sense.DEF: information about something that is written down or stored on computer, film etc so that it can be looked at in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try to keep a record of everything I spend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量把所有的花销都记录下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据官方记录﹐去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

Sense.DEF: the fastest speed, longest distance, highest or lowest level etc that has ever been achieved or reached, especially in sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: The American team set a new world record in the sprint relay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国队在短跑接力赛中创了一项新的世界纪录。

Sense.DEF: a round flat piece of plastic with a hole in the middle that music and sound are stored on
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent a lot of time listening to records .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了很多时间听唱片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad’s got a huge record collection .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲收藏有大量的唱片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major British record company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的一家大型唱片公司

Sense.DEF: the facts about how successful, good, bad etc someone or something has been in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人或某事物过去的〕记录﹔经历﹔履历

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chemistry graduates have a good record in finding employment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学专业的毕业生就业一向容易。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s track record in improving conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司在改善工作条件方面的成绩记录

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Davis defended the government’s record on unemployment what they have done about unemployment .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯先生为政府解决失业问题所做的努力辩护。

Sense.DEF: information kept by the police that shows someone has committed a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s only 18 and he already has a record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他才18岁﹐就已经有了犯罪记录。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won’t employ anyone with a criminal record.
