Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不会雇用有前科的人。

Sense.DEF: if someone is in the record books, they have achieved more than anyone else in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hopes to get into the record books by becoming the youngest woman to hold a pilot’s licence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想成为持有飞行员执照的最年轻女性﹐从而被载入史册。

Sense.DEF: very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was out of bed and ready for school in record time that morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天早上她以最快的速度起床准备上学。

Sense.DEF: if you say something off the record, you do not want people to repeat what you say, for example in newspapers or meetings
Sense.TRAN: 非正式的﹔私下说的﹔不得引用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I talk to you, strictly off the record?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能和你私下谈谈吗？

Sense.DEF: to say something publicly or officially, so that it may be written down and repeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is on record as saying that teachers are under too much pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她公开说教师的压力太大。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what you are saying should be remembered or written down
Sense.TRAN: 郑重声明〔用于告诉某人自己所说的话应该被记住或记下〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the record, the police never charged me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要郑重声明﹐警方从来没有起诉我。

Sense.DEF: to tell people the truth about something, because you want to be sure that they understand what the truth really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would like to set the record straight on a few points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想澄清几点。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 1

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Official records show that 44 businesses have stopped trading in the last 12 months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方记录表明﹐在过去12个月中﹐有44家公司中止了贸易。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers keep a record of students’ progress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师对学生的进步情况进行记录。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially say something or write it down
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 公开宣布某事﹔把某事记录在案
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wish to put on record my objection to the scheme.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想对这个计划公开表示反对。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be able to look at them

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Where written records do survive, they are incomplete.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使那些保存下来的书面记录也并不完整。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Using historical records, we have produced an image of the temple.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们利用历史记载﹐绘制出了那座寺庙的图样。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This has been the wettest winter since official records began.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是自有官方记录以来雨水最多的一个冬季。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many hospitals did not keep accurate records.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多医院没有建立精确档案。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 病历/医院记录/健康记录等

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: records of births, deaths etc, that the public are allowed to look at

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Last summer was one of the hottest on record.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年夏天是有记录以来最热的夏天之一。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do better or be greater than an existing record
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He broke the world record twice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两次打破世界纪录。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Davies holds the record for most points in a season.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯保持着单赛季得分最多的纪录。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: achieve it for the first time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The twenty-year-old set a new British record of 44.47 secs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位20岁的年轻人创造了44.47秒的新英国纪录。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do as well as the record

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price of oil has hit an all-time record.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价创历史新高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Powell equalled the 100 metres world record with a time of 9.77 seconds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍威尔平了9.77秒的百米世界纪录。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 英国/美国/意大利等纪录
创纪录的数字/水平/时间等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pollution in the lake has reached record levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖水污染达到了空前的程度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The stock market reached a record high on August 21.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月21日股市创出新高。

Sense.DEF: to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband made her record every penny she spent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He recorded that the operation was successful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在记录里说手术很成功。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1892 it is recorded that the weather became so cold that the river froze over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据记录﹐1892年天气非常寒冷﹐整条河都结冰了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 验尸官作出了意外死亡的结论。

Sense.DEF:
to store music, sound, television programmes etc on tape or
disc s
so that people can listen to them or watch them again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group has just recorded a new album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组合刚录制了一张新专辑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the machine still recording?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那机器还在录吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll record the film and we can all watch it later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把电影录下来﹐我们稍后可以一起看。

Sense.DEF: if an instrument records the size, speed, temperature etc of something, it measures it and keeps that information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wind speeds of up to 100 mph have been recorded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经记录到高达每小时100英里的风速。

Sense.DEF: a record-breaking number, level, performance, or person is the highest, lowest, biggest, best etc of its type that has ever happened or existed
Sense.EXAMPLE: his record-breaking flight across the Atlantic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他破纪录的跨越大西洋的飞行

Sense.DEF: if you send a letter or package by recorded delivery, you send it using a service which records that it has been sent and delivered
a piece of electrical equipment that records music, films etc
Sense.TRAN: 盒式录音机/磁带录音机/录像机等

Sense.DEF: a simple wooden or plastic musical instrument like a tube with holes in it, which you play by blowing into it and covering different holes with your fingers to change the notes
a judge in a city court, in some areas of Britain and the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔英﹑美某些地区市法院的〕法官

Sense.DEF: the person who has achieved the fastest speed, the longest distance etc in a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: the world long-jump record-holder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳远的世界纪录保持者

Sense.DEF:
music, speech, or images that have been stored on tape or
disc s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you heard the new recording of Mozart’s Requiem?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听过莫扎特《安魂曲》的新录制版本吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a video recording of the interview
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 采访的录像

Sense.DEF:
the act of storing sound or images on tape or
disc s

GramExa.GLOSS: a studio etc used for recording music

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment for playing records
to tell someone a story or describe a series of events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan recounted how he and Joyce had met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦讲述了他和乔伊丝相识的经过。

Sense.DEF: a second count of votes that happens in an election because the result was very close
Sense.TRAN: 重新计算选票﹐重点选票

Sense.DEF: to get back an amount of money you have lost or spent
Sense.TRAN: 重新获得﹐收回〔失去或花掉的钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie will have to be a huge hit to recoup its cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影必须大获成功才能收回成本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was desperate to try and recoup his losses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不顾一切地试图挽回损失。

Sense.DEF: something that you do to achieve something or deal with a situation, or the act of doing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔实现或解决某事的〕手段﹐途径﹔依赖﹔求助
Sense.EXAMPLE: We may conclude that he never had recourse to this simple experiment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许可以断定﹐他根本就没有试过这个简单的实验。

GramExa.GLOSS: without using or doing something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a way of solving disputes without recourse to courts of law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不诉诸法律而解决纠纷的一个方法

Sense.EXAMPLE: Surgery may be the only recourse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术可能是唯一的办法。

Sense.DEF: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发烧几天之后﹐她开始恢复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s in hospital, recovering from a heart attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心脏病发作住院了﹐正在康复之中。

Sense.DEF: to return to a normal condition after a period of trouble or difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tourist industry is recovering to pre-war levels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业正在恢复到战前的水平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yesterday morning shares seemed to recover from Monday’s collapse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一股票暴跌﹐昨天早上好像又回升了。

Sense.DEF: to get back something that was taken from you, lost, or almost destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Four paintings stolen from the gallery have been recovered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美术馆的四幅被盗画作已经失而复得。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 残骸中找到了两具尸体。

Sense.DEF: to get back an amount of money that you have spent or lost
Sense.TRAN: 重新获得﹐收回〔花掉或失去的钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was entitled to recover damages from the defendants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有权向被告追讨赔偿。

Sense.DEF: to get back an ability, a sense, or control over your feelings, movements etc after a period without it
Sense.TRAN: 恢复〔能力﹑知觉﹑对情绪的控制﹑活动能力等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was some hours before she recovered consciousness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了几个小时她才恢复知觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once she stumbled, but somehow she recovered her balance and carried on running.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绊了一下﹐但还是找回平衡﹐继续向前跑去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He recovered himself enough to speak calmly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他镇定下来﹐平静地说话。

Exponent.DEF: to become healthy again after you have been seriously ill or injured, or had a bad experience
Exponent.TRAN: 〔从伤病中〕康复﹔〔从糟糕经历中〕恢复
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My mother’s been very ill, and she’s still in hospital recovering.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈病得很重﹐仍在住院康复。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She needed time to recover from the shock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要时间从那场打击中恢复过来。

Exponent.DEF: to recover from an injury or illness. In everyday English, people usually say get better rather than recover .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔受伤或生病后〕康复﹔好转〔在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get better﹐而不说recover〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hope you get better soon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你早日康复。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My back’s been quite bad recently, but it’s getting better slowly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近我的背很不舒服﹐不过正在慢慢好起来。

Exponent.DEF: to recover from a bad experience, or a minor illness. In everyday English, people usually say get over rather than recover .
Exponent.TRAN: 从〔糟糕经历或小病中〕恢复过来〔在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get over﹐而不说recover〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She never got over his death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直没有摆脱他去世带来的痛苦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m getting over my cold.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感冒在好转。

Exponent.DEF: to recover from an illness or operation – used especially when you are writing to encourage someone to recover
Exponent.TRAN: 康复﹔好起来〔尤用于写信鼓励某人在生病或手术后康复〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Get well soon – we all miss you!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你早日康复——我们都想你！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hope you get well quickly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你很快就能康复。

Exponent.DEF: to have recovered and be able to live life as usual again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It may take a week or two until you’re back on your feet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能需要一两个星期的时间你才能康复。

Exponent.DEF: to be showing definite signs of recovering after an illness or injury
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m glad to see you’re on the mend again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到你再次好转我很高兴。

Exponent.DEF: to spend time resting and getting your health or energy back, after you have had an illness or had a difficult or tiring experience
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been a hard year, and I needed a few weeks in the sun in order to recuperate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一年不容易,我需要晒几个星期太阳来恢复元气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is recuperating from a heart attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他处于心脏病发作后的恢复期。

Exponent.DEF: to spend a long period of time recovering from a serious illness, especially by resting in a comfortable or warm place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was at home convalescing after major surgery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 动了大手术后﹐她在家疗养。

Sense.DEF: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors expect him to make a full recovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生预计他能完全康复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann made a quick recovery from her operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术后安康复得很快。

Sense.DEF: the process of returning to a normal condition after a period of trouble or difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

Sense.DEF: when you get something back that has been taken or lost
Sense.TRAN: 〔被拿走或失去的东西的〕复得﹔找回﹔取回

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recovery of the stolen money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失窃钱款的追回

Sense.DEF:
a course of treatment for people who are
addicted
to drugs or alcohol
a room in a hospital where people first wake up after an operation
to make something from the past exist again in a new form or be experienced again
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can never recreate the feeling of winning for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你永远无法再次体会第一次获胜时的心情。

Sense.DEF: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement
Sense.EXAMPLE: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the provision of recreation facilities places or equipment for people to use to enjoy themselves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供娱乐设施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recreation area for children to play in
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 供儿童玩耍的娱乐区域

RunOn.EXAMPLE: recreational activities

Sense.DEF:
an
rv
Sense.TRAN: 野营车﹐活动房屋式旅游车

Sense.DEF: an area of public land used for sports and games
a public room, for example in a hospital, used for social activities or games
a room in a private house, where you can relax, play games etc
when you blame or criticize someone for something that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bitter accusations and recriminations followed the disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灾难过后﹐严厉的指责和批评随之而来。

Sense.DEF:
a
recreation room
to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

Sense.DEF: to get people to join the army, navy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the men in the village were recruited that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里的大多数男子在那一天应征入伍。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I recruited three of my friends to help me move.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动员了三个朋友帮我搬家。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or
air force

GramExa.GLOSS: one who is completely untrained
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

Sense.DEF: someone who has recently joined an organization, team, group of people etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: New recruits are sent to the Atlanta office for training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新成员被送到亚特兰大办事处接受培训。

Sense.DEF:
relating to the
rectum
a shape that has four straight sides, two of which are usually longer than the other two, and four 90˚ angles at the corners
having the shape of a rectangle
to correct something that is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面﹐但损害已经造成了。

Sense.DEF: consisting of straight lines
behaviour that is honest and morally correct
a priest in some Christian churches who is responsible for a particular area, group etc
the person in charge of certain colleges and schools
a house where the priest of the local church lives

the lowest part of your
bowel s
lying down on your back or side
to get better again after an illness or injury

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coles is recuperating from a sprained ankle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科尔斯扭伤了脚踝﹐正在康复。

Sense.DEF: to get back money that you have spent or lost in business
Sense.TRAN: 重新获得﹐收回〔生意上花费或失去的钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve recuperated our losses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已挽回损失。

Sense.DEF: to return to a more normal condition after a difficult time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winston proposed several ways for the industry to recuperate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温斯顿为复兴这个行业提出了几种办法。

Sense.DEF: recuperative powers, abilities etc help someone or something get better again, especially after an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recuperative vacation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有助于恢复健康的假期

Sense.DEF: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不好或令人不快的事物〕再次发生﹐再次出现
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病有复发的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

Sense.DEF:
if a number or numbers after a
decimal point
recur, they are repeated for ever in the same order
an occasion when something that has happened before happens again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: after the recurrence of a back problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背疾复发之后
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Measures must be taken to stop a recurrence of last night’s violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须采取措施防止昨晚的暴力事件再次发生。

Sense.DEF: happening or appearing several times
Sense.TRAN: 一再发生的﹔重复出现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: recurrent minor illnesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断发作的小病
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political revolution is a recurrent theme in Riley’s books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治革命是赖利书里一再出现的主题。

Sense.DEF: used materials or substances that are recyclable can be recycled
Sense.EXAMPLE: recyclable cardboard packaging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可回收利用的纸板包装材料

Sense.DEF: to put used objects or materials through a special process so that they can be used again
Sense.EXAMPLE: We take all our bottles to be recycled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把我们所有的瓶子都回收利用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: packaging made of recycled paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再生纸包装材料

Sense.DEF: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new
Sense.TRAN: 再次应用﹔重新使用〔观点﹑文章等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

Sense.DEF: the process of treating used objects or materials so that they can be used again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recycling is important to help protect our environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回收利用对保护环境很重要。

Sense.DEF: things that are to be recycled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to take out the recycling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了把要回收利用的东西拿出来。

Sense.DEF: having the colour of blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: We painted the door bright red .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把门漆成鲜红色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red balloon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个红气球

Sense.DEF: hair that is red has an orange-brown colour
if you go red, your face becomes a bright pink colour, especially because you are embarrassed or angry
Sense.TRAN: 涨红的﹐通红的〔尤因尴尬或生气〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every time you mention his name, she goes bright red.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次你提到他的名字﹐她的脸都会涨得通红。

Sense.DEF: red wine is a red or purple colour

Sense.LEXUNIT: like a red rag to a bull

Variant.LEXVAR: like waving a red flag in front of a bull

Sense.DEF: very likely to make someone angry or upset
Sense.TRAN: 容易使人愤怒﹔容易使人苦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just mentioning his ex-wife’s name was like a red rag to a bull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要提到他前妻的名字﹐他就会怒不可遏。

Sense.LEXUNIT: roll out the red carpet/give sb the red carpet treatment
Sense.DEF: to give special treatment to an important visitor
Sense.TRAN: 隆重欢迎/隆重接待某人

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean no money at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t give him one red cent for that car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那辆车白送我都不要。

Sense.DEF:
communist
or extremely
left-wing
political views – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 共产主义的﹔激进左翼的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the colour of blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like the way the artist uses red in this painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢画家在这幅作品中对红色的运用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the reds and yellows of the trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红黄斑斓﹐层林尽染
Sense.EXAMPLE: The corrections were marked in red in red ink .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修改处用红笔标出。

Sense.DEF: red wine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice bottle of red
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶香醇的红葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: to owe more money than you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the airline’s fourth straight year in the red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是该航空公司连续第四年亏空。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has
communist
or very
left-wing
political opinions – used especially in the past to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 赤色分子﹔共产主义者﹔激进左翼人士〔尤用于过去﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a warning that there is very great danger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the hospitals are on red alert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有医院都处于紧急待命状态。

Sense.DEF: one of the cells in your blood that carry oxygen to every part of your body
used to emphasize that someone has all of the qualities that a typical man, Englishman etc is supposed to have – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 典型的男人/英国人/美国人等〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a redbrick university is one of the British universities built in the late 19th or early 20th century, rather than an older university
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学〕建于19世纪末20世纪初的﹐红砖的

Sense.DEF:
a red button on a television
remote control
which you press if you want to use
interactive tv
services
Sense.TRAN: 红色按钮〔电视机遥控器上启用互动电视服务的按钮〕

Sense.DEF:
a red card held up by the
referee
in a football match, to show that a player has done something against the rules and will not be allowed to play for the rest of the game
a British soldier during the 18th and 19th centuries
an organization in Islamic countries that helps people who are suffering as a result of war, floods, disease etc
Sense.TRAN: 红新月会〔伊斯兰国家中相当于红十字会的组织〕

Sense.DEF: an international organization that helps people who are suffering as a result of war, floods, disease etc
a very small red fruit that grows on bushes in northern Europe
to become red, or to make something red
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue’s face reddened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休脸红了。

Sense.DEF: slightly red
Sense.EXAMPLE: reddish-brown lipstick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红棕色唇膏

Sense.DEF: to change the way a room looks by painting it, changing the curtains etc
to make something less bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

GramExa.GLOSS: the one good thing about an unpleasant person or thing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel had a single redeeming feature - it was cheap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆只有一个可取之处——便宜。

Sense.DEF: to do something that will improve what other people think of you, after you have behaved badly or failed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent the rest of the game trying to redeem himself after a first-minute mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛余下的时间里﹐他都在尽力弥补开局时的失误。

Sense.DEF: to exchange a piece of paper representing an amount of money for that amount of money or for goods equal in cost to that amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can redeem the coupon at any store.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张券可以在任何商店兑换。

Sense.DEF: to free someone from the power of evil, especially in the Christian religion
to do what you promised to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government found itself unable to redeem its election pledges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府无法履行其选举承诺。

Sense.DEF: to buy back something which you left with someone you borrowed money from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He finally redeemed his watch from the pawnbroker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于从当铺老板那里赎回了手表。

Sense.DEF: able to be exchanged for money or goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stamps are redeemable for merchandise or cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代币券可兑换商品或现金。

Sense.DEF: Jesus Christ
the state of being freed from the power of evil, believed by Christians to be made possible by Jesus Christ
the act of exchanging a piece of paper worth a particular amount of money for money, goods, or services
too bad to be saved, repaired, or improved
Sense.TRAN: 不可救药的﹐无可挽回的

Sense.DEF:
the exchange of
share s
,
bond s
etc for money
to move someone or something to a different place or job
Sense.TRAN: 重新部署﹔调遣 〔人员〕﹔调配〔物资〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plans to redeploy 200 employees in the next six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划要在未来的6个月内调遣200名雇员。

Sense.DEF: to make an area more modern by putting in new buildings or changing or repairing the old ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old docks are being redeveloped as a business park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧船坞正在改建成商业园区。

Sense.DEF: the act of redeveloping an area, especially in a city
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指城市里的〕改建﹐重新开发
Sense.EXAMPLE: redevelopment of the city’s downtown area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中心城区的改造

Sense.DEF: to take a journey in a plane that continues all night
Sense.TRAN: 乘坐红眼航班﹐乘坐夜间航班
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took the red eye to LA.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搭夜间航班去洛杉矶。

Sense.DEF: embarrassed or ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red-faced officials ordered an investigation into the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尴尬的官员命令调查这起事故。

Sense.DEF: something that shows or warns you that something might be wrong, illegal etc
a large star that is near the middle of its life and shines with a reddish light
Sense.TRAN: 红巨星〔一种处于中年期发红光的巨型恒星〕

Sense.DEF: to catch someone at the moment when they are doing something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Earl was caught red-handed taking the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厄尔在拿钱时被当场逮到。

Sense.DEF: someone who has red hair
a fact or idea that is not important but is introduced to take your attention away from the points that are important
Sense.TRAN: 转移注意力的次要事实[想法]

Subsense.DEF: metal or rock that is red-hot is so hot that it shines red
Subsense.TRAN: 〔金属或岩石〕红热状态的﹐热得通红的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The poker glowed red-hot in the fire.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨火棍在火里闪着红通通的光。

Subsense.DEF: very hot
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Be careful with those plates – they’re red-hot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心那些盘子﹐烫得很。

Sense.DEF: extremely active, exciting, or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 极富活力的﹔极刺激的﹔极有趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red-hot news story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热点新闻报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Braves have been red-hot in the last few games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最近几场比赛中勇士队打得非常精彩。

Sense.DEF: a red-hot feeling is very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: red-hot anger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴怒

Sense.DEF: the team or person who most people believe will win a competition

to
dial
a telephone number again
to use something for a different purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was good at redirecting the children’s energy into something useful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她善于让孩子们把精力转移到有用的事情上。

Sense.DEF: to send something in a different direction
Sense.TRAN: 使改变方向﹔使改变路线[航线]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flight was redirected to Cleveland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航班改道飞向克利夫兰。

Sense.DEF: to send someone’s letters to their new address from an address that they have left
to give something to each member of a group so that it is divided up in a different way from before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a programme to redistribute wealth from the rich to the poor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将富人财富重新分配给穷人的计划

Sense.DEF: the act of redistributing something, especially money or land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major redistribution of land
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的土地重新分配

Sense.DEF: a day that you will always remember because something special happened that made you very happy

the area of a town or city where there are many
prostitute s

dark coloured meat such as
beef
or
lamb
a person who lives in a country area of the US, is uneducated, and has strong unreasonable opinions – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 乡巴佬〔指居于美国乡村﹑未受过教育﹑思想顽固的人﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a redneck bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间乡巴佬酒吧

Sense.DEF:
a day every other year on which a lot of money is collected for people who need help in the UK and other countries. Red Nose Day is organized by the
charity
organization Comic Relief, and people often wear plastic red noses or put them on the front of their cars to show their support.
Sense.TRAN: 红鼻子日〔由慈善组织“喜剧救济”筹划﹑隔年举行的募捐活动日﹐人们常戴上塑料红鼻子或将其放在汽车前部﹐以示支持〕

Sense.DEF: to do something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to redo this piece of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作你得重做。

Sense.DEF: to change the way a room is decorated
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having the kitchen redone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在重新装修厨房。

Sense.DEF: making you think of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a style redolent of the sixties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种使人想起60年代的风格

Sense.DEF: smelling strongly of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bar was redolent with the smell of stale cigarette smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里弥漫着污浊的烟味。

Sense.DEF: to greatly increase your effort as you try to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides redoubled their efforts to end the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都加倍努力﹐争取结束战争。

Sense.DEF: a small hidden place, for example where soldiers hide themselves when they are fighting
someone who is redoubtable is a person you respect or fear
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had never met a more redoubtable fighter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未遇见过如此令人敬畏的斗士。

Sense.DEF: to improve people’s opinion of someone
Sense.TRAN: 提高某人的信誉/声誉等

Sense.DEF: a red vegetable which you can eat raw or use in cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: stuffed red peppers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酿红辣椒

Sense.DEF: a spicy red powder used in cooking
to correct something that is wrong or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little could be done to redress the situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局势难以挽回。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Affirmative action was meant to redress the balance make the situation fair for minorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反歧视行动旨在弥补对少数群体的不公平待遇。

Sense.DEF: money that someone pays you because they have caused you harm or damaged your property
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only hope of redress is in a lawsuit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得赔偿的唯一希望就是打官司。

Sense.DEF: official rules that seem unnecessary and prevent things from being done quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 繁琐费时的手续﹔繁文缛节
Sense.EXAMPLE: a procedure surrounded by bureaucracy and red tape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥着官僚作风和繁文缛节的程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new rules should help cut the red tape for farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新规则应有助于为农场主减少繁琐费时的手续。

Sense.DEF: a British newspaper that has its name in red at the top of the front page. Red-tops have a lot of readers, but are not considered to be as serious as other newspapers.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕红头（通俗）小报〔因报名套红而得名〕

Sense.DEF: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The workforce has been reduced by half.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 职工人数已减少一半。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the shirts were reduced to £10.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有衬衫都减价至10英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new bridge should reduce travelling time from 50 minutes to 15 minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座新桥应该能将行程从50分钟缩减到15分钟。

Sense.DEF: if you reduce a liquid, or if it reduces, you boil it so that there is less of it
to become thinner by losing weight
to be poorer than you were before

Section.SECHEADING: TO REDUCE PRICES, NUMBERS, OR AMOUNTS 降低价格﹑减少数字或数量

Exponent.DEF: to make the price, amount, or size of something less or smaller
Exponent.TRAN: 降低〔价格〕﹔减少〔数量〕﹔缩小〔尺寸〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The price was reduced by 50%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格降了50%。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need to reduce the amount of salt in our diet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要减少饮食中盐的含量。

Exponent.DEF: to reduce something, especially by a large amount – used about prices, costs, jobs, or the time needed to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 削减〔尤指大量减少价格﹑成本﹑工作岗位或时间〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Companies are always looking for ways to cut costs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司总是在想方设法削减成本。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The journey time will be cut to under 2 hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 行程将缩短到两小时内。

Exponent.DEF: to reduce the level, limit, or amount of something. Lower sounds rather formal.
Exponent.TRAN: 降低﹐减少〔水平限制或数量﹔该词听上去颇为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The voting age was lowered to 18.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票年龄降到了18岁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government decided to lower interest rates by 0.5%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决定降息0.5%。

Exponent.DEF: to reduce something such as prices or costs, or reduce the level of something. Bring sth down is less formal than lower .
Exponent.TRAN: 降低〔价格或成本﹔该说法不如lower正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government wants to bring down the level of inflation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府希望降低通货膨胀水平。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is trying to bring its costs down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正试图降低成本。

Exponent.DEF: to reduce an amount or price by a very large amount – used especially in newspapers and advertisements
Exponent.TRAN: 大幅度削减〔数量或价格﹐尤用于报纸和广告〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Public spending has been slashed over the past two years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去两年里﹐公共开支遭大幅削减。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Prices slashed for one week only!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大降价仅一周！

Exponent.DEF: to reduce the amount of something – used especially about people deciding to spend less, do less, or use less of something
Exponent.TRAN: 削减〔尤用于决定减少开销﹑工作或使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The education budget has been cut back again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育预算又遭削减。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need to cut back on my workload.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得削减工作量。

Exponent.DEF: to reduce the number of people employed in order to reduce costs – used about a company or organization
Exponent.TRAN: 〔公司或机构为缩减开支而〕裁员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is planning to downsize its European operations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正计划缩减其欧洲业务。

Sense.DEF: to make someone cry, be silent etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was reduced to tears in front of her students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在学生面前流下了眼泪。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something they would rather not do, especially when it involves behaving or living in a way that is not as good as before
Sense.TRAN: 迫使某人做某事﹔使某人沦落到某种地步
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually Charlotte was reduced to begging on the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后夏洛特沦落到沿街乞讨。

Sense.DEF: to destroy something, especially a building, completely
Sense.TRAN: 把某物〔尤指建筑物〕化为灰烬/变成瓦砾/夷为废墟等
Sense.EXAMPLE: A massive earthquake reduced the city to rubble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场大地震把这座城市夷为废墟。

Sense.DEF: to change something into a shorter simpler form
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many jobs can be reduced to a few simple points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多工作都可以概括成简单的几点。

Sense.DEF: able to be considered simply as something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Things do not happen according to plan, and they are not reducible to tidy models.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划不如变化﹐不可能什么事都简单地按固定的模式发生。

Sense.DEF: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尺寸﹑价格或数量的〕缩小﹔减少﹔下降
Sense.EXAMPLE: strategies for noise reduction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少噪音的对策

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slight reduction in the price of oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价略微降低

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the reduction of interest rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率的下降

GramExa.EXAMPLE: substantial reductions on children’s clothes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 童装的大减价

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

Sense.DEF: when someone tries to explain complicated ideas or systems in very simple terms – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 简化论﹔简单化理论〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone has to leave their job, because they are no longer needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The closure of the export department resulted in over 100 redundancies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出口部关闭导致一百多人被解雇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two thousand workers now face redundancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000 名工人现在面临失业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An employee is not eligible for a redundancy payment unless he has been with the company for two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公司工作满两年的雇员才有资格拿遣散费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were offered a £3,000 cash bonus to take voluntary redundancy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们发了3,000英镑的现金补贴﹐叫我们自动离职。

Sense.DEF: when something is not used because something similar or the same already exists
money you get from your employer when you are made redundant
if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在继而发生的裁员中﹐70名工厂工人被解雇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As the economy weakens, more and more jobs will be made redundant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着经济疲弱﹐越来越多的工作岗位将被裁撤。

Sense.DEF: not necessary because something else means or does the same thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the removal of redundant information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多余信息的删除

Sense.DEF: a very tall tree that grows in California and Oregon, or the wood from this tree
Sense.TRAN: 〔生长在美国加利福尼亚和俄勒冈的〕红杉﹔红杉木

Sense.DEF: a type of tall plant like grass that grows in wet places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reeds grew in clumps all along the river bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿河岸长着一丛丛芦苇。

Sense.DEF:
a thin piece of wood that is attached to a musical instrument such as an
oboe
or
clarinet
, and that produces a sound when you blow over it
to teach someone to think or behave in a different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young criminals must be re-educated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年罪犯必须接受再教育。

Sense.DEF: a voice that is reedy is high and unpleasant to listen to
a place that is reedy has a lot of reeds growing there

a line of sharp rocks, often made of
coral
, or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proposal to protect several miles of thousand-year-old coral reef
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护绵延数英里的千年古珊瑚礁的提案

Sense.DEF: to tie up part of a sail in order to make it smaller

a cigarette containing the drug
marijuana
a double knot that cannot come undone easily
to have a strong bad smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: This room absolutely reeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间真是臭极了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He reeked of sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一身汗臭。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the reek of cigarettes and beer

Sense.DEF: to seem very clearly to have a particular quality or be connected with something bad
Sense.TRAN: 明显带有…性质﹔充满〔不好的〕…气息
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole business reeks of dishonesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事都充满欺诈的味道。

Sense.DEF: to be confused or shocked by a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norman’s brain was reeling, but he did his best to appear calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺曼头都晕了﹐但他尽量显得平静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party is still reeling from its recent election defeat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政党仍被最近的选举失利弄得晕头转向。

Sense.DEF: to step backwards suddenly and almost fall over, especially after being hit or getting a shock
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指被打或震惊而〕踉跄着后退
Sense.EXAMPLE: Diane reeled back in amazement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜惊讶得朝后打了一个趔趄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The force of the punch sent him reeling against the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一拳打得他趔趄着靠在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪踉跄着离开吧台﹐把凳子都撞倒了。

Sense.DEF: to seem to go around and around
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room reeled before my eyes and I fainted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间在我眼前旋转起来﹐随即我就晕了过去。

Sense.DEF: to wind the reel on a fishing rod so that a fish caught on the line comes towards you
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took almost an hour to reel the fish in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花了将近一个小时才收了线﹐把鱼钓上来。

Sense.DEF: to get or attract a large number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme reels in more than 13 million viewers a show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这节目每次播出都能吸引超过1,300万名观众收看。

Sense.DEF: to repeat a lot of information quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack reeled off a list of names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克一口气背出了一长串名字。

Sense.DEF: to do something again and again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Yankees reeled off 14 straight wins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬基队连胜14场。

Subsense.DEF: a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a cotton reel
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棉线轴
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a fishing rod and reel
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钓竿和钓线轴

Subsense.DEF: the amount that one of these objects will hold
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a reel of film
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一卷胶卷

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of a cinema film that is contained on a reel
Sense.EXAMPLE: the final reel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片结尾部分

PIC.HEADING: REEL 卷轴；卷盘
PIC.PICCONTENT: cotton reel BrE 【英】 棉线轴；reel 卷轴；a reel of film 一盘胶片

Sense.DEF:
a quick
folk
dance, especially one from Scotland or Ireland, or the music for this
Sense.TRAN: 里尔舞〔一种轻快的民间舞蹈﹐尤指苏格兰或爱尔兰舞蹈〕﹔里尔舞曲

Sense.DEF: to elect someone again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris was re-elected for a third term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯第三次当选。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Barnes is seeking re-election .

Sense.DEF: to perform the actions of a story, crime etc that happened in the past
Sense.TRAN: 重演﹐再次展现〔过去的事件﹑犯罪经过等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the church, children re-enacted the Christmas story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在教堂里重演基督降生的故事。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a re-enactment of the crime

Sense.DEF: to change the structure of an activity, organization etc so that it performs better
Sense.EXAMPLE: They reengineered the department, and cut nearly 400 jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们重组该部门﹐削减了将近400个工作岗位。

Sense.DEF: to improve the design of a product
Sense.EXAMPLE: Radio networks are being reengineered to give digital operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无线电网络正被改造成数字模式操作。

Sense.DEF: when someone starts being involved in something again or enters a place again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: America’s successful re-entry into the Japanese auto market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国成功重返日本汽车市场

Sense.DEF:
when a spacecraft enters the earth’s
atmosphere
again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The satellite burned up on re-entry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫星在重返大气层时烧毁。

Sense.DEF:
the official who is in charge of the town governments in some Canadian
province s
Sense.TRAN: 〔加拿大某些省份的〕地方行政官

Sense.DEF: an English law officer in the past

a
referee

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=reference编号﹐参照号

Sense.DEF: a large room in a school, college etc where meals are served and eaten
to mention or speak about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We agreed never to refer to the matter again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们说定永远不再提这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although she didn’t mention any names, everyone knew who she was referring to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管她没有提任何人的名字﹐但大家都知道她指的是谁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He likes to be referred to as ‘Doctor Khee’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢别人叫他“基博士”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital now refers to patients by name, not case number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院现在叫病人的名字﹐不叫号码了。

Sense.DEF: to look at a book, map, piece of paper etc for information
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave the speech without referring to his notes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱稿发表了演讲。

Sense.DEF: if a statement, number, report etc refers to someone or something, it is about that person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figures refer to our sales in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字是我们在欧洲的销售额。

Sense.DEF: to send someone or something to a person or organization to be helped or dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 把某人介绍给某人〔以求帮助〕/把某事物交给某人〔解决〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My doctor is referring me to a dermatologist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的医生介绍我去看一位皮肤科医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My complaint was referred to the manufacturers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的投诉已转给制造商受理。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone where to find information
Sense.TRAN: 叫某人去某处〔查阅资料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Readers are referred to the bibliography for further information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 读者可查看参考书目﹐获取详细资料。

Sense.DEF: something that is referable to something else can be related to it

someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,
basketball
, or
boxing
, are followed
someone who provides information about you when you are trying to get a job
Sense.TRAN: 〔找工作时的〕证明人﹐介绍人﹐推荐人
Sense.EXAMPLE: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

Sense.DEF: someone who is asked to settle a disagreement

someone who judges an article or
research
idea before it is
publish ed
or money is provided for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔刊登前鉴定文章的〕审阅人﹔ 〔拨款前鉴定研究计划的〕鉴定专家

Sense.DEF: to be the referee of a game
part of something you say or write in which you mention a person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article made no reference to previous research on the subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章没有提及此前对该课题的研究情况。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The governor made only a passing reference to the problem of unemployment he mentioned it quickly .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长对失业问题只是一语带过。

Sense.DEF: the act of looking at something for information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A vocabulary index is included for easy reference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 附有词汇索引以便查阅。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep their price list on file for future reference so that it can be looked at in the future .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将他们的价目表存档﹐以供日后参考。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book will become a standard work of reference a book that people look at for information .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书将成为权威参考书。

Subsense.DEF: an idea, fact, event etc that you already know, which helps you understand or make a judgment about another situation
Subsense.TRAN: 〔帮助理解或判断的〕参照标准﹐参考依据
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lee’s case will be the reference point for lawyers in tomorrow’s trial.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李的判例将成为律师在明天庭审时的参考依据。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She used her work experience as a frame of reference for her teaching.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己的工作经历作为教学的参考依据。

Subsense.DEF: something that you can see that helps you to know where you are when you are travelling in an area

Sense.DEF: used to say what you are writing or talking about, especially in business letters
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am writing to you in reference to the job opening in your department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获悉贵部门有空缺职位﹐特来函求问。

Subsense.DEF: a letter containing information about you that is written by someone who knows you well, and is usually intended for a new employer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We will need references from your former employers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要你以前雇主的推荐信。

Subsense.DEF: a person who provides information about your character and abilities
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ask your teacher to act as one of your references.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你的老师做推荐人之一。

Sense.DEF: a book, article etc from which information has been obtained
Sense.EXAMPLE: a comprehensive list of references
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详尽的参考书目清单

Sense.DEF: a number that tells you where you can find the information you want in a book, on a map etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a list of towns, each with a map reference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份城镇清单﹐每个城镇都有地图参照号

Sense.DEF: to mention another book, article etc that contains information connected with the subject you are writing about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book does not reference anything written in the last 10 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书并未参考过去十年中的任何作品。

Sense.DEF:
a book such as a dictionary or
encyclopedia
that you look at to find information
a public library or a room in a library, that contains books that you can read but not take away
Sense.TRAN: 参考图书馆﹔参考书阅览室

Sense.DEF: when people vote in order to make a decision about a particular subject, rather than voting for a person
Sense.TRAN: 〔为表决某问题的〕全民投票﹔全民公决

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a referendum on independence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就独立问题进行的全民公决

Sense.EXAMPLE: The city council agreed to hold a referendum on the issue in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会同意在11月就此问题进行全民投票。

Sense.DEF: when someone sends someone or something to another person to be helped or dealt with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor will give you a referral to a specialist in your area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生会把你转给当地的专科医生。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 39 percent of patients were seen within four weeks of referral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被介绍转诊的病人中﹐只有39%的人在四个星期内得到了诊治。

Sense.DEF: to fill something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waitress refilled our coffee cups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女服务员又把我们的咖啡杯斟满。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a refillable lighter

Sense.DEF: a container filled with a particular substance, such as ink or petrol, that you use to fill or replace an empty container, or the substance itself
Sense.TRAN: 添补物﹔替换物﹔添补[替换]的材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refill for his pen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这种笔的笔芯

Sense.DEF: another drink of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a refill?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要再来一杯吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free refill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费的续杯

Sense.DEF: to borrow money from a bank etc in order to pay back an existing amount that you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: As interest rates fall, homeowners are likely to refinance their loans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着利率下降﹐房主可能会重新贷款。

Sense.DEF: to improve a method, plan, system etc by gradually making slight changes to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car makers are constantly refining their designs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车制造商在不断完善他们的设计。

Sense.DEF: to make a substance purer using an industrial process
Sense.EXAMPLE: oil refining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油的提炼

Sense.DEF: a substance that is refined has been made pure by an industrial process

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 精制糖/精炼油/精炼石油

Sense.DEF: someone who is refined is polite and seems to be well-educated or to belong to a high social class – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 优雅的﹐有教养的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refined way of speaking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优雅的谈吐

Sense.DEF: a method or process that is refined has been improved to make it more effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laser surgery has become much more refined over the last decade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去十年间﹐激光手术已日臻完善。

Sense.DEF: an improvement, usually a small one, to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new model has a number of refinements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型号有一些细微的改进。

Sense.DEF:
something which is an improved
version
of an existing product, system etc
Sense.TRAN: 改良品﹐经过改进的东西

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new theory is a refinement of Corbin’s theory of personality development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新理论是对科尔宾人格发展理论的改良。

Sense.DEF: the process of improving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some further refinement is needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要进一步的改进。

Sense.DEF: the process of making a substance more pure
Sense.EXAMPLE: sugar refinement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖的提纯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the refinement of cocaine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可卡因的提纯

Sense.DEF: the quality of being polite and well-educated, in a way that is typical of someone from a high social class
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of great refinement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常文雅的女士

Sense.DEF: a factory where something such as oil or sugar is made purer
to make a ship, aircraft, building etc ready to be used again, by doing repairs and putting in new machinery
Sense.TRAN: 整修﹔重新装备〔船只﹑飞机﹑建筑物等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship was completely refitted five years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船五年前全面整修过。

Sense.DEF: the process of increasing the amount of money being used in a country in order to increase trade
if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could see her face reflected in the car’s windshield.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到自己的脸映照在汽车的挡风玻璃上。

Sense.DEF: to show or be a sign of a particular situation or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The increasing racial diversity of the US is reflected in the latest census statistics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国社会种族越来越多元化的现象反映在最新的人口统计数据中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much you’re paid reflects how important you are to the company you work for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你报酬的高低反映你在所供职的公司里的重要性。

Subsense.DEF: if a surface reflects light, heat, or sound, it sends back the light etc that reaches it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wear something white – it reflects the heat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿件白色的衣服——它能反射热。

Subsense.DEF: if light, heat, or sound reflects off something it reaches, it comes back from it

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about something, or to say something that you have been thinking about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had time to reflect on his successes and failures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有时间反思他的成功和失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moe reflected that he had never seen Sherry so happy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫说他从未见过谢里这么高兴。

Sense.DEF: to influence people’s opinion of someone or something, especially in a bad way
Sense.TRAN: 给…带来影响〔尤指坏影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If my children are rude, that reflects on me as a parent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如我的孩子没有礼貌﹐那会使我这个做家长的丢脸。

Sense.DEF: respect or admiration that is given to someone, not because of what they are or what they have done, but because of what someone they know has done
Sense.TRAN: 仰仗别人而得到的荣誉
Sense.EXAMPLE: I certainly don’t want to bask in any reflected glory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当然不想沾光享受别人的荣耀。

Sense.DEF: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

Sense.DEF: careful thought, or an idea or opinion based on this
Sense.TRAN: 深思﹐仔细考虑﹔〔经过仔细考虑形成的〕想法﹐见解
Sense.EXAMPLE: A moment’s reflection will show the stupidity of this argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需认真想一下便可看出这种观点多么愚蠢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At first I disagreed, but on reflection after thinking carefully about it , I realized she was right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我不同意﹐但经过一番考虑后﹐我发现她是对的。

Sense.DEF: something that shows what something else is like, or that is a sign of a particular situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His speech was an accurate reflection of the public mood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的讲话是公众情绪的准确反映。

GramExa.GLOSS: show how good or bad someone or something is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On some level, a student’s grades are a reflection on the teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在某种程度上﹐学生的成绩是老师水平的反映。

Sense.DEF: the action or process of light, heat, or sound being thrown back from a surface
a reflective surface reflects light
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stick reflective tape on your school bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给你的书包贴上反光带。

Sense.DEF: thinking quietly about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in a reflective mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她陷入沉思。

Sense.DEF: showing that something is true about a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: TV is reflective of society’s more liberal views on sex.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视反映出社会更为开放的性观念。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of plastic that is fastened to a bicycle or to a piece of clothing, so that it can be seen more easily at night. All bicycles sold in the UK must be fitted with reflectors.
Sense.TRAN: 反光板﹔反射物 〔为夜间容易辨认而固定在自行车或衣服上。 英国出售的自行车必须装有反射装置〕

Sense.DEF: a surface that reflects light

Subsense.DEF: the natural ability to react quickly and well to sudden situations

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A tennis player needs to have very quick reflexes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 网球运动员需要反应迅速。

Subsense.DEF: a sudden uncontrolled movement that your muscles make as a natural reaction to a physical effect
Subsense.TRAN: 〔生理上的〕反射动作﹐反射作用
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Doctor Mulholland tested Jennifer’s reflexes especially by hitting her knee with a special rubber hammer .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔霍兰医生检查了珍妮弗的反射反应。

Sense.DEF: something that you do without thinking, as a reaction to a situation
Sense.TRAN: 下意识的动作﹔本能反应

Sense.DEF:
a reflexive verb or
pronoun
shows that the action in a sentence affects the person or thing that does the action. In the sentence ‘I enjoyed myself’, ‘myself’ is reflexive.
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词或代词〕反身的〔句子I enjoyed myself中﹐myself是反身代词〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of
alternative
medicine in which areas of the feet are touched or rubbed in order to cure medical problems in other parts of the body
Sense.TRAN: 反射疗法〔按摩足部某些部位来治病的一种替代疗法〕

Sense.DEF: the practice of planting trees in an area where they were previously cut down, in order to grow them for industrial use or to improve the environment
to start to exist again or to make something start to exist again
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of the year, the company re-formed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年末公司重组。

Sense.DEF: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to radically reform the tax system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

Sense.DEF: to change your behaviour and become a better person, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greeley says he’s a genuinely reformed character .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里利说他已经彻底改过自新了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reformed criminal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名改过自新的罪犯

Sense.DEF: a change or changes made to a system or organization in order to improve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reform of the legal system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律制度的改革

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government announced a much-needed programme of economic reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府宣布了一套极为必要的经济改革方案。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Reforms were made to revive the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为复苏经济而进行了改革。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister is calling for sweeping reforms of the NHS.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相正要求全面改革国民医疗服务体系。

Sense.DEF: if you reformat a document, you change the way it is organized or arranged, for example the amount of space between lines
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first seven books will all be condensed and reformatted for electronic reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前七册书将全部压缩并重排格式﹐做成电子读物。

Sense.DEF: when something is completely changed in order to improve it
the religious changes in Europe in the 16th century, that resulted in the Protestant churches being established
Sense.TRAN: 宗教改革〔欧洲16世纪的宗教变革﹐促成了新教的产生〕

Sense.DEF:
old use a
reform school
someone who works to improve a social or political system
Sense.EXAMPLE: a great social reformer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伟大的社会改革家

Sense.DEF: wanting to change systems or situations, especially in politics
Sense.EXAMPLE: the reformist wing of the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内的改革派

Sense.DEF: a special school where young people who have broken the law are sent
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re not careful, you’ll end up in reform school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你不小心﹐最后会进少管所的。

Sense.DEF: if glass or water refracts light, the light changes direction when it passes through the glass or water
deliberately not obeying someone in authority and being difficult to deal with or control
a refractory disease or illness is hard to treat or cure
Sense.TRAN: 〔疾病〕难以医治的﹔难以治愈的

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you want to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please refrain from smoking in this area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请勿在此处吸烟。

Sense.DEF:
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each
verse
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌曲或诗歌每节末尾的〕反复句﹐叠句﹐副歌

Sense.DEF: a remark or idea that is often repeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our proposal met with the constant refrain that the company could not afford it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的提议所得到的答复就是那句说了一遍又一遍的老话——“公司负担不起费用”。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less tired or less hot
Sense.TRAN: 使恢复精力﹐使提神﹔使清凉
Sense.EXAMPLE: A shower will refresh you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

Sense.DEF: to make someone remember something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人想起﹐唤起某人的记忆
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked at the map to refresh my memory of the route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看看地图﹐回忆这条路线。

Sense.DEF: to add more of an alcoholic drink to someone’s glass
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I refresh your drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你再加点酒好吗？

Sense.DEF: if you refresh your computer screen while you are connected to the Internet, you make the screen show any new information that has arrived since you first began looking at it

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Jen returned from vacation feeling relaxed and refreshed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍度假归来﹐感到轻轻松松﹑神清气爽。

Sense.DEF: a training course, usually a short one, that teaches you about new developments in a particular subject or skill, especially one that you need for your job
making you feel less tired or less hot
Sense.TRAN: 消除疲劳的﹐提神的﹔清凉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refreshing drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯提神的饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: The breeze felt refreshing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微风让人神清气爽。

Sense.DEF: pleasantly different from what is familiar and boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: It made a refreshing change to talk to someone new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和刚认识的人谈话感觉很新鲜。

Sense.DEF: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑体育赛事等中提供的〕茶点﹐点心和饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refreshments will be served after the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会后有茶点招待。

Sense.DEF: food and drink in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: We worked all day without refreshment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不吃不喝地工作了一整天。

GramExa.GLOSS: alcoholic drink - used humorously
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was in need of some liquid refreshment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要来一点酒。

Sense.DEF: the experience of being made to feel less tired or hot

a Mexican dish in which beans that have already been cooked are crushed and then
fried
with spices
to make something such as food or liquid cold in a refrigerator in order to preserve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refrigerate the mixture overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把混合物冷藏过夜。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, shaped like a cupboard, used for keeping food and drink cool

to fill a plane or vehicle with
fuel
before continuing a journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was refuelled in Dubai.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在迪拜加过油。

Sense.DEF: to make feelings, emotions, or ideas stronger
Sense.TRAN: 使〔感情﹑情绪或想法〕更强烈
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attack refuelled fears of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击事件加剧了人们对战争的恐惧。

Sense.DEF: shelter or protection from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the frequent air-raids, people took refuge in their cellars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在频繁的空袭中﹐人们躲在地窖里避难。

Sense.DEF: a place that provides shelter, or protection from danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wildlife refuge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生动物保护区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A huge oak tree provided a refuge from the storm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵巨大的橡树成了躲避暴风雨的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a refuge for battered wives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受虐妻子的庇护所

Sense.DEF: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refugees were streaming across the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民正涌过边境。
难民营

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
Sense.EXAMPLE: They refused to give me a refund .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝给我退款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should go down there and demand a refund.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该到那里去﹐要求退款。

Sense.DEF: money that you get back from the government when it has taken too much money in taxes from your salary
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for
Sense.TRAN: 退还〔钱款﹐尤因买家对所购货物或服务不满意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took the radio back, and they refunded my money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把收音机送回去﹐他们给我退了款。

Sense.DEF: to decorate and repair something such as a building or office in order to improve its appearance
Sense.TRAN: 修缮﹐整修〔建筑物或办公室等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Grand Hotel has been completely refurbished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格兰德酒店已彻底整修。

Sense.DEF: to change and improve a plan, idea, or skill
Sense.TRAN: 修改﹐完善〔计划﹑想法或技能〕

Sense.DEF: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His refusal to pay the fine got him into even more trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒付罚金﹐这下麻烦更大了。

GramExa.GLOSS: an immediate direct refusal
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His request was met with a blunt refusal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的要求遭到断然拒绝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They couldn’t understand her refusal of a scholarship to Yale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们无法理解她为什么拒绝耶鲁大学的奖学金。

Sense.DEF: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她叫他走﹐但他不肯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I absolutely refuse to take part in anything illegal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝不愿意参加任何违法活动。

GramExa.GLOSS: refuse immediately and directly without giving a reason
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mom flatly refused to go back into the hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈断然拒绝再进医院。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse could not refuse , could I?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他愿意给那么多钱﹐我怎么可能拒绝呢？

Sense.DEF: to say no to something that you have been offered
Sense.TRAN: 不接受﹐拒绝﹝别人给的东西﹞
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused a second piece of cake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谢绝了第二块蛋糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The offer seemed too good to refuse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报价太优惠了﹐让人难以拒绝。

Sense.DEF: to not give or allow someone something that they want, especially when they have asked for it officially

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was refused a work permit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她申请工作许可证被拒绝了。

Exponent.DEF: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I asked the bank for a loan, but they refused.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我申请银行贷款﹐但被拒绝了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When they refused to leave, we had to call the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不肯离开﹐我们只得报警。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you will not do something when someone asks you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They asked me so nicely that I couldn’t really say no.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们如此恳切相求﹐我真的没法拒绝。

Exponent.DEF: to refuse to accept an offer or invitation, or a formal request
Exponent.TRAN: 拒绝某人/某事物〔指提议﹑邀请或正式要求〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They offered me the job but I turned it down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我这份工作﹐不过我拒绝了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The board turned down a request for $25,000 to sponsor an art exhibition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会拒绝了出资2.5万美元赞助一项艺术展的请求。

Exponent.DEF: to refuse to accept an idea, offer, suggestion, or plan
Exponent.TRAN: 拒绝接受〔想法﹑提议﹑建议或计划〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They rejected the idea because it would cost too much money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有接受这个主意﹐因为耗资太大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Senate rejected a proposal to limit the program to two years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院拒绝了将该计划限定在两年内的提议。

Exponent.DEF: to politely refuse to accept an offer or invitation, or refuse to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 谢绝〔提议或邀请〕﹔礼貌地拒绝
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has declined all offers of help.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谢绝了所有人的帮助。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A palace spokesman declined to comment on the rumours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫廷发言人拒绝对传言发表评论。

Exponent.DEF: to refuse to allow someone to do something or enter somewhere
Exponent.TRAN: 拒绝〔某人做某事或进入某地〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were denied permission to publish the book.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有获准出版这本书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was denied access to the US.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被拒绝进入美国。

Exponent.DEF: to officially refuse to allow a law or plan, or to refuse to accept someone’s suggestion
Exponent.TRAN: 否决〔法律或计划〕﹔反对〔某人的建议〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Congress vetoed the bill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会否决了这项议案。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The suggestion was quickly vetoed by the other members of the team.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条建议很快遭到了队友的反对。

Exponent.DEF: to officially refuse to accept something because someone has broken the rules, or not done it in the correct way
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因违反规则或做法不正确而〕不承认﹐不接受
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The goal was disallowed by the referee.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个进球被裁判判为无效。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court decided to disallow his evidence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭裁决对他的证词不予采信。

Exponent.DEF: to refuse to accept someone’s offer, request, or suggestion
Exponent.TRAN: 回绝〔某人的提议或要求〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company raised its offer to $6 billion, but was rebuffed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司将出价提高到60亿美元﹐但遭到回绝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was politely rebuffed when he suggested holding the show in Dublin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他建议在都柏林上演这出戏﹐但被婉言拒绝。

Exponent.DEF: to refuse to allow or accept a plan or suggestion
Exponent.TRAN: 反对[拒绝]某人/某事物〔指计划或建议〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plan was given the thumbs down by the local authority.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划遭到地方当局反对。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They gave us the thumbs down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝了我们。

Sense.DEF: waste material that has been thrown away
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refuse dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾场
Sense.EXAMPLE: refuse collection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾收集

Sense.DEF: someone who refuses to take part in something or obey a law
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝参与者﹔抗拒法规者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Around 250,000 refuseniks have not paid the tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约25万抗拒者没有缴纳该税。

Sense.DEF: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

GramExa.PROPFORM: refute a hypothesis/a claim/an idea etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to refute Darwin’s theories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反驳达尔文理论的尝试

Sense.DEF: to say that a statement is wrong or unfair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She refuted any allegations of malpractice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她否认任何有关玩忽职守的指控。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=registration登记﹐注册

Sense.DEF:
used to show what year a car was first
register ed
,based on the first letter of its
number plate
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Y reg. BMW
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆Y字头牌照的宝马车

Sense.DEF: to get something back, especially an ability or quality, that you have lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family never quite regained its former influence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族再也没有恢复往昔的影响力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He somehow managed to regain his balance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总算恢复了平衡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government forces have regained control of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军已重新控制了这座城市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When she regained consciousness woke up after being unconscious , she was lying on the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恢复知觉醒来时﹐正躺在地板上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked stunned, but he soon regain ed his composure became calm again .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎愣了愣﹐但很快就恢复平静了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors don’t know if he will ever regain the use of his legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们不知道他的腿是否还能恢复功能。

Sense.DEF: to reach a place again
typical of a king or queen, suitable for a king or queen, or similar to a king or queen in behaviour, looks etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ceremony of regal splendour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家气派的典礼
Sense.EXAMPLE: James watched with regal detachment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯用高高在上的冷漠神情注视着。

Sense.DEF: to entertain someone by telling them about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过讲述某事〕逗…开心﹐使高兴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bailey regaled the customers with tales of our exploits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝利把我们的英勇事迹讲给顾客听﹐逗他们开心。

Sense.DEF: traditional clothes and decorations, used at official ceremonies
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royal regalia worn by a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家的礼服
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pipe band in full regalia wearing all their traditional clothes, decorations etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛装的风笛乐队

Sense.DEF: respect and admiration for someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jan’s regard for his great talent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简对他卓越才能的敬佩

Sense.EXAMPLE: Burt had high regard for his old law professor, Dr. Finch he respected him a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯特对他以前的法律教授芬奇博士非常敬重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The voters hold her in high regard respect or admire her .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民都很尊敬她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are held in low regard in this society are not respected or admired .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师在这个社会里不受尊重。

Sense.DEF: attention or consideration that is shown towards someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has no regard for other people’s feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无视别人的感受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One must show proper regard for the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都必须对法律表示应有的尊重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The present administration has demonstrated little regard for environmental issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现任政府对环境问题关注甚少。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All students must have access to quality education without regard to wealth or class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的学生﹐不论贫富和阶级﹐都必须享有接受高质量教育的权利。

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: US foreign policy with regard to Cuba
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国对古巴的外交政策

Sense.DEF: relating to something you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 在这方面﹐关于此事〔指与前文提到的内容有关〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s problems, in this regard, are certainly not unique.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这方面来讲﹐这些问题无疑并非该公司所独有。

Sense.DEF: good wishes - used when sending your good wishes to someone or when ending a short letter or message
Sense.TRAN: 致意﹐问候〔用于表达问候或结束简短的信函〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My husband sends his regards .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫向你问好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hope to see you soon. Regards, Chris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望很快见到你。 祝安﹐克里斯

GramExa.GLOSS: used to end a letter in a friendly but rather formal way
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 谨致问候〔友好但比较正式的问候﹐用于信的末尾〕

Sense.DEF: a long look without moving your eyes
to think about someone or something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul seemed to regard sex as sinful and immoral.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗好像把性视为罪恶和不道德的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Edith was widely regarded as considered by many people to be eccentric.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为伊迪丝是个怪人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His work is highly regarded regarded as very good by art experts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品得到艺术专家们的高度评价。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something, in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood back and regarded him coldly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她退后站着﹐冷冷地看着他。

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular subject - use this when you want to talk or write about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: As regards a cure for the disease, very few advances have been made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至于这种疾病的治疗﹐进展甚微。

Sense.DEF: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about
Sense.TRAN: 关于〔尤用于信函或演说中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regarding your recent inquiry, I have enclosed a copy of our new brochure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于你最近的咨询﹐我随信附上一本我们最新的手册。

Sense.DEF: without being affected or influenced by something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law requires equal treatment for all, regardless of race, religion, or sex.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律规定人人平等﹐无论种族﹑宗教或性别。

Sense.DEF: if you continue doing something regardless, you do it in spite of difficulties or other people telling you not to

GramExa.GLOSS: continue what you are doing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You get a lot of criticism, but you just have to carry on regardless.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你受到许多批评﹐但无论如何你只能继续下去。

Sense.DEF: a sports event at which there are races for rowing boats or sailing boats

a period of government by a
regent person who governs instead of a king or queen
Regency buildings, furniture etc are from or in the style of the period 1811-1820 in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑﹑家具等1811-1820年间〕英国摄政时期（风格）的

Sense.DEF: to make something develop and grow strong again
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to regenerate the US economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 振兴美国经济的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Marshall Plan sought to regenerate the shattered Europe of 1947.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马歇尔计划试图重建1947年千疮百孔的欧洲。

Sense.DEF: to grow again, or make something grow again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small nodules form as the liver cells regenerate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肝细胞再生时会形成一些小结节。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a regenerative process
a new strategy for urban regeneration

Sense.DEF: someone who governs instead of a king or queen, because the king or queen is ill, absent, or still a child

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the Prince Regent

Sense.DEF: a kind of popular music originally from Jamaica, with a strong regular beat
Sense.TRAN: 雷鬼乐〔源自牙买加的一种节奏强劲的流行音乐〕

Sense.DEF: the crime of killing a king or queen
someone who kills a king or queen
a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason
Sense.TRAN: 政权﹐〔尤指未经公平选举而掌权的〕政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 军事/极权主义/法西斯政权
残暴的/暴虐的/腐败的政权

Sense.DEF: a particular system - used especially when talking about a previous system, or one that has just been introduced
Sense.TRAN: 制度〔尤用于谈及以往或刚推行的制度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据新制度﹐所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

Sense.DEF: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dietary regime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食保健法

Sense.DEF: a change in the government of a country that happens because another country forces that government out of power
Sense.TRAN: 〔由另一个国家迫使的〕政权更替

Sense.DEF: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a regimen of morning stretching exercises
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上进行伸展锻炼的养生法

Sense.EXAMPLE: Patients maintain a strict dietary regimen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人严格遵守饮食规律。

Sense.DEF:
a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several
battalion s
a large number of people, animals, or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a regiment of ants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群蚂蚁

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the regimental commander

Sense.DEF: to organize and control people firmly and usually too strictly
Sense.EXAMPLE: the regimented routine of boarding school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寄宿学校严格的生活规律

Sense.DEF: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常无明确界线的〕地区﹔区域﹔地带
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to bring peace to the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Choco region of Colombia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哥伦比亚的乔科地区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flooding is likely in some coastal regions of the Northeast during the early part of the week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周初东北部一些沿海地区可能出现水患。

Sense.DEF: a particular part of someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lower back region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腰部

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a region of the brain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑部的一个区域

Sense.DEF: used to describe an amount of time, money etc without being exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grant somewhere in the region of £2,500
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔约2,500英镑的补助金

Sense.DEF: the parts of a country that are away from the capital city
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government policy to relocate jobs from the capital to the regions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将就业机会从首都转移到其他地区的政府政策

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular region or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: local and regional government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方及区域治理
Sense.EXAMPLE: regional variations in farming practice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农耕方式的地区性差异
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight regional accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻微的地方口音

RunOn.EXAMPLE: goods sold locally and regionally
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地方上和局部地区销售的货品

Sense.DEF: loyalty to a particular region of a country and the desire for it to be more independent politically
an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the official register of births, deaths, and marriages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生﹑死亡和结婚的官方登记册

Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you signed the hotel register ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

GramExa.GLOSS: official list of voters
say the names of the students in a class, to check who is there

Sense.DEF: the words, style, and grammar used by speakers and writers in a particular situation or in a particular type of writing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: letters written in a formal register
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用正式语体写的信

Sense.DEF: the range of musical notes that someone’s voice or a musical instrument can reach
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音或乐器的〕音域﹔声区﹔音区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the upper register of the cello
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大提琴的高音区

Sense.DEF:
a
cash register
Sense.TRAN: 现金出纳机﹐现金收入记录机

Sense.DEF:
a movable metal plate that controls the flow of air in a
heating
or
cooling system
Sense.TRAN: 〔供暖或制冷设备上控制气流的〕调风器﹐节气门

Sense.DEF: to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tanker is registered in Rotterdam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘油轮是在鹿特丹登记的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How many students have registered for English classes?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You must bring your insurance card with you when you register with a dentist or doctor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向牙医或医生登记的时候必须带保险卡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The baby’s birth was registered this morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上给宝宝做了出生登记。

GramExa.GLOSS: be on an official list of a particular group
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 登记为失业者/残疾人等

Sense.DEF: to officially state your opinion about something so that everyone knows what you think or feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The delegation registered a formal protest with US embassy officials Wednesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表团在星期三向美国大使馆官员提出了正式抗议。

Sense.DEF: if something registers, or if you register it, you realize or notice it, and then remember it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had told me her name before, but I guess it didn’t register.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前告诉过我她的名字﹐不过我好像没在意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d been standing there for several minutes before he registered my presence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在那儿站了好几分钟﹐他才注意到我。

Sense.DEF: if an instrument registers an amount or if something registers on it, the instrument shows that amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thermometer registered 98.6˚.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度计上显示98.6度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake registered 7.2 on the Richter scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次地震为里氏震级7.2级。

Sense.DEF: to show or express a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face registered shock and anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上流露出震惊和愤怒。

Sense.DEF:
to send a package, letter etc by
registered post
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you register the parcel?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那包裹你是用挂号邮寄的吗？

Sense.DEF: the office of a company in Britain, to which all letters and official documents must be sent
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国公司接收信件和正式文件的〕注册办事处

Sense.DEF: a way of insuring something that you send by post in case it gets lost or damaged

a
registry office
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国办理出生﹑结婚﹑死亡登记的〕户籍登记处

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of official records of births, marriages, and deaths
an official of a college or university who deals with the running of the college
Sense.TRAN: 〔学院或大学的〕教务长﹐教务主任﹔注册主任

Sense.DEF:
a hospital doctor who has finished his or her training but is of a lower rank than a
consultant
the act of recording names and details on an official list

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the registration of motor vehicles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机动车的登记
