Sense.EXAMPLE: Student registration for a course of study starts the first week in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生注册在9月份的第一个星期开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The registration fee is $75.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注册费是75美元。

Sense.DEF: an official piece of paper containing details about a motor vehicle and the name of its owner
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I see your license and registration , ma’am?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫人﹐我能看一下你的驾照和登记证吗？

Sense.DEF:
the official set of numbers and letters shown on the front and back of a vehicle on the
number plate
a place where information used by an organization is kept, especially official records or lists

used when saying where something, especially a ship, is officially
register ed
Sense.TRAN: 登记〔尤指船舶在某地登记〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the registry of the vessel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船舶登记

Sense.DEF: a local government building in Britain where you can get married, and where births, marriages, and deaths are officially recorded
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国可办理结婚手续并负责出生﹑结婚和死亡登记的〕户籍登记处

Sense.DEF: to go back to an earlier and worse condition, or to a less developed way of behaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient had regressed to a state of childish dependency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人退回到像小孩一样依赖他人的状态。

Sense.DEF: the act of returning to an earlier condition that is worse or less developed
the act of thinking or behaving as you did at an earlier time of your life, such as when you were a child
returning to an earlier, less advanced state, or causing something to do this - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 退步的﹐倒退的﹔退化的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many considered the changes to the welfare laws a regressive step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为福利法的变革是一种退步。

Sense.DEF: a tax that has less effect on the rich than on the poor
to feel sorry about something you have done and wish you had not done it
Sense.TRAN: 后悔〔做了某事〕﹔对…感到遗憾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t do anything you might regret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要做自己会后悔的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I regret leaving school so young.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我后悔那么早就辍学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was beginning to regret that he’d come along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始后悔自己跟着一起来。

Sense.DEF: used in official letters or statements when saying that you are sorry or sad about something
Sense.TRAN: 对…感到抱歉[遗憾]〔用于正式的信函或声明中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I regret that I will be unable to attend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐我不能参加。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I regret to inform you that your contract will not be renewed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很遗憾地通知你﹐你的合同将不予续签。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I deeply regretted what had happened.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对发生的事深感遗憾。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a feeling of great sadness
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I bitterly regretted my decision to leave.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我痛悔作出离开的决定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The airline sincerely regrets any delays to passengers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司对于给旅客造成的延误表示诚挚的歉意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We very much regret that there will be job losses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很遗憾将会裁员。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: regret it in the future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you don’t go, you may live to regret it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你不去﹐以后会后悔的。

Sense.DEF: sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no regrets about leaving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我毫不后悔离开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has already expressed deep regret for what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于发生的这一切﹐她深表遗憾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided with some regret that it was time to move on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遗憾地作出决定﹐该是我另谋发展的时候了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐我不得不谢绝你的好意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lost touch with her, much to my regret.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾的是﹐我和她失去了联系。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are unable to go to a meeting, accept an invitation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不能赴会﹑接受邀请等〕表示歉意
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was ill and had to send his regrets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲因病不能前往﹐只好表示歉意。

Sense.DEF: someone who is regretful feels sorry or disappointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She apologized and sounded genuinely regretful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她道歉了﹐听语气是真心觉得后悔。

Sense.DEF: feeling sad because you do not want to do what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I must go,’ he said regretfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我必须走了。”他遗憾地说。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a situation that you wish was different or that you are sorry about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regretfully, we do not have time to continue this discussion now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐我们现在没有时间继续这一讨论。

Sense.DEF: something that is regrettable is unpleasant, and you wish things could be different
Sense.TRAN: 令人懊悔的﹐可惜的﹐令人遗憾的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was a very regrettable error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个令人很遗憾的错误。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s regrettable that classical music receives so little attention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐人们对古典音乐关注甚少。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a situation that you wish was different or that you are sorry about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regrettably, he will not be able to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是他到时候来不了。

Sense.DEF: to form a group again in order to be more effective, or to make people do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Allies regrouped and launched a new attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盟军重新部署﹐发动了一次新的进攻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Russians retreated, needing to regroup their forces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄国人需要重组军力﹐于是撤退了。

Sense.DEF: to stop and think about something, so that you can start to do something again in a better way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I paused for a minute to regroup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我停了停﹐重新整理思绪。

Sense.DEF: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between
Sense.TRAN: 定期的﹐定时的﹔有规律的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司定期召集雇员开会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing was slow and regular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hear from him on a regular basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们定期收到他的来信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork always at the same time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们﹐非常准时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regular job a job that you do during normal working hours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固定的工作

Sense.DEF: happening or doing something very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regular occurrence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise helps keep your weight down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼有助于减轻体重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the bar’s regular customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是这家酒吧的常客之一。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Penn Station was in regular use people used it often until the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩恩车站正常使用到20世纪60年代。

Sense.DEF: normal or usual
Sense.TRAN: 正常的﹔通常的﹔平常的﹔惯常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has returned to his regular duties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经回去正常上班了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our regular opening hours are 10 am to 7 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正常的营业时间是从上午10点到下午7点。

Sense.DEF: with the same amount of space between each thing and the next
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pipes were placed at regular intervals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管道按固定的间距安放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carpet with a regular pattern of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块有着规则花卉图案的地毯

Sense.DEF: ordinary, without any special feature or qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regular type of guy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个普通人

Sense.DEF: of a normal or standard size
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regular Coke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准装可乐

Sense.DEF: evenly shaped with parts or sides of equal size
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regular hexagon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正六边形
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very handsome, with strong regular features an evenly shaped face .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很英俊﹐五官十分端正。

Sense.DEF: a regular verb changes its forms in the same way as most verbs, for example its past tense and past participle end in ‘ed’. The verb ‘dance’ is regular, but the verb ‘be’ is not.
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词〕规则的〔如动词dance是规则的﹐而be是不规则的〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you think someone is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a regular little dictator!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个十足的小霸王！

Sense.DEF: a regular army etc is permanent, and exists whether there is a war or not

Subsense.DEF:
to get rid of waste from your
bowel s
often enough to be healthy

a woman who is regular has her
menstrual period
at the same time each month

Sense.DEF: someone who often goes to the same bar, restaurant etc or who takes part in an activity very often
Sense.TRAN: 常客﹐老主顾﹔经常参加…活动的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The barman knows all the regulars by name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位酒吧男侍应叫得出所有常客的名字。

Sense.DEF: a soldier whose permanent job is in the army

petrol that contains
lead

if you ride a
skateboard
or
snowboard
regular footed, you ride with your left foot at the front of the board and your right foot at the back
Sense.TRAN: 常规站姿的〔指滑板或单板滑雪运动的一种站姿﹐左脚在前﹐右脚在后〕

Sense.DEF: when the same thing keeps happening often, especially with the same amount of time between each occasion when it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Climate change is disrupting the regularity of the seasons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候的变化正在打乱季节的规律性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our team kept losing with monotonous regularity in a way that seems boring or annoying .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们球队一次又一次地输掉比赛﹐让人感到厌烦。

Sense.DEF: when something is arranged in an even way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the regularity of his features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他端正的五官

Sense.DEF: to make a situation that has existed for some time legal or official
at the same time each day, week, month etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We meet regularly, once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们定期见面﹐每月一次。

Sense.DEF: often
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see them pretty regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常见到他们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to exercise regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼很重要。

Sense.DEF: evenly arranged or shaped
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plants are regularly spaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植株间距均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: regularly shaped crystals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形状规则的水晶

Sense.DEF: to control an activity or process, especially by rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: strict rules regulating the use of chemicals in food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 限制化学品在食物中使用的严格规定

Sense.DEF: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人出汗以调节体温。

Sense.DEF: an official rule or order
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seem to be so many rules and regulations these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今好像条条框框很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new regulations on imports
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的进口条例

Sense.EXAMPLE: regulations governing the safety of toys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监控玩具安全的条例

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local authority is introducing new planning regulations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方政府正在实施新的规划条例。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All companies must comply with the regulations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有公司都必须遵守规定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the new regulations, all staff must have safety training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据新条例﹐所有员工都必须接受安全培训。

Sense.DEF: control over something, especially by rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过规章进行的〕控制﹔管理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the regulation of public spending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公共开支的管理

Sense.DEF: used or worn because of official rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用或穿戴〕符合规定的﹔正规的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls were all wearing regulation shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们都穿着规定的鞋子。

Sense.DEF: an instrument for controlling the temperature, speed etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heat regulator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热调节器

Sense.DEF: someone who makes sure that a system operates properly or fairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: traffic safety regulators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通安全管理者

Sense.DEF: a regulatory authority has the official power to control an activity and to make sure that it is done in a satisfactory way
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构〕具有监管权的﹐监管的﹐管理的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New drugs have been approved by the regulatory authority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新药已经得到监管机构的批准。

Sense.DEF: to bring food that you have already swallowed, back into your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some birds and animals regurgitate food to feed their young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些鸟兽会回吐食物以喂哺幼崽。

Sense.DEF: to repeat facts, ideas etc that you have read or heard without thinking about them yourself - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 照搬﹐〔不加思考地〕重复〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tries to get students to think critically, not just regurgitate facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图让学生进行批判性的思考﹐而不仅仅是照本宣科。

Sense.DEF: the process of curing someone who has an alcohol or drugs problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rehab program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康复治疗计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent three months in rehab.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了三个月进行康复治疗。

Sense.DEF: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison
Sense.TRAN: 协助〔重病患者〕康复﹔帮助〔刑满释放者〕恢复正常生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: a special unit for rehabilitating stroke patients
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协助中风患者康复的特殊病房

Sense.DEF: to make people think that someone or something is good again after a period when people had a bad opinion of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister seems to be trying to rehabilitate the former defence secretary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相似乎在努力为前国防大臣恢复名誉。

Sense.DEF: to improve a building or area so that it returns to the good condition it was in before
Sense.TRAN: 使恢复原状﹐修复〔建筑或地区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the older houses have now been rehabilitated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多老房子现在都进行了修葺。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the rehabilitation of mentally ill patients
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病患者的康复治疗

Sense.DEF: to use the same ideas again in a new form that is not really different or better - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 把〔原来的内容〕改头换面〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He simply rehashed the same story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是把同一个故事改头换面了一下。

Sense.DEF: to repeat something that was discussed earlier, especially in an annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以令人恼怒的方式〕重提﹐重复
Sense.EXAMPLE: This issue has been rehashed so many times already.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题已经重提过太多次了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was just a rehash of last year’s show.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只不过是去年节目的翻版。

Sense.DEF: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rehearsal for ‘Romeo and Juliet’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《罗密欧与朱丽叶》的排演

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dialogue was worked out by actors in rehearsal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段对白是演员在排练的时候想出来的。

Sense.DEF: a time when all the people involved in a big event practise it together before it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wedding rehearsal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼的预演

Sense.DEF: to practise or make people practise something such as a play or concert in order to prepare for a public performance
Sense.TRAN: （使）排练﹐ （使）排演〔戏剧或音乐会等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we need to rehearse the first scene again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们需要把第一场再排练一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band was rehearsing for their world tour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队正在为他们的世界巡回演出排练。

Sense.DEF: to practise something that you plan to say to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had carefully rehearsed her resignation speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认真演练过辞职时要说的话。

Sense.DEF: to repeat an opinion that has often been expressed before
Sense.TRAN: 重复〔过去经常有人表达的观点〕

Sense.DEF: to make a meal or drink hot again
Sense.EXAMPLE: I reheated some soup for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把汤重新热了一下﹐午饭时喝。

Sense.DEF:
to arrange for a pet to have a new owner and home, especially a pet that has been looked after in a
shelter
Sense.TRAN: 为〔尤指收容所里的宠物〕找寻新家
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kittens have been rehomed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小猫已经找到新主人了。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a new or better home
Sense.EXAMPLE: All flood victims will be rehoused as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有水灾灾民都将尽快得到安置。

Sense.DEF:
the period when someone is king, queen, or
emperor

GramExa.EXAMPLE: changes that took place during Charlemagne’s reign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理曼大帝统治时期的变革
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the reign of James I
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯一世统治时期

Sense.DEF: the period when someone is in charge of an organization, team etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: during his reign at the Education Department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他担任教育部领导期间

Sense.DEF: a period during which something is the most powerful or most important feature of a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the reign of Stalinism in the Soviet Union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯大林主义主导苏联的时期

Sense.DEF: a period when a ruler or a government kills many of their political opponents

to rule a nation or group of nations as their king, queen, or
emperor
Sense.EXAMPLE: George VI reigned from 1936 to 1952.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治六世于1936年至1952年在位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pharaohs reigned over Egypt for centuries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法老在埃及统治了几个世纪。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or quality reigns, it exists strongly for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: For several minutes confusion reigned .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几分钟场面大乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silence reigned while we waited for news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在等待消息的时候鸦雀无声。

Sense.DEF: the most recent winner of a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can he defeat the reigning Wimbledon champion?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能否击败现任温布尔登网球赛冠军？

Sense.DEF: if someone or something reigns supreme, they are the most important part of a situation or time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a time when romance reigned supreme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个极为浪漫的时代。

Sense.DEF: to pay money back to someone when their money has been spent or lost

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company will reimburse you for travel expenses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的旅费可向公司报销。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow band of leather that is fastened around a horse’s head in order to control it
to allow an emotion or feeling to be expressed freely
Sense.TRAN: 放任〔情感〕﹐对〔思想〕不加约束
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave free rein to his imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他任想象信马由缰。

Sense.DEF: to give someone complete freedom to do a job in whatever way they choose

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep a tight rein on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to control something strictly
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物严加控制
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance director keeps a tight rein on spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务主管严格控制开支。

Sense.DEF: to take or give someone control over an organization or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owens will officially take over the reins in a few weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个星期以后欧文斯将正式接手掌权。

Sense.DEF: to start to control a situation more strictly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is reining in public expenditure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正在收紧公共开支。

Sense.DEF: to make a horse go more slowly by pulling on the reins
to be born again in another body after you have died
the belief that after someone dies their soul lives again in another body
the person or animal that contains the soul of a dead person or animal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She thinks she is a reincarnation of Cleopatra.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为自己是克里奥帕特拉转世。

Sense.DEF:
a large
deer
with long wide
antler s horns
, that lives in cold northern areas
to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger
Sense.TRAN: 加强﹐强化〔观点﹑思想或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film reinforces the idea that women should be pretty and dumb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片强化了这个观点——女人要漂亮﹐而且要笨一些。

Sense.DEF: to make part of a building, structure, piece of clothing etc stronger
Sense.TRAN: 加强﹐加固〔建筑的一部分﹑结构等〕﹔使〔衣物的某个部位〕更结实

Sense.DEF: to make a group of people, especially an army, stronger by adding people, equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 增援﹐使更强大﹐加强〔尤指军队〕的力量

Sense.DEF:
concrete
with metal bars in it to make it stronger
more soldiers, police etc who are sent to a battle, fight etc to make their group stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police called for reinforcements .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方要求增援。

Sense.DEF: positive reinforcement is when you give someone praise or rewards for their behaviour or work, so they want to continue doing well. Negative reinforcement is when you give someone punishments or criticism when their behaviour or work is bad, so that they want to improve to avoid punishments again.
Sense.TRAN: 正强化/负强化〔正强化指给予某人表扬或奖励﹐使其继续表现良好﹔负强化指给予某人惩罚或批评﹐使其改正以免再次受到惩罚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to give students plenty of positive reinforcement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要给学生足够的正面鼓励。

Sense.DEF: the act of making something stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge needs some structural reinforcement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座桥需要结构性加固。

Sense.DEF: if someone is reinstated, they are officially given back their job after it was taken away
to make something such as a law, system, or rule exist again
Sense.EXAMPLE: California reinstated the death penalty in 1977.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚于1977年恢复了死刑。

Sense.DEF: to share the insurance of something between two or more companies, so that there is less risk for each
Sense.TRAN: 分保﹐给…再保险 〔由两家或两家以上公司承保﹐以分担风险〕

Sense.DEF: to think about something, show something, perform something etc in a new way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book reinterprets the Dracula legend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书重新诠释了德古拉的传说。

Sense.DEF: to start using something again or bring something back to an area after it had not been used or had not existed there for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to reintroduce a capital-gains tax on securities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恢复证券资本利得税的计划

Sense.DEF: to make changes to an idea, method, system etc in order to improve it or make it more modern
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to reinvent the American educational system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革美国教育制度的计划

Sense.DEF: to do something differently from before, especially in order to improve or change the way people think of you
Sense.TRAN: 重塑自己的形象﹐改变自己的形象
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bowie has constantly reinvented himself during his long career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在漫长的职业生涯中﹐鲍伊常常改变自己的形象。

Sense.DEF: to waste time trying to find a way to do something when someone else has already discovered the best way to do it
Sense.TRAN: 无谓地重复﹐徒劳﹐白费功夫〔因别人早已发现做某事的最好方法〕

Sense.DEF:
to use money you have earned from
investment s
to buy additional investments
Sense.TRAN: 再投资﹔把〔利润〕用于再投资

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She reinvested the dividends in mutual funds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把红利再投资于共同基金。

Sense.DEF: to produce a record, book etc again, after it has not been available for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an early jazz record reissued on CD
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以CD形式重新发行的早期爵士乐唱片

Sense.DEF: to repeat a statement or opinion in order to make your meaning as clear as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me reiterate the most important points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来把最重要的几点重申一遍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lawyers reiterated that there was no direct evidence against Mr Evans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师重申没有对埃文斯先生不利的直接证据。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a reiteration of his previous statement

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gibson rejected the idea as ‘absurd’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉布森拒绝了这个想法﹐说它“荒谬”。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Dexter flatly rejected completely rejected calls for his resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His proposal was rejected outright completely rejected .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

Sense.DEF: to not choose someone for a job, course of study etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s obvious why his application was rejected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他申请被拒的原因很明显。

Sense.DEF: to throw away something that has just been made, because its quality is not good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: If inspectors find a defective can, the batch is rejected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果质检员发现一个罐头有瑕疵﹐那么这一批货就会被废弃。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to give someone any love or attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children feel abandoned or rejected if they don’t see their parents regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子如果不能经常见到父母﹐就会感到被遗弃或冷落。

Sense.DEF:
if your body rejects an organ, after a
transplant
operation, it does not accept that organ
a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop selling cheap rejects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售廉价次品的商店

Sense.DEF: someone who is not accepted or liked by another person, or by other people
Sense.TRAN: 不合格者﹔被排斥者﹔被拒收者
Sense.EXAMPLE: They felt that they were society’s rejects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们感到自己是社会的弃儿。

Sense.DEF: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝接受[相信﹐赞同]﹔否决

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are the reasons for his rejection of the theory?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不接受这个理论的原因是什么？

Sense.DEF: the act of not accepting someone for a job, school etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sent me a rejection letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone stops giving you love or attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was left with a feeling of rejection and loss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一种遭人嫌弃的失落感。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or organize something in a different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to rejig the schedule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调整时间表的计划

Sense.DEF: to feel or show that you are very happy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His family rejoiced at the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这个消息﹐他全家都欢欣鼓舞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We rejoiced in our good fortune.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们庆幸自己的好运。

Sense.DEF: to have a name or title that is silly or amusing
Sense.TRAN: 有个滑稽的名字/称呼叫…
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rejoices in the name of Pigg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有个滑稽的名字叫皮格。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people are very happy because they have had good news

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was great rejoicing at the victory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们热烈庆祝胜利。

Sense.DEF: to go back to a group of people, organization etc that you were with before
Sense.TRAN: 重返﹐回到〔某一群体﹑组织等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rejoined her friends in the lounge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回到休息室和朋友们待在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1938 he rejoined the Socialists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1938年他重回社会党。

Sense.DEF: to say something in reply, especially rudely or angrily
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指粗鲁或愤怒地〕回答﹐反驳
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t care!’ she rejoined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不在乎！”她回嘴道。

Sense.DEF: a reply, especially a rude one
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to think of a snappy rejoinder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图想出一句简短的话来反驳。

Sense.DEF: to make something work much better or become much better again
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某事物〕变得更有活力﹔使〔某事物〕恢复活力
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to rejuvenate the inner city areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧城区复兴计划

Sense.DEF: to make someone look or feel young and strong again
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕变得年轻﹔使〔某人〕恢复活力
Sense.EXAMPLE: I came back from holiday feeling rejuvenated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我度假回来﹐感到恢复了活力。

Sense.DEF: to make someone have a particular feeling, thought etc again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial has rekindled painful memories of the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场审判又唤起了人们对战争的痛苦回忆。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
relay 3
Sense.TRAN: relay 3 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were afraid he might relapse into a coma.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们担心他会再次昏迷。

Sense.DEF: to start to behave badly again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clara soon relapsed into her old ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉拉很快又重蹈过去的恶习。

Sense.DEF: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a relapse and died soon after.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她旧病复发﹐不久就去世了。

Sense.DEF: if two things relate, they are connected in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand how the two ideas relate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白这两个观点有什么联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The charges of fraud relate to events that took place over ten years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些欺诈指控涉及十多年前发生的事件。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say something has (something) to do with another thing, rather than relates to it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 have (something) to do with﹐而不说 relate to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The changes have to do with events that took place over ten years ago.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变化与十几年前发生的事有关。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand what the two ideas have to do with each other.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白这两个观点有什么关联。

Sense.DEF: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected
Sense.TRAN: 证明…有联系﹐把…联系起来

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about events that have happened to you or to someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He later related the whole story to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you understand someone’s problem, situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对别人的问题﹑处境等〕认同﹐理解

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laurie finds it difficult to relate to children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳里觉得很难理解小孩子的想法。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know he feels upset, and I can relate to that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他难过﹐也能理解他的感受。

Sense.DEF: things that are related are connected in some way
Sense.TRAN: 有关系的﹐有联系的﹐相关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police now believe that the three crimes could be related.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前警方认为三宗案件可能互相关联。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of drug abuse and other related issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滥用毒品问题以及其他相关问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffers with memory loss related to his disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因病丧失了记忆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Education levels are strongly related to income.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育程度和收入有很大的关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people suffering from tobacco-related illnesses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 患有与抽烟有关的疾病的人

Sense.DEF: connected by a family relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you two related?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个是亲戚吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I might be related to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他可能有亲戚关系。

Sense.DEF: animals, plants, languages etc that are related belong to the same group
Sense.TRAN: 〔动植物﹑语言等〕同类的﹐同族的﹐同系的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dolphins and porpoises are closely related.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚和鼠海豚是近亲。

Exponent.DEF: used about things that have a connection with each other. Connected is not used before a noun.
Exponent.TRAN: 有联系的﹐相关的〔connected不用于名词前〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Physics and Maths are closely related.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理和数学密切相关。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two problems are connected.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个问题有关联。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: homelessness and other related issues
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无家可归现象及与之相关的问题

Exponent.DEF: having a direct connection – often used when one thing is the cause of the other
Exponent.TRAN: 直接相关的〔常指一事为另一事的原因〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Skin cancer is directly linked to sun exposure and damage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤癌与日晒和晒伤直接相关。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two closely linked factors produced this result.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个密切相关的因素造成这一结果。

Exponent.DEF: used about two or more things that are connected with each other and affect each other in a complicated series of ways
Exponent.TRAN: 互相关联的﹔互相影响的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The various parts of society are closely interrelated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会各部分紧密关联。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book consists of a series of interconnected essays.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中收录一系列彼此相关的文章。

Exponent.DEF: used about two or more things, countries, people etc that depend on each other, and cannot exist or continue without each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two countries’ economies have become increasingly interdependent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国经济越来越相互依存。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: interdependent relationships between species
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 物种间相互依存的关系

Exponent.DEF: related to what is being discussed or to a particular area of activity
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The exam tests the way you select and organize information relevant to the question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项测试考察你对与问题相关信息的选择和编排方法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Applicants should have several years’ relevant experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请者应当拥有数年相关经验。

Exponent.DEF: to be very closely connected – used about two things that need to be considered together
Exponent.TRAN: 与某事物密切关联〔用于需同时考虑的两个事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The history of the city has long been bound up with the sea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市的历史长期以来都与大海密切相关。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your professional development is closely bound up with personal growth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业发展与个人成长密切关联。

Sense.DEF: about or concerning
Sense.EXAMPLE: documents relating to immigration laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与移民法相关的文件

Subsense.DEF: official connections between countries, companies, organizations etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑公司﹑组织等之间的〕（正式）关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain threatened to break off diplomatic relations with the regime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国威胁要和该政权断绝外交关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Relations between the two countries have improved recently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近两国关系有所改善。

Subsense.DEF: the way in which people or groups of people behave towards each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Relations between workers and management are generally good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资关系总的来说不错。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about something that is connected with or compared with the thing you are talking about
Subsense.TRAN: 相对某事物而言〔用于显示两者的联系或进行比较〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Women’s earnings are still low in relation to men’s.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的收入相对于男性而言仍然偏低。

Subsense.DEF: concerning
Subsense.TRAN: 关于某事物﹐涉及某事物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: latest developments in relation to the disease
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关这种疾病的最新进展

Sense.DEF: a connection between two or more things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the relation between prices and wages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 物价和工资之间的联系

Sense.EXAMPLE: The price the meat is sold for bears no relation to is not connected to the price the farmer receives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉的售价和农民拿到的价格无关。

Sense.DEF: a member of your family
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have relations in Canada and Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在加拿大和苏格兰都有亲戚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What relation are you to Jessica?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和杰茜卡是什么亲戚关系？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steve is a distant relation of my wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫是我妻子的远房亲戚。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many Japanese favor closer relations with the U.S.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多日本人赞同与美国保持更密切的关系。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Relations between neighbours on the estate are very good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区邻里关系很好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had begun to establish friendly relations with his co-workers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始与同事建立起了友好关系。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: relations between people from different races who live in the same place
relations between managers and workers
official relations between two countries
relations between different groups in society

Collocate.EXAMPLE: After the incident, Croatia broke off all relations with Serbia.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那起事件之后﹐克罗地亚断绝了与塞尔维亚的一切关系。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company has tried to establish relations with several universities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司试图与数家大学建立起联系。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: begin them again after they were stopped or interrupted
make them less friendly

Sense.DEF: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和父母关系很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the special relationship between Britain and the US
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国和美国之间的特殊关系

Sense.DEF: the way in which two or more things are connected and affect each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the relationship between diet and health problems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s studying politics and its relationship to the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在研究政治及其与媒体的关系。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lessons bear little relationship they are not connected to the children’s needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些课和儿童的需要几乎不相干。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people spend time together or live together, and have romantic or sexual feelings for each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两人之间的〕爱情关系﹔性关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never had a sexual relationship before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前从未与人有过性关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t really want a relationship with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不太想和我谈恋爱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you in a relationship right now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你眼下在恋爱吗？

Sense.DEF: the way in which you are related to someone in your family

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s your relationship to Sue?’ ‘She’s my cousin.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你和休是什么关系？”“她是我的表姐。”

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ve always had a good relationship with our neighbours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直与邻居关系很好。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 发展/形成/建立一种关系
Collocate.EXAMPLE: By that age, children start developing relationships outside the family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了那个年龄﹐小孩子开始与外人接触。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: develop a strong relationship
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We want to forge closer relationships with our allies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望与盟友结成更加紧密的关系。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it firm and strong

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Over the years, we’ve developed a good relationship.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来﹐我们的关系发展得不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Laura had a very close relationship with her grandmother.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉和奶奶非常亲。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My friendly relationship with Scott’s family continued after his death.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特去世后﹐我同他家人继续保持友谊。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our relationship is strong enough to survive anything.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的关系很稳固﹐经得起任何考验。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone both likes and dislikes someone else
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The local people have a love-hate relationship with tourists.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人对游客又爱又恨。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a particularly close relationship
a relationship appropriate for people who work together

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 医患关系/亲子关系/师生关系等

Sense.DEF: a member of your family
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gathering of friends and relatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲朋好友的聚会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her boyfriend is a distant relative of mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的男朋友是我的远房亲戚。

Exponent.DEF: a member of your family, especially one who does not live with you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most of her relatives were able to come to the wedding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的大部分亲戚都能来参加婚礼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We have some distant relatives in Australia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在澳大利亚有些远亲。

Exponent.DEF: a member of your family. Relation means the same as relative. It is often used when talking about whether someone is in the same family as another person.
Exponent.TRAN: 亲戚〔含义与relative相同﹐常用于谈论某人与另一人是否为一家人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Big cities can be lonely places if you have no friends or relations there.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是没有朋友或亲戚﹐在大城市里就可能很孤独。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘ What relation is she to you ?’ ‘She’s my half sister.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “她是你什么人？”“她是我同母异父的姐姐。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s no relation to the singer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是那个歌手的亲戚。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is a family member of a person who lived and died a long time ago, for example the great-grandchild of that person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The people are the descendants of slaves who were brought over from Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人是那些从非洲带过来的奴隶的后代。

Exponent.DEF: a member of your family who lived a long time ago, especially hundreds of years ago
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My ancestors originally came from Ireland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖先来自爱尔兰。

Exponent.DEF: people in your family who lived a long time ago – often used in historical descriptions
Exponent.TRAN: 祖先〔常用于历史性描述〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His forefathers came to America over a century ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个世纪之前﹐他的祖先来到美国。

Exponent.DEF: a family group that consists not only of parents and children, but also includes grandparents, aunts etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Extended families rarely live together in Britain, but they are still important.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国﹐大家庭成员很少住在一起﹐但他们依然很重要。

Exponent.DEF: your family, especially your parents
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you going to see your folks at Christmas?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节你会去看家人吗？

Exponent.DEF: the person or people who are most closely related to you, for example your husband or mother, and who need to be told if something serious happens to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The next of kin must be notified of his death before his name is released to the press.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的死讯必须先通知至亲﹐然后才能将其姓名透露给媒体。

Sense.DEF: having a particular quality when compared with something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative you are not poor compared to some people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能认为自己很穷﹐但一切都是相对的。

Sense.DEF: connected with a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: facts relative to this issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与这个问题有关的事实

Sense.DEF: a part of a sentence that has a verb in it, and is joined to the rest of the sentence by ‘who’, ‘which’, ‘where’ etc, for example the phrase ‘who lives next door’ in the sentence ‘The man who lives next door is a doctor.’
Sense.TRAN: 关系从句〔如在 The man who lives next door is a doctor一句中﹐who lives next door 是关系从句〕

Sense.DEF: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system is relatively easy to use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

Sense.DEF: used when comparing something with all similar things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relatively speaking, land prices are still pretty cheap here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对来说﹐这里的土地价格还相当便宜。

Sense.DEF:
a
pronoun
such as ‘who’, ‘which’, or ‘that’ by which a relative clause is connected to the rest of the sentence

the belief in
philosophy
that nothing is absolutely true and that things can only be judged in comparison with one another
Sense.TRAN: 相对主义〔认为不存在绝对正确﹐只能通过比较来判断事物的一种哲学思想〕

Sense.DEF:
the relationship in
physics
between time, space, and movement according to Einstein’s
theory
a new effort to sell a product that is already on sale

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The product is being relaunched with a new name.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个产品正以新名称再次投放市场。

Sense.DEF: to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to sit down and relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想坐下来休息一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What Robyn needed was a drink to relax her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萝宾需要的是喝一杯放松放松。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hot bath should help to relax you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗个热水澡可以帮助你放松下来。

Sense.DEF: to become quiet and calm after you have been upset or nervous, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once out of danger, he started to relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一脱离危险﹐他就开始放心了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relax! Everything’s fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松点！ 一切都很好。

Sense.DEF: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

Sense.DEF: to make a rule or law less strict

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hughes believes that immigration controls should not be relaxed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休斯认为不应放宽移民管制。

Subsense.DEF: to hold something less tightly than before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He relaxed his grip on my arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他松开了抓着我胳膊的手。

Subsense.DEF: to become less strict in the way you control something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party has no intention of relaxing its hold on the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政党无意放松其对国家的控制。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the amount of attention you give to something
Sense.TRAN: 使注意力松懈/放松警惕等

Exponent.DEF: to rest or do something that is enjoyable after you have been working
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the evenings, I like to relax with some music and a nice meal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 入夜时分﹐我喜欢听听音乐﹐吃顿丰盛的晚餐﹐放松一下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In two weeks’ time I’ll be relaxing on a beach in Greece.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两周后﹐我就将在希腊的海滩上享受惬意了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop working or stop being active, and sit down or lie down so that you become less tired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你累的话﹐我们就停下来休息一会儿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor told me to take some time off work and try to rest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生要我请几天假﹐尽量休息。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually relax after you have been working hard or feeling anxious
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在劳累工作或紧张焦虑之后〕放松﹐松弛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been a bad day and he just wanted to get home and unwind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一天很糟﹐他只想回家放松一下。

Exponent.DEF: to relax and not do very much, especially after working very hard or being ill
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在辛苦工作或病后〕放松﹐休息
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Now that you’ve finished your exams, you can take it easy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然考试结束﹐你可以休息了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor said he’ll have to take things easy for while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他得休息一阵子。

Exponent.DEF: to rest for a short time after a tiring activity, especially by sitting with your feet resting on something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kate poured herself a drink and put her feet up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特给自己倒了杯喝的﹐然后搁起脚休息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When you’re pregnant and doing a full-time job, you must find time to put your feet up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是怀孕了还要做全职工作﹐就必须找时间休息。

Exponent.DEF: to relax completely, or stop worrying and getting annoyed about things – used mainly by young people
Exponent.TRAN: 放松﹔冷静〔主要为年轻人使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We spent the day chilling out by the pool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一整天都待在泳池边休息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hey dude, chill out! It’s only a car!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐朋友﹐别紧张！不过是辆汽车而已！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let’s go back to my place and chill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去我家放松放松。

Sense.DEF: a way of resting and enjoying yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I play the piano for relaxation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弹钢琴自娱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meditation allows you to enter a state of deep relaxation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冥想能使你进入完全放松的状态。

Sense.DEF: the process of making rules on the control of something less strict

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a relaxation of government regulations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府法令的放宽

Sense.DEF: feeling calm, comfortable, and not worried or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gail was lying in the sun looking very relaxed and happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖尔躺在阳光下﹐看上去十分轻松愉快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel more relaxed about my career than I used to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于事业我比以前更淡定了。

Sense.DEF: a situation that is relaxed is comfortable and informal
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a very relaxed atmosphere in the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里的气氛十分轻松。

Sense.DEF: not strict, or not feeling that you have to do something in the way that other people think you should do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has a fairly relaxed approach to housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她干家务活很随意。

Sense.DEF: making you feel relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a relaxing evening at home
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家里度过的一个轻松的夜晚

Sense.DEF: if people do something in relays, several small groups of them do it, one group after another, so that the activity is continuous
a relay race
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 100 metres relay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一百米接力赛

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment that receives radio or television signals and sends them on
to pass a message from one person or place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He quickly relayed this news to the other members of staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

Sense.DEF: if radio or television signals are relayed, they are received and sent, especially so that they can be heard on the radio or seen on television
Sense.TRAN: 中继转发﹐转播〔广播或电视信号〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The broadcasts were relayed by satellite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些电视节目通过卫星进行转播。

Sense.DEF: to lay something on the ground again because it was not done well enough before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carpet will have to be relaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯必须重铺。

Sense.DEF: a running or swimming race between two or more teams in which each member of the team takes part one after another
to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察逮捕了几个人﹐后来都释放了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was released from the hospital yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他昨天获准出院了。

Sense.DEF: to let news or official information be known and printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new trade figures have just been released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

Sense.DEF: to make a CD, video, film etc available for people to buy or see
Sense.EXAMPLE: A version of the game for Mac computers will be released in February.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏的苹果电脑版将于2月份发行。

Sense.DEF: to stop holding or drop something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of bombs were released over Dresden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数以千计的炸弹在德累斯顿上空投下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sudden noise made him release his hold on her arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这突然的声响使他放开了抓着她胳膊的手。

Sense.DEF: to express or get rid of feelings such as anger or worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Physical exercise is a good way of releasing stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼身体是释放压力的好方法。

Sense.DEF: to let a substance flow out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oil was released into the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油被排入大海。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone not to do their duty or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because of rising costs, the company released 10% of their workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为成本不断上涨﹐公司解雇了10%的员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Williams asked to be released from her contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯要求解除她的合同。

Sense.DEF: to allow part of a piece of machinery or equipment to move from the position in which it is fastened or held
Sense.EXAMPLE: Release the handbrake first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先松开手闸。

Sense.DEF: when someone is officially allowed to go free, after being kept somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before release, the sea lions are fitted with electronic tracking devices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海狮在释放之前被装上了电子追踪器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon has obtained early release from prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙获准提早出狱。

Subsense.DEF: a new CD, video, film etc that is available to buy or see
Subsense.TRAN: 新发行的激光唱片[录像带﹐电影等]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the band’s latest release
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队最新发行的唱片

Subsense.DEF: if a film is on release, you can go see it in a cinema
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film is on general release.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影已经上映。

Subsense.DEF: freedom to show or express your feelings
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Playing an instrument can be a form of emotional release.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演奏乐器可以是情感宣泄的一种途径。

Subsense.DEF: a feeling that you are free from the worry or pain that you have been suffering
Subsense.EXAMPLE: treatment that will bring a release from pain
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助缓解疼痛的治疗方法

Sense.DEF: when a chemical, gas etc is allowed to flow out of its usual container

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the release of toxic waste into the rivers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废料向河流的排放

Sense.DEF: an official statement, report etc that is made available to be printed or broadcast, or the act of making it available
Sense.TRAN: 发布的声明[报告等]﹔〔声明﹑报告等的〕发表﹐发布
Sense.EXAMPLE: October 22nd is the date set for the report’s release.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告定于10月22日发表。

Sense.DEF: a handle, button etc that can be pressed to allow part of a machine to move
to give someone or something a less important position than before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women tended to be relegated to typing and filing jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女往往被安排去做打字﹑归档等较不重要的工作。

Sense.DEF:
if a sports team is relegated, it is moved into a lower
division

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were relegated to the Fourth Division last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年我们被降为丁级队。

Sense.DEF: to change your attitude and become less strict or cruel towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last her father relented and came to visit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后她父亲的态度软化﹐去看了她。

Sense.DEF: strict, cruel, or determined, without ever stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: her relentless determination to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要成功的坚定决心
Sense.EXAMPLE: a regime that was relentless in its persecution of dissidents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无情迫害持不同政见者的政权

Sense.DEF: something bad that is relentless continues without ever stopping or getting less severe
Sense.TRAN: 〔不愉快的事〕不间断的﹐没完没了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the relentless crying of a small baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小婴儿没完没了的哭声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family facing relentless financial problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济问题层出不穷的一个家庭

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He questioned her relentlessly.

Sense.DEF: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relevant documents were presented in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We received all the relevant information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What experience do you have that is relevant to this position?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有哪些和这个职位相关的经验？

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the country’s reliance on imported oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国对进口石油的依赖

Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

Sense.DEF: dependent on someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most companies are now reliant on computer technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公司现在依赖计算机技术。

Sense.DEF: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roman relics found in a field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the books and photos, relics of Rob’s university days
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书籍和照片——罗布大学时代的旧物
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything in the house seemed old and untouched, like relics of an ancient time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋里的一切似乎都很古老﹐没有人动过﹐就像是古时的遗迹。

Sense.DEF: a part of the body or clothing of a holy person which is kept after their death because it is thought to be holy
a feeling of comfort when something frightening, worrying, or painful has ended or has not happened
Sense.TRAN: 宽慰﹐宽心﹔〔恐惧﹑忧虑或痛苦过后的〕轻松
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a huge surge of relief and happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我如释重负﹐大感欣慰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He watched with relief as the girl nodded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到女孩点头﹐就放心了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He laughed in relief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放心地笑了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: No one was hurt, and we all breathed a sigh of relief .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人受伤﹐我们都松了一口气。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is a relief to see/have/know etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hate to say it, but it was a relief to have him out of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想这么说﹐但是他不在家里确实让我很轻松。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To my relief, they spoke English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我宽心的是他们说英语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor said it was just the flu. What a relief!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说只是流感。 终于放心了！

Sense.DEF: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the relief of suffering
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦减轻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cool room provided relief from the terrible heat outdoors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个凉爽的房间可以挡一挡户外的酷热。

Sense.DEF: money, food, clothes etc given to people who are poor or hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: money raised for the relief effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

GramExa.EXAMPLE: famine relief for victims of the drought
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为旱灾灾民提供的饥荒救济品

Sense.DEF: a person or group of people that replaces another one and does their work after they have finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: the relief for the military guard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接班的哨兵
Sense.EXAMPLE: a relief driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换班司机

Sense.DEF: a way of decorating wood, stone etc with a shape or figure that is raised above the surface, or the decoration itself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: figures carved in relief
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浮雕人像

Sense.DEF: to make something very noticeable, or to be very noticeable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tree stood out in stark relief against the snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树在白雪的映衬下显得格外醒目。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The article throws into sharp relief the differences between the two theories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章使两种理论的区别更加明显。

Sense.DEF: a funny moment during a serious film, book, or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔严肃的电影﹑书或情景中的〕轻松/滑稽场面
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moment of comic relief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松诙谐的一刻

Sense.DEF: money given by the government to help people who are poor, old, unemployed etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: families on relief during the Depression
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大萧条时期领取救济金的家庭

Sense.DEF: the act of freeing a town when it has been surrounded by an enemy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the relief of Mafeking
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马弗京的解围

Sense.DEF: if you show a part of the Earth’s surface in relief, you show the differences in height between different parts of it
a map that shows the different heights of mountains, valleys etc by printing them in a different colour or by raising some parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔用不同颜色或立体效果表示地势高低的〕地势图﹐地形图

Sense.DEF: a road that vehicles use to avoid heavy traffic, usually built for this purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于缓解交通拥堵的〕疏导路﹐辅路﹐旁道
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eastern relief road for city traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东面用于缓解城市交通的疏导路

Sense.DEF: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings
Sense.TRAN: 减轻﹐缓解〔疼痛或不快的感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people eat for comfort, to relieve their anxieties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人进食是为了寻找安慰﹐缓解焦虑。

Sense.DEF: to make a problem less difficult or serious
Sense.TRAN: 减轻﹐缓和﹐缓解〔问题的难度或严重性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: programs aimed at relieving unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在缓和失业问题的方案

Sense.DEF: to replace someone when they have completed their duty or when they need a rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard will be relieved at midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哨兵将在午夜时换岗。

Sense.DEF:
a polite expression meaning to
urinate
- often used humorously
to make something less dull and boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plain wall relieved by flecks of blue and yellow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以黄﹑蓝斑点打破素色墙面的单调

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The books helped relieve the boredom of waiting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在无聊的等待中﹐这些书能解闷。

Sense.DEF: to free a town which an enemy has surrounded
to help someone by taking something from them, especially a job they do not want to do or something heavy that they are carrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rose and relieved her of her bags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起来接过她手中的包。

Sense.LEXUNIT: relieve sb of their post/duties/command etc
Sense.DEF: to take away someone’s job because they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 解除某人的职务/职责/指挥权等
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the defeat General Meyer was relieved of his command.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战败之后﹐迈耶将军被解除了指挥权。

Sense.DEF: to steal something from someone - used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of guys relieved him of his wallet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个家伙偷了他的钱包。

Sense.DEF: feeling happy because you are no longer worried about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked immensely relieved when she heard the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这个消息﹐她似乎大大松了一口气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mother was relieved to see him happy again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他又高兴起来﹐他妈妈放心了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt relieved that Ben would be there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本会在那儿﹐我就放心了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A relieved smile spread over his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上绽开了宽慰的笑容。

Sense.DEF: a belief in one or more gods
Sense.EXAMPLE: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course on philosophy and religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

Sense.DEF: a particular system of this belief and all the ceremonies and duties that are related to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of different religions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教信仰不同的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Islamic religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊斯兰教
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tribe practised a religion that mixed native beliefs and Christianity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个部落信奉一种融合本地信仰和基督教信仰的宗教。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become interested in religion in a way that seems strange to other people
Sense.TRAN: 突然对宗教感兴趣﹔突然皈依
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller found religion in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒在监狱里突然信教了。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something is very important to someone and they are extremely interested in it and spend a lot of time doing it, watching it etc
Sense.TRAN: 某事物简直就是一种宗教信仰〔用于表示某人对某事物非常重视﹐并极感兴趣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football was a religion in my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球是我们一家人的狂热爱好。

Sense.DEF: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a religious school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教学校
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

Sense.DEF: believing strongly in your religion and obeying its rules carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: My aunt’s a deeply religious person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姑母是个非常虔诚的信徒。

Section.SECHEADING: RELATING TO RELIGION 与宗教有关的

Exponent.DEF: relating to religion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the country’s religious leaders
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的宗教领袖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the importance of religious freedom
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教自由的重要性

Exponent.DEF: relating to matters of the human spirit, rather than the physical world
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Spiritual leaders
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神领袖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: spiritual values
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神价值
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We tend to ignore people’s spiritual needs, and focus too much on material things.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们往往忽视人们的精神需求﹐而过多注重物质。

Exponent.DEF: connected with God and religion, and therefore treated in a special way – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 上帝的﹔宗教的﹔神圣的〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Holy Bible
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《圣经》
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the holy city of Mecca
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣城麦加
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a Hindu holy man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位印度教圣人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They believe they are fighting a holy war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相信自己在打一场圣战。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The priest puts some holy water on the child’s head.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师将一些圣水洒在那个孩子的头上。

Exponent.DEF: connected with God and religion, and therefore treated in a special way – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 上帝的﹔宗教的﹔神圣的〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This place is sacred to both Jews and Muslims.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地方对犹太人和穆斯林来说都是神圣的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In India, cows are considered sacred .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在印度﹐牛被视为神圣的动物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Hindu sacred texts
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度教经文
Exponent.EXAMPLE: sacred music
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣乐
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sacred ritual
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣礼

Exponent.DEF: relating to the study of religion or to religious beliefs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a theological debate
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 神学辩论
Exponent.EXAMPLE: theological training
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 神学培训

Exponent.DEF: not relating to religion or controlled by a religious authority
Exponent.TRAN: 世俗的﹐非宗教的﹔不受教会管辖的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: secular education
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世俗教育
Exponent.EXAMPLE: secular matters
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世俗事务
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the UK we live in a much more secular society.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国﹐我们生活在一个世俗得多的社会中。

Section.SECHEADING: BELIEVING IN A RELIGION 信仰宗教的

Exponent.DEF: believing strongly in a religion and obeying its rules
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My father was a very religious man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是个很虔诚的教徒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you religious?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你信教吗？

Exponent.DEF: having a very strong belief in a religion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a devout Catholic
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个虔诚的天主教徒

Exponent.DEF: believing in the traditional beliefs, laws, and practices of a religion
Exponent.TRAN: 正统信仰的﹐正宗教义的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: orthodox Jews
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正统的犹太教徒

Section.SECHEADING: NOT BELIEVING IN GOD OR RELIGION 不信仰上帝或宗教的

Exponent.DEF: someone who does not believe that God exists
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She says she is an atheist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自称是无神论者。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: atheist propaganda
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无神论宣传

Exponent.DEF: someone who believes that people cannot know whether God exists or not
Exponent.TRAN: 不可知论者﹔不可知论（者）的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think I’d describe myself as an agnostic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该说我是个不可知论者。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a group of prominent agnostic scientists
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群持不可知论的著名科学家

Sense.DEF: if you do something religiously, you are always very careful to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He exercises religiously every morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天早上都非常认真地锻炼。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is related to religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a religiously diverse country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教信仰多元的国家

Sense.DEF:
people who belong to Christian churches and who support
conservative
political ideas and have very traditional moral beliefs, for example not approving of
homosexuality
and
abortion
Sense.TRAN: 宗教右派〔指持保守政治观点﹑维护传统道德的基督教团体〕

Sense.DEF: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不情愿地〕放弃﹐交出〔职位﹑权力﹑权利〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stultz relinquished control to his subordinate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯塔尔茨把控制权交给了他的下属。

Sense.DEF: a container for religious objects that are related to holy people
to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t relish the thought of you walking home alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想让你一个人走回家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He relishes the chance to play Hamlet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很高兴能有机会扮演哈姆雷特。

Sense.DEF: great enjoyment of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ate with great relish , enjoying every bite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃得津津有味﹐享受每一口饭菜。

Sense.DEF: a thick spicy sauce made from fruits or vegetables, and usually eaten with meat
Sense.TRAN: 〔用水果或蔬菜做成的〕（浓）调味汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot dog with mustard and relish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配芥末酱和调味汁的热狗

Sense.DEF: to remember or imagine something that happened in the past so clearly that you experience the same emotions again
Sense.TRAN: 〔凭回忆或想象〕再次体验﹐重温
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls watch the tape, eager to relive their victory against UCLA.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们观看录像带﹐急于重温打败加州大学洛杉矶分校队的胜利时刻。

Sense.DEF: to put something into a container again, especially bullets into a gun

if you reload a page on the Internet, you ask for the information shown on that page to be sent to your computer again, usually because there has been a problem or because you want the information to be as new as possible
if a person or business relocates, or if they are relocated, they move to a different place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of firms are relocating to the North of England.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司正在迁往英格兰北部。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: businesses that relocate in depressed areas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迁往经济萧条地区的企业

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The residents were relocated to temporary accommodation while the work was being done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 施工期间﹐居民被安置在临时住处。

Sense.DEF: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦尔斯最终同意了﹐但很勉强。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reluctance to share information
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不情愿分享信息

Sense.DEF: slow and unwilling
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a reluctant smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她勉强笑了笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maddox was reluctant to talk about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马多克斯不愿意谈论此事。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Reluctantly, he agreed.

Sense.DEF: to trust or depend on someone or something to do what you need or expect them to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew I could rely on David.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

GramExa.PROPFORM: rely on sb/sth to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many working women rely on relatives to help take care of their children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多职业妇女都靠亲属来帮忙照看孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people now rely on the Internet for news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人现在靠因特网来了解新闻。

Sense.DEF: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: For its income, the company relies heavily on only a few contracts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的收入主要依靠少数几份合同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have to rely on the river for their water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用水只能依靠这条河。

Sense.DEF: to continue to be in the same state or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please remain seated until all the lights are on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请留在座位上﹐直到灯全都亮起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We remained friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们依然是朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy remained silent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩依然默不作声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite the job losses, Parker remained as manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有人失业﹐但帕克还是保住了经理的位子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many scientists remain unconvinced by the current evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现有证据依然不能使很多科学家信服。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something or someone stays in a particular state, condition, or place, rather than remains in it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示某事物或某人保持某种状态或停留于某地﹐一般用 stay﹐而不用 remain
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We stayed friends.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们依然是朋友。

Sense.DEF: to stay in the same place without moving away

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was too ill to remain at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她病得很重﹐不能再留在家里了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民获准留在英国。

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist or be left after others have gone, been used, or been destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little of the original building remains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来的建筑已经所剩无几。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The score is tied, with fifteen minutes remaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛还剩15分钟﹐双方比分持平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What remains of his original art collection is now in the city museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当初那些艺术藏品中得以保留下来的部分现在都在市博物馆里。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something is left rather than remains .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示某物留存﹐一般说 be left﹐而不说 remain
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Not much of the old town is left .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座老镇的原貌已所剩无几。

Sense.DEF: to be left after other things have been dealt with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several points remain to be settled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个问题尚待解决。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There remained a few jobs still to be finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还剩下几项任务需要完成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact remains that racism is still a considerable problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况是﹐种族主义依然是个相当大的问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is still uncertain whether something will happen or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It remains to be seen whether the operation was successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术是否成功还有待观察。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs remain and stay in spoken and written English. 动词remain和stay在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
Remain is more formal than stay. remain比stay正式。

Sense.DEF: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with
Sense.EXAMPLE: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spent the remainder of his police career behind a desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他警察生涯的剩余时间都是在办公桌前度过的。

Subsense.DEF: the number you get when you subtract one number from another number
the number that is left when you divide one number by another number
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fifteen divided by four gives you a remainder of 3.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 15除以4﹐余数为3。

Sense.DEF: the remaining people or things are those that are left when the others have gone, been used, or been dealt with
Sense.EXAMPLE: The few remaining guests were in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留下没走的几位客人都在厨房里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入余下的原料﹐用文火炖30分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only remaining question is whether we can raise the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩下的唯一问题是我们能否筹到这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the table were the remains of the evening meal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子上是晚餐的剩菜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: extensive Roman remains of ancient buildings at Arles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔勒的一大片古罗马遗迹

Sense.DEF: the body of someone who has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her remains are buried in Westminster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的遗体葬在威斯敏斯特。

Sense.DEF: a record or film that has the same music or story as one that was made before
Sense.TRAN: 重新录制的唱片﹔重新摄制的电影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a remake of ‘Cape Fear’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《海角惊魂》的新版

Sense.DEF: to film a story or record a piece of music again
Sense.TRAN: 重新摄制〔电影〕﹔重新录制〔唱片〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was remade as a musical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它被重新制作成为一部音乐剧。

Sense.DEF: to build or make something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: She remade her wedding dress to fit her daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己的婚纱改了改给女儿穿。

Sense.DEF:
to send someone back from a court of law, to wait for their
trial
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith was remanded in custody kept in prison until Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯在押候审直至星期二。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been remanded on bail for a month allowed to leave the law court and go home to wait for trial .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经取保候审一个月了。

Sense.DEF: to send a case to be dealt with in another court
Sense.TRAN: 将〔案件〕发回下级法院重审
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court remanded the case for trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院将案件发回下级法院重审。

Sense.DEF:
the period of time that someone spends in prison before their
trial

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evans committed suicide while on remand in Parkhurst prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯在押候审期间在帕克赫斯特监狱自杀了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: remand prisoners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在押犯人

Sense.DEF:
a place like a prison where people are kept while waiting for a
trial

a place like a prison where young people are kept while waiting for a
trial
something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, a local journalist overheard the remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不巧一名当地记者无意中听到了这些话。

Sense.DEF: the things you say in a formal speech

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the chairman’s introductory remarks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席的开场白

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Caldwell, in his remarks, emphasized the need for cooperation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考德威尔发言时强调了合作的必要性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have made that remark.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不该那样说。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He ignored my remark and carried on working.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没理会我的话﹐继续干活。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you do not think about carefully
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 不经意的/随口说出的话
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to upset you – it was just a throwaway remark.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是有意气你——那句话只是随口说说罢了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not planned or intended
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I found out about their relationship from a chance remark Teddy made at dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 从特迪吃饭时无意中说的一句话﹐我发现了他们的关系。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a remark about someone’s appearance or behaviour, especially an offensive one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He kept making personal remarks about Tom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不断地对汤姆进行人身攻击。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an offensive remark showing racist/sexist attitudes
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 种族主义/性别歧视的话

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that shows you do not think someone or something is very good
one that is clever and amusing

Sense.DEF: to say something, especially about something you have just noticed
Sense.TRAN: 评论﹔谈到﹐说起〔尤指刚察觉的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘This house must be very old,’ he remarked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这幢房子一定很古老了。”他说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anderson left the table, remarking that he had some work to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德森离开桌子﹐说他还有事情要做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remarked on the difference in security measures at the two airports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲到了两个机场安全措施的不同。

Sense.DEF: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise
Sense.TRAN: 非凡的﹔不寻常的﹔显著的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has made remarkable progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她取得了显著的进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a remarkable coincidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不寻常的巧合

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a remarkable achievement for the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对公司来说是一个非凡的成就。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is remarkable that women did not have the vote until that time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女直到那个时候才有选举权﹐这很令人惊讶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His drawings are remarkable for their accuracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画以精细著称。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a remarkable man .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个了不起的人。

Sense.DEF: in an amount or to a degree that is unusual or surprising

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She plays the violin remarkably well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的小提琴拉得特别好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Remarkably, all of the passengers survived the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人称奇的是﹐这次事故中所有乘客都幸免于难。

Sense.DEF: to marry again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Widowed in 1949, Mrs Hayes never remarried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海斯太太 1949年丧夫后一直没有再婚。

Sense.DEF: to make a musical recording sound better or a film look better by using a computer to improve the original
Sense.EXAMPLE: an album with 15 digitally remastered songs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包含15首经数字化翻录而成的歌曲的专辑

Sense.DEF: when two teams or people compete against each other a second time, especially when there was no clear winner in the first competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因首轮未决出胜负而举行的〕重赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both teams are preparing for the rematch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两支球队都在为重赛做准备。

Sense.DEF: able to be corrected or cured
Sense.EXAMPLE: remediable problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以解决的问题

Sense.DEF: a special course etc that helps students who have difficulty learning something
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助后进学生的〕补习课程/班/老师等

Sense.DEF: intended to improve something that is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some remedial work needs to be done on the foundations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地基需要修补一下。

Sense.DEF: intended to cure a problem with someone’s health
Sense.EXAMPLE: remedial mental health therapies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神健康治疗法

Sense.DEF: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The program is one remedy for discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个方案是解决歧视问题的一个办法。

Sense.DEF: a medicine to cure an illness or pain that is not very serious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a remedy for colds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗感冒的药物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a natural remedy that helps insomnia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有助于治疗失眠的天然药物

Sense.EXAMPLE: a home remedy one that you make at home for sore throats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗喉咙疼痛的家庭疗法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The herb is used as a folk remedy a traditional medicine, rather than one a doctor gives you for a baby’s teething pains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种草药是治疗幼儿出牙疼痛的民间药方。

Sense.DEF: if a situation is beyond remedy, nothing can be done to make it better
Sense.TRAN: 不可救药的﹐无法挽回的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt as if her marital problems were beyond remedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得她的婚姻问题好像已经无法挽回了。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了改善这种情况﹐水必须进行化学处理。

Sense.DEF: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you remember Rosa Davies?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得罗莎·戴维斯吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember her exact words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记不得她的原话了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I remember you two couldn’t stand each other at first!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得起初你们俩都受不了对方！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I remember meeting her at a party once.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得曾在某次聚会上见过她一面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I remember my father bringing home a huge Christmas tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得父亲带回来一棵巨大的圣诞树。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I remember it well ; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我记得很清楚﹔我从未见过母亲这么生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她清楚地记得他们登上火车时的激动心情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我隐约记得在报纸上看到过有关情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had three children, if I remember rightly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我没记错﹐他们有三个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve lived here for as long as I can remember .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我记忆中他们一直都住在这儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one got drunk as far as I can remember .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得当时没有人喝醉酒。

Sense.DEF: to bring information or facts that you know into your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: You left your keys on the table, remember?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把钥匙放在桌子上了﹐想起来了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember her phone number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不起来她的电话号码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suddenly remembered that I’d left the stove on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然想起我没有关炉子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I called the office, but I don’t remember who I spoke to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给办公室打过电话﹐但我记不起是谁和我通话的。

Sense.DEF: to not forget something that you must do, get, or bring
Sense.TRAN: 记住﹐记得﹝去做某事﹑拿某物等﹞
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope he remembers the wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他记得带酒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remember to take your P.E. clothes to school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了把你的运动服带到学校去。

Sense.DEF: to keep a particular fact about a situation in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember, processed food is usually full of salt and sugar.
