Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐加工食品一般都含有大量盐和糖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remember that not everyone has as much money as you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐不是每个人都和你一样有钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It should be remembered that a lot of work went into this event.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要忘了﹐这个活动花了不少功夫呢。

Sense.DEF: to think with respect about someone who has died, often in a ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: On this day we remember the dead of two world wars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天﹐我们缅怀两次世界大战的死难者。

Sense.DEF: to be famous for something important that you did in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is best remembered for his travel books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因他的游记而为人们所熟知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson wanted to be remembered as ‘the education president’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊希望人们记住他是“教育总统”。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a present on a particular occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lilian always remembers me at Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莲过圣诞节时总会送礼物给我。

GramExa.GLOSS: arrange for someone to have something of yours after you die
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在遗嘱中把部分财产赠予某人

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to give a greeting from you to someone else

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If you remember doing something , you have a picture in your mind of the time when you did it.
F2NBox.TRAN: remember doing something指记得以前做过某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I remember playing there when I was little.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得小时候在那里玩耍过。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you remember to do something , you do not forget to do what you had intended.
F2NBox.TRAN: remember to do something指记得要去做某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We must remember to close that window.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定要记得关上那扇窗。

Exponent.DEF: to form an idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I remember Janine – she lived in that house on the corner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得雅尼娜——她当时住在街角的那栋房子里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember how the film ends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不记得那部影片的结尾了。

Exponent.DEF: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation, especially in order to tell someone about it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指为了告诉别人某件事〕回想起
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you recall where your husband was that night?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得那天晚上你丈夫在哪里吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She recalled that he had seemed a strange, lonely man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她记得他好像是个孤苦伶仃的怪人。

Exponent.DEF: to remember an event or situation
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Harry smiled as he recollected the scene.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里回想起那一幕﹐微笑起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tried to recollect what had happened next in her dream.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她努力回忆自己梦里接下来发生了什么。

Exponent.DEF: to learn facts, a piece of writing or music etc, so that you can remember them later
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s trying to memorize his speech.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在努力熟记自己的讲稿。

Exponent.DEF: to think about something that happened in the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I thought back to when I was his age.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回忆起我在他那个年龄时的情形。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Looking back, I should have been more patient with her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 回想当时﹐我应该对她再耐心点的。

Exponent.DEF: to talk about pleasant events, people, experiences etc from the past, because you want to remember them or enjoy talking about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were reminiscing about old times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在追忆过去的时光。

Exponent.DEF: to remember something important when you are doing something, because it could affect what you do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bear in mind that this is the first time he’s done this.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐这是他第一次这样做。

Exponent.EXP: sth is on the tip of your tongue
Exponent.DEF: used to say that you know a word or a name but that you have difficulty remembering it at this exact moment
Exponent.TRAN: 某事物就在嘴边〔但想不起来了〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His name’s on the tip of my tongue. I’ll think of it in a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字就在我嘴边。让我想想。

Exponent.DEF: to make you think of another person, thing, or time, because they are similar
Exponent.TRAN: 让某人想起某事物〔因为相似〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It reminds me of the time when I first started teaching.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让我想起自己刚开始教书的时候。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The taste reminded him of school dinners.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那味道令他想起了学校伙食。

Sense.DEF: when people remember and give honour to someone who has died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a service in remembrance of those killed in the war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念战争死难者的仪式

Sense.EXAMPLE: a Holocaust remembrance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大屠杀纪念

Sense.DEF: a memory that you have of a person or event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trillin’s remembrances of his childhood
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里林的童年记忆

Sense.DEF: the Sunday nearest to November 11th, when a ceremony is held in Britain to remember people who were killed in the two world wars
Sense.TRAN: 阵亡将士纪念日〔最接近11月11日的星期天﹐英国在这一天举行仪式悼念两次世界大战中的阵亡者〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone remember something that they must do
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕想起〔必须做的事〕﹐提醒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girls constantly had to be reminded about their chores.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不经常提醒那些女孩子料理好自己的事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remind me to buy some milk tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提醒我今天晚上买点牛奶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Welland reminded her son that they still had several people to see.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦兰太太提醒儿子﹐他们还有几个人要拜访。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when something has just made you remember something you were going to say or do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, that reminds me, I saw Jenny in town today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐这倒提醒了我﹐我今天在城里看见珍妮了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I reminded myself to watch them closely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提醒自己要密切注意他们。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他记了几条﹐提醒自己要说些什么。

Sense.DEF: to make someone remember someone that they know or something that happened in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That song always reminds me of our first date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那首歌总使我回忆起我们的第一次约会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was reminded how lucky I was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使我想起我是多么幸运。

Sense.DEF: used in a joking way when someone has mentioned something that embarrasses or annoys you
Sense.TRAN: 别跟我提这事〔某人提到使你尴尬或不快的事情时的诙谐说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We’ve got a test tomorrow.’ ‘Don’t remind me!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们明天有考试。”“别跟我提这事！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: let me remind you/may I remind you (that)
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a warning or criticism
Sense.TRAN: 让我提醒你〔用于加强警告或批评的语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me remind you that you are expected to arrive on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我提醒你﹐你一定要按时到达。

Sense.DEF: to seem similar to someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕想起〔相似的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The landscape reminded her of Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿的风景让她想起苏格兰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corinne reminds me of myself when I was her age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科琳娜使我想起了我像她那么大时的情景。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you notice, remember, or think about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reminder of the dangers of drinking and driving
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于酒后驾车种种危险的警示

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Occasional bursts of gunfire are a reminder that the rebels are still active.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 零星的炮火声提醒人们﹐叛军仍在活动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The damaged church was preserved as a stark reminder of the horrors of war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座被毁的教堂被保留下来﹐无情地提醒人们战争的恐怖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The drop in stock prices serves as a reminder is a reminder that investing is a form of gambling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票价格的下跌提醒人们投资是一种赌博。

Sense.DEF: something, for example a letter, that reminds you to do something which you might have forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 〔提醒做某事的〕提示信﹐通知单
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reminder from the dentist for your check-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙医寄来的检查提醒函

Sense.DEF: to talk or think about pleasant events in your past
Sense.TRAN: 谈论[追忆]快乐的往事﹐缅怀过去

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a group of former students reminiscing about their college days
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 追忆着大学时光的一群老校友

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written story about events that you remember
Sense.TRAN: 回忆往事的谈话﹔回忆录

GramExa.EXAMPLE: reminiscences of the war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争回忆录

Sense.DEF: reminding you of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a style strongly reminiscent of Virginia Woolf’s novels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种酷似弗吉尼娅·吴尔夫小说的风格

Sense.DEF: thinking about the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face wore a reminiscent smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面带微笑﹐沉浸在往事之中。

Sense.DEF: careless because you did not do something that you ought to have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: parents who are remiss in their duties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有尽责的父母

GramExa.PROPFORM: it was remiss of sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was remiss of the social services not to notify the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有通知警方﹐这是社会福利部门的疏忽。

Sense.DEF: a period when a serious illness improves for a time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chemotherapy was successful, and she is now in remission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化疗很成功﹐现在她的症状有所缓解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The cancer has gone into remission .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症已经开始好转。

Sense.DEF: a reduction of the time that someone has to spend in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was given six months’ remission for good behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为表现良好获六个月减刑。

Sense.DEF: when you allow someone to keep the money they owe you
Sense.EXAMPLE: remission of debts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免除债务

Sense.DEF: forgiveness from God for the bad things that you have done
to send a payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please remit payment by cheque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请用支票汇付货款。

Sense.DEF: to free someone from a debt or punishment
to send a proposal, plan, or problem back to someone for them to make a decision about
Sense.TRAN: 把〔建议﹑计划或问题〕发回…〔以作出决定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court remitted the matter to the agency for reconsideration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭将此事发回该机构作重新考虑。

Sense.DEF: the particular piece of work that someone has been officially asked to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remit of a senior member of staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级雇员的职权范围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marketing is outside our remit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场营销不是我们的职责。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you send to pay for something
when you send money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will forward the goods on remittance of £10.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 10英镑汇出后即行发货。

Sense.DEF:
a different
version
of a popular song, in which someone has added to or changed the original recording
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disco remix
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混音版迪斯科舞曲

Sense.DEF: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The remnants of a meal stood on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃剩的饭菜摆在桌上。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of cloth left from a larger piece and sold cheaply
to change the shape, structure, or appearance of something, especially a building
Sense.TRAN: 改变〔尤指建筑的〕形状[结构﹐外观]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airport terminals have been extensively remodelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航站楼已作了大规模的改建。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
remould
a complaint or protest
Sense.EXAMPLE: angry remonstrances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的抗议

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you strongly disapprove of something they have said or done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Everton manager remonstrated angrily with the referee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃弗顿队主教练愤怒地向裁判抗议。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Throughout the trial, he had shown no remorse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个审判过程中﹐他没有表示出一丝悔意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a pang of remorse for what she had done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为自己所做的事感到一阵悔恨。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be full of remorse/be filled with remorse
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Filled with remorse, Dillon decided to resign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄龙满心懊悔﹐决定辞职。

Sense.DEF: something bad or threatening that is remorseless continues to happen and seems impossible to stop
Sense.TRAN: 〔令人不快或威胁人的事〕无休止的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remorseless winter winds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续不断的冬风

Sense.DEF: cruel, and not caring how much other people are hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: a remorseless murderer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个冷酷的杀手

Sense.DEF:
to borrow money by having a second
mortgage
on your house, or increasing the one you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: We may have to remortgage the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可能得把房子再按揭。

Sense.DEF: far from towns or other places where people live
Sense.EXAMPLE: a remote border town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个偏远的边境小镇
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fire in a remote mountain area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏远山区的火灾

Sense.DEF: if a chance or possibility of something happening is remote, it is not very likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔机会或可能性〕渺茫的﹐微乎其微的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a remote chance that you can catch him before he leaves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不大可能在他离开前赶上他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The prospect of peace seems remote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实现和平的希望似乎很渺茫。

Sense.DEF: far away in time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remote time when dinosaurs walked the earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐龙霸行天下的远古时代

GramExa.GLOSS: someone related to you, who lived a long time ago

Sense.DEF: very different from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Heights was quiet and clean and remote from the busy daily life of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高地静谧洁净﹐与忙碌的城市生活截然不同。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly, and not interested in people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father was a remote, quiet man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲是个冷淡的人﹐少言寡语。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have the remotest idea/interest/intention etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not know something, are not interested in something, do not intend to do something etc
Sense.TRAN: 一无所知/毫无兴趣/毫无打算等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hasn’t the remotest interest in sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对体育毫无兴趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t the remotest idea what you mean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点都不明白你是什么意思。

Sense.DEF:
a
remote control
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me the remote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把遥控器给我。

Sense.DEF: a system that allows you to use information on a computer that is far away from your computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕远程访问﹐远程存取

Sense.DEF: a thing you use for controlling a piece of electrical or electronic equipment without having to touch it, for example for turning a television on or off
the process of controlling equipment from a distance, using radio or electronic signals
Sense.TRAN: 〔用无线电或电子信号的〕遥控
Sense.EXAMPLE: a missile guided by remote control
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遥控制导导弹

Sense.DEF: a type of computer software that lets you use a particular computer by connecting it to another one that is far away

the process of calling your own telephone when you are away from your home or office so that you can listen to messages that people have left on your
answering machine
by only a small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brew tasted only remotely of beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这啤酒味道很淡。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something is not at all interested, funny etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was nothing remotely new in this idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个观点毫无新意。

Sense.DEF: from far away
Sense.EXAMPLE: remotely operated vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遥控驾驶的车辆

Sense.DEF:
the use of
satellite s
to obtain pictures and information about the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 遥感﹐遥测〔用人造卫星拍摄地球图像并获取信息〕

Sense.DEF: when people do their work at home, using a computer that is connected to the computer system in an office
Sense.TRAN: 远程工作〔通过与办公室的计算机联网在家里工作〕

Sense.DEF: to change an idea, system, way of thinking etc
Sense.TRAN: 改变〔观点﹑系统﹑思维方式等〕﹔改造
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mergers have forced organizations to remould themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并迫使机构改组。

Sense.DEF: an old tyre with a new surface, that you can use again
to get onto a horse, bicycle etc again
easy to remove
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sofa with removable cloth covers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布套可拆卸的沙发

Sense.DEF: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the removal of rubbish
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移除垃圾

Sense.DEF: when you get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: stain removal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去污

Sense.DEF: when someone is forced out of an important position or dismissed from a job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mayor’s removal from office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长被罢黜

Sense.DEF: the process of taking furniture from your old house to your new one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The removal men have been in and out all day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家工人一整天都在进进出出。

Sense.DEF: a large vehicle used for moving furniture and other things from one house to another
to take something away from, out of, or off the place where it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remove the old wallpaper and fill any holes in the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撕下旧墙纸﹐把墙上的洞都填平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reference books may not be removed from the library.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参考书不得带出图书馆。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

Sense.DEF: to force someone out of an important position or dismiss them from a job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress could remove the President from office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会可以罢免总统。

Sense.DEF: to take off a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He removed his hat and gloves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摘下了帽子和手套。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone takes clothing off rather than removes it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示脱衣服﹐一般用 take off﹐而不用 remove
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Is it OK if I take my coat off ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以把外套脱了吗？

Sense.DEF: to be very different from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The events in the newspaper article were far removed from reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上报道的这些事件与事实大相径庭。

Sense.DEF:
the child,
grandchild
etc of your
cousin
, or your cousin’s father, grandfather etc
Sense.TRAN: 隔一代/两代等的堂[表]亲戚

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – MEANING 义项 2

Exponent.DEF: to make something no longer exist, especially something that was causing problems
Exponent.TRAN: 去除〔尤指引起麻烦的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some stains are difficult to remove with ordinary washing powder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些污渍用普通洗衣粉难以去除。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the obstacles to an agreement have now been removed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成协议的所有障碍现在都已扫除。

Exponent.DEF: to remove someone or something that you do not want. Get rid of is much more common than remove in everyday English, but is usually only used in active sentences.
Exponent.TRAN: 摆脱某人/某物〔在日常英语中比 remove 常用得多﹐但一般仅用于主动句〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They managed to get rid of all the weeds.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们设法除掉了所有杂草。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was almost impossible to get rid of him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎不可能摆脱他。

Exponent.DEF: to completely get rid of something that you do not want, especially because it is unnecessary or causing problems
Exponent.TRAN: 根除〔不必要或引起麻烦的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you book online, this eliminates the need for a ticket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是网上预订的话就完全不需要票了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new system will help to eliminate costly delays.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新系统将有助于杜绝代价高昂的延误现象。

Exponent.DEF: to completely get rid of a disease or a problem
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The disease has been eradicated from most of Europe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病在欧洲大部分地区已被消灭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Street crime has almost been eradicated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头犯罪几乎已被根除。

Exponent.DEF: to remove something that has been written on a computer, or stored in a computer
Exponent.TRAN: 删除〔写入或存入计算机的某物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you want to delete this file?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想删除这个文档吗？

Exponent.DEF: to remove recorded sounds or pictures from a tape, or writing from paper
Exponent.TRAN: 抹去〔录音﹑画面〕﹔擦除〔文字〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall I erase this video?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以抹去这段录像吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s better to cross out a mistake than to try to erase it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 错的地方划去更好﹐不要擦掉。

Exponent.DEF: to remove a part from a film, book, speech etc
Exponent.TRAN: 删剪〔电影﹑书﹑讲话等的部分内容〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The most violent scenes were cut.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最暴力的镜头都被剪掉了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parts of his original speech were cut.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲原文有部分被剪掉了。

Sense.DEF: a distance or amount by which two things are separated

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The X-ray operator works at a safe remove in a separate room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: X射线操作人员在安全距离外的另一个房间工作。

Sense.DEF: a substance that removes paint marks etc
Sense.TRAN: 脱漆剂/洗甲水/去污剂等

Sense.DEF: a period during sleep when your eyes move quickly, when you are dreaming
the pay you give someone for something they have done for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: high rates of remuneration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高的报酬

Sense.DEF: making a lot of money
a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某种艺术形式﹑音乐形式等的〕复兴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a renaissance in wood carving over the last few years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去几年里木雕的复兴

Sense.DEF:
the period of time in Europe between 14th and 17th centuries, when art, literature,
philosophy
, and scientific ideas became very important and a lot of new art etc was produced
Sense.TRAN: 〔欧洲14至17世纪的〕文艺复兴时期

Sense.DEF: art, furniture etc belonging to the Renaissance period
Sense.TRAN: 文艺复兴时期的艺术/家具/建筑等

Sense.DEF: a man or woman who can do many things well, such as writing and painting, and who knows a lot about many different subjects

relating to the
kidney s
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute renal failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急性肾衰竭

Sense.DEF: to give something a new name

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Myddleton Way was renamed Allende Avenue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米德尔顿路已改名为阿连德大街。

Sense.DEF: becoming popular, strong, or important again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters have come back to a renascent Labour Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民又回来支持东山再起的工党了。

Sense.DEF: to tear or break something violently into pieces
to cause someone or something to be in a particular condition
Sense.TRAN: 使成为﹔使变得﹔使处于〔某种状态〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was rendered almost speechless by the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这个消息他几乎说不出话来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The blow to his head was strong enough to render him unconscious.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头上挨了重重的一击﹐昏了过去。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is unlikely that the court will render an opinion before November 5.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭不可能在11月5日以前表态。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered for something you have done
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

Sense.DEF: to express or present something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She made a sound that in print is rendered as ‘harrumph’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发出一个声音﹐写出来就是harrumph。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Infrared film renders blue skies a deep black.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 红外线胶片将蓝色的天空拍成深黑色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sculpture rendered in bronze
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一尊青铜雕像

Sense.DEF: to translate something into English, Russian etc
Sense.TRAN: 将某物译成英语/俄语/汉语等

Sense.DEF:
to spread
plaster
or
cement
on the surface of a wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brick wall that has been rendered and whitewashed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经抹上灰泥并粉刷好的砖墙

Sense.DEF: to melt the fat of an animal as you cook it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steam the goose to render some of the fat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鹅肉蒸一蒸﹐化掉一些油。

Sense.DEF: someone’s performance of a play, piece of music etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spirited rendering of the national anthem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有激情的国歌演奏

Sense.DEF: the way an expression, piece of writing etc is translated or explained, or the way an event, situation etc is described

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a faithful rendering of historical events
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对历史事件的忠实描述

Sense.DEF:
a material made of
cement
and sand, used on the outside walls of buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔用水泥和沙搅拌而成﹐用于涂抹外墙的〕灰泥

Sense.DEF: an arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place, often secretly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made a rendezvous with her in Times Square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和她相约在时代广场见面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: plans for a secret rendezvous
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘密约会的计划

Sense.DEF: a place where two or more people have arranged to meet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boats picked us up at pre-arranged rendezvous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在预先约定的地点接我们。

Sense.DEF: a bar, restaurant etc where people like to meet
Sense.TRAN: 热门聚会处〔指酒吧﹑饭店等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular rendezvous for media people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传媒界人士爱去的聚会场所

Sense.DEF: to meet someone at a time or place that was arranged earlier
Sense.TRAN: 〔在约定的时间或地点〕会面﹐相会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll rendezvous with James in Nicosia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在尼科西亚和詹姆斯碰头。

Sense.DEF: if two spacecraft, aircraft, or military vehicles rendezvous, they meet, for example to move supplies from one to the other
Sense.TRAN: 〔航天器﹑飞机或军用车辆为调动补给等而〕会合

Sense.DEF: someone’s performance of a play, piece of music etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a moving rendition of Lennon’s ‘Imagine’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深情地演唱了列侬的《想象》。

Sense.DEF: a translation of a piece of writing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an English rendition of a Greek poem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首希腊语诗歌的英译

Sense.DEF: someone who leaves one side in a war, politics etc in order to join the opposing side – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a renegade army unit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支变节的陆军分队

Sense.DEF: to not do something you have promised or agreed to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: They reneged on a pledge to release the hostages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们违背承诺﹐没有释放人质。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for an agreement or official document to continue for a further period of time
Sense.TRAN: 延长〔协议或官方文件〕的期限﹐使续期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to renew my passport this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年我需要办理护照换发。

Sense.DEF: to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people have renewed their efforts to save the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民再一次作出努力﹐挽救这所学校。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police renewed their appeal for witnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察再次呼吁目击者出来作证。

GramExa.GLOSS: become friendly with someone again

Sense.DEF: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window frames need to be renewed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗框需要换新的。

Sense.DEF: to arrange to borrow a library book for a further period of time
if an agreement or official document is renewable, you can make it continue for a further period of time after it ends
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议或官方文件〕可延期的﹐可续期的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a six-month lease but it’s renewable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租期六个月﹐但是可以续签。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a renewable visa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可延期的签证

Sense.DEF: renewable energy replaces itself naturally, or is easily replaced because there is a large supply of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔能源〕可更新的﹐可再生的﹐可恢复的
Sense.EXAMPLE: renewable energy such as solar power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳能等可再生能源
Sense.EXAMPLE: an industry based on renewable resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基于可再生资源的行业

Sense.DEF: renewable ways of producing energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must expand the use of renewables.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须扩大对可再生能源的利用。

Sense.DEF: when an activity, situation, or process begins again after a period when it had stopped

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a renewal of the recent conflict
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近那次冲突的继续
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spring is a time of renewal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天是万物复苏的时节。

Sense.DEF: when you make an agreement or official document continue for a further period of time after it ends
Sense.TRAN: 〔有效期的〕延长﹔展期﹔续订﹔更新

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the renewal of our annual licence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 更新我们一年期的许可证

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s contract comes up for renewal at the end of this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克的合同将在今年年末到期﹐需要续签。

Sense.DEF: when the poor areas of towns are improved by making new jobs, industries, homes etc
starting again, especially with increased interest or strength
Sense.TRAN: 再次发生的﹔再次兴起的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: renewed concern about farming methods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对农耕方式的重新关注
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The festival went ahead, despite renewed protests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管抗议再度爆发﹐节庆活动依然继续。

Sense.DEF: feeling healthy and relaxed again, after feeling ill or tired
Sense.TRAN: 体力恢复的﹔重新振作的

Sense.DEF: a substance used for making milk thicker in order to make cheese
if you renounce an official position, title, right etc, you publicly say that you will not keep it any more
Sense.TRAN: 宣布放弃〔职位﹑头衔﹑权利等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edward renounced his claim to the French throne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华宣布放弃对法国王位的继承权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She renounced her citizenship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她宣布放弃国籍。

Sense.DEF: to publicly say or show that you no longer believe in something, or will no longer behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 宣布与…断绝关系﹔宣布摒弃
Sense.EXAMPLE: These groups must renounce violence if there is to be progress towards peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 若要迈向和平﹐这些组织就必须放弃使用暴力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people renounced capitalism in favour of peace and love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人提倡和平和友爱﹐摒弃资本主义。

Sense.DEF: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again
Sense.TRAN: 修复﹐整修﹐翻新〔建筑物或家具〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店已经翻新﹐并重新装饰。

Sense.DEF: when you are famous and a lot of people admire you for a special skill, achievement, or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has won world renown for his films.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电影让他享誉全球。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He achieved some renown as a football player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为足球运动员﹐他小有名气。

Sense.DEF: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an island renowned for its beauty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个以美景闻名的岛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s renowned as a brilliant speaker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以口才出众著称。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a world renowned expert in the field
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该领域中享誉世界的专家

Sense.DEF: to regularly pay money to live in a house or room that belongs to someone else, or to use something that belongs to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most students rent rooms in their second year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学生到二年级时租房居住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather have my own house than rent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我更想有自己的房子﹐不想租房。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some farmers rent their land from the council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些农场主向市政会租赁土地。

Sense.DEF: to let someone live in a house, room etc that you own, or use your land, in return for money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rents out two rooms to students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把两个房间出租给学生。

Sense.DEF: to pay money for the use of something for a short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you rent a car while you’re in Spain?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在西班牙期间会租车吗？

Sense.DEF: if a house rents at or for an amount of money, that is how much you must pay to use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Houses here rent for at least $1,500 a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的房子每周租金至少1,500美元。

Sense.DEF: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pay the rent at the beginning of every month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每逢月初交付房租。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an annual rent of £8,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年8,000英镑的房租

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you pay to use a car, boat etc that belongs to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rent was only $20 an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时租金仅20美元。

Sense.DEF: available to be rented
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luxury villas for rent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华别墅招租。

Sense.DEF: a large tear in something made of cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: huge rents in the curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘的大裂缝

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rents in the city centre are very high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心的租金很高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our workers get low rents and other advantages.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的工人可获得低房租及其他优待。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely high
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some landlords charge exorbitant rents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些房东收取过高的租金。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rent is fixed for three years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年里房租不变。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: which people can easily pay
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government plans to provide more homes at affordable rents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府计划提供更多人们租得起的住房。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: rent paid to the owner of the land that a house, office etc is built on

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t afford to pay the rent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无力支付租金。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The landlord wants to put up the rent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东想涨租金。

Collocate.COLLOC: fall behind with the rent/get behind on the rent
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fail to pay your rent on time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How can they justify such big rent increases?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金涨那么多﹐他们怎么能说得过去？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money that you owe because you have not paid your rent
a book that shows the payments you have made in rent

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
rend
used to describe or refer to someone who is always willing to do something – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rent-a-mob people who are always willing to go and protest somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱闹事的暴民
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rent-a-quote politician one who is always willing to make a statement about a subject
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有金句出租的政客﹐爱发表议论的政客

Sense.DEF: the money that you pay to use a car, television, or other machine over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑电视或其他机器的〕租金﹐租用费

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price includes accommodation and car rental.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个价格包括住宿和租车的费用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Video rental is usually £3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像带的租金通常是3英镑。

GramExa.GLOSS: the money that you pay to use a telephone line

Sense.DEF: an arrangement to rent something for a period of time, or the act of doing this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you sign the rental agreement?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在租赁协议上签个字好吗？

Sense.DEF: something that you rent, especially a house or car
Sense.TRAN: 租用的东西〔尤指房屋﹑汽车〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: companies that provide rentals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租赁公司

Sense.DEF: a young man who has sex with other men in return for money
Sense.TRAN: 〔为男性提供性服务的〕年轻男妓

Sense.DEF: when a city or a state uses laws to control the cost of renting houses and apartments
houses etc that people pay rent for
Sense.TRAN: 租用的住处/住房/公寓等

Sense.DEF: without payment of rent
Sense.EXAMPLE: rent-free accommodation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费住宿
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lives there rent-free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他免费住在那里。

Sense.DEF: money that some people get from the local government to help them pay their rent
an occasion when all the people living in a group of houses or apartments refuse to pay their rent, as a protest against something
when someone makes a formal decision to no longer believe in something, live in a particular way etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对信仰﹑生活方式等的〕摈弃﹐放弃

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their renunciation of terrorist tactics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对恐怖策略的摒弃

Sense.DEF: if a theatre, restaurant etc reopens, or if it is reopened, it opens again after a period when it was closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The swimming pool will reopen in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳池将于5月份重新开放。

Sense.DEF: if you reopen a discussion, law case etc, or if it reopens, you begin it again after it had stopped
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔讨论﹑案件审理等〕再次开始﹐恢复

GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to reopen the issue of the power station’s future
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图重提发电站未来这一问题

Sense.DEF: if a government reopens the border of their country, or if the border reopens, people are allowed to pass through it again after it had been closed
to order a product to be supplied again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you reorder more of this fabric?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能再多订购一些这种面料吗？

Sense.DEF: to change the way that things are ordered or arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole system needs reordering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个系统需要重新调整。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or organize something in a new way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our office is being completely reorganized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们办公室正在彻底改组。

RunOn.DEF: a major reorganization of child care services
RunOn.TRAN: 儿童看护服务的重大调整

Sense.DEF:
a
sales representative
someone who speaks officially for a company, organization, or group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to speak to the students’ rep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要和学生代表谈一谈。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Safety reps have the right to stop the job when workers are in danger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人有危险的时候﹐安全代表有权停工。

Sense.DEF:
a
representative

repertory
, or a repertory theatre or company
Sense.TRAN: 轮流演出选定的剧目﹔轮演剧目剧场﹔轮演剧目剧团
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most actors start off in rep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数演员是从参加轮演剧目的演出起步的。

Sense.DEF:
a
reputation
one exercise that you do in a series of exercises
Sense.TRAN: 〔系列运动中的一组〕重复动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do 15 reps of each exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每组动作重复15次。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Representative, used before names 〔美国〕众议院议员〔用于名字前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rep. Bud Shuster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众议院议员巴德·舒斯特

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Republican共和党人[支持者]

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
repay
to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

Sense.DEF: to do something to remove harm that you have caused
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil tried to repair the damage that his statements had caused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔试图弥补他那番话造成的损害。

Exponent.DEF: to do some work on something that is damaged or not working properly, so that it is in good condition again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The builders are coming to repair the roof.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人会来修补屋顶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you had the washing machine repaired yet?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让人来修洗衣机了吗？

Exponent.DEF: to repair something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m taking the car in to get it fixed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把车送去修。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The chain on the bike needs fixing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车链条得修修了。

Exponent.DEF: to repair something that is damaged, torn, or not working
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve found someone who’ll mend the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找了个人来修补篱笆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you mend this sweater for me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我补一下这件毛衣好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to check a vehicle or machine and repair it if necessary, especially regularly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You should have your car serviced every six months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该每六个月保养一次汽车。

Exponent.DEF: to repair an old building so that it looks in good condition again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They bought an old house and renovated it themselves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们买了一栋旧房子﹐自己翻新。

Exponent.DEF: to repair something old and valuable, especially a building, piece of furniture, painting etc, so that it looks the same as it did originally
Exponent.TRAN: 修复〔有价值的古旧之物﹐尤指建筑﹑家具﹑画作等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many paintings were damaged in the fire but have now been restored.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多画作都在大火中受损﹐不过现在已经得到修复。

Exponent.DEF: to repair an old building or vehicle, so that it looks in good condition again
Exponent.TRAN: 修复〔古旧建筑〕﹔修理〔汽车〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He does up old cars and sells them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他修理旧车再出售。

Exponent.DEF: to quickly repair something that has a hole in it, by putting a piece of material on it, especially temporarily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They patched up the wall with bits of cement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用了一些水泥来补墙。

Exponent.DEF: to repair holes in clothes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you any good at darning socks?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会补袜子吗？

Sense.DEF: to go to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we repair to the drawing room?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去客厅好吗？

Sense.DEF: something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

GramExa.EXAMPLE: repairs to the roads
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路的维修

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His job is to make minor repairs on all the machines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作是给所有的机器作些小修小补。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The church tower is in need of repair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an extensive programme of building repairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的建筑修缮计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the paintings were beyond repair so damaged that they cannot be mended .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中许多画作已经无法修复。

GramExa.GLOSS: being repaired
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is the bridge still under repair?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥还在维修当中吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: They did a good repair job on the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把屋顶修得很好。

Sense.DEF: in good or bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Garden tools should be kept in good repair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 园艺工具应该妥善保管。

Sense.DEF: able to be fixed
Sense.TRAN: 可修理的﹐可修补的﹐可修缮的

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to repair things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the TV repairman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视机修理工

Sense.DEF: money paid by a defeated country after a war, for all the deaths, damage etc it has caused
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government agreed to pay reparations to victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府同意向受害者支付赔款。

Sense.DEF: when you give something to someone or do something for them because you have done something wrong to them in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Offenders must make reparation for their crimes through community service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯法者必须通过社区服务来补偿他们的罪行。

Sense.DEF: conversation which is fast and full of intelligent and amusing remarks and replies
Sense.TRAN: 机智而巧妙的应对[回答]
Sense.EXAMPLE: witty repartee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机智的应答

Sense.DEF: a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chefs had prepared a delicious repast for the mayor and his guests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨师们已为市长及其宾客备下佳肴。

Sense.DEF: to send someone back to their own country
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, prisoners were repatriated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐战俘被遣返。

Sense.DEF: to send profits or money you have earned back to your own country
to pay back money that you have borrowed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your mortgage will be repaid over 25 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的按揭贷款将在25年内还清。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll repay you the money you lent me next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你借给我的钱我下星期还你。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone pays money back rather than repays it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示还钱﹐一般用 pay back﹐而不用 repay
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you back the money at the end of the week.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我周末还你钱。

Sense.DEF: to do something for someone, or give them something, in return for helping you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can we repay him for everything he’s done?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎么才能报答他所做的一切呢？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to buy them something to repay all their kindness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给他们买点东西来报答他们的好意。

Sense.DEF: if something repays your time, effort etc, it is worth the time or effort you have spent
money that is repayable at a particular time has to be paid back by that time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a loan repayable over 10 years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 10年还清的贷款

Sense.DEF: when you pay back money that you have borrowed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the repayment of debt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 债务的偿还

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you pay regularly until you do not owe any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: monthly mortgage repayments of £330
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月330英镑的按揭贷款还款额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you worry about meeting paying your loan repayments ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是否在为支付每一期还款而发愁？

Sense.DEF: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law
to say or write something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you repeat your question?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry - could you repeat that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick patiently repeated that he had to work that day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克耐心地重复了一遍﹐说那天他得上班。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不是我的错﹐我再说一遍﹐不是。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I promise,’ she repeated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我保证。”她又说了一遍。

GramExa.GLOSS: say something that you have said before, usually by mistake
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔通常指无意地〕重复自己说过的话
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Elderly people tend to repeat themselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人说话往往重复。

Sense.DEF: to do something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Repeat the exercises twice a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套操每天做两次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must not repeat the mistakes of the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能再犯以前的错误。

GramExa.GLOSS: do the same class at school again the following year

Sense.EXAMPLE: The team are hoping to repeat their success achieve the same good result of last season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队希望再续上一赛季的佳绩。

Sense.DEF: to say something that someone else has just said, especially in order to learn it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Repeat after me: amo, amas, amat …
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请跟我读amo﹐amas﹐amat ……

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that you have heard, especially something secret
Sense.TRAN: 转述〔听说的东西﹐尤指秘密〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s what happened, but don’t repeat it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情是这样的﹐不要告诉别人。

Sense.DEF: to broadcast a television or radio programme again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The series will be repeated in the autumn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部连续剧秋天将重播。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not want to repeat what someone has said, especially because it is rude
Sense.TRAN: 某人的话不堪重复〔尤因粗鲁〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her comments don’t bear repeating!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的那番话真是不堪重复！

Sense.DEF: if food repeats on you, its taste keeps coming back into your mouth after you have eaten it
an event that is very like something that happened before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The match was basically a repeat of last year’s game at Wembley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛差不多是去年温布利那场比赛的翻版。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance have the same thing happen again on the way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

Sense.DEF: a television or radio programme that has been broadcast before
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is it a repeat?’ ‘No, it’s a new series.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “是重播吗？”“不是﹐是新播出的连续剧。”

Sense.DEF:
an order of goods or a
prescription
of medicine that is the same as one you had before
Sense.TRAN: 〔相同货物的〕续订订单/〔同样药物的〕相同处方

Sense.DEF: the sign that tells a performer to play a piece of music again, or the music that is played again
too rude to repeat – used about something someone says
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人的话太粗俗〕不宜重复的

Sense.DEF: able to be repeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope these results are repeatable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望这些结果是可复验的。

Sense.DEF: done or happening again and again
Sense.EXAMPLE: repeated calls for change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再三呼吁变革
Sense.EXAMPLE: repeated attempts to kill him
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再三企图杀害他

Sense.DEF: many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham was repeatedly warned not to work so hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆一再被提醒工作不要这么拼命。

Sense.DEF: a gun that you can fire several times before you have to load it again
if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell repelled him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这气味让他反感。

Sense.DEF: to make someone who is attacking you go away, by fighting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was ready to repel an attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队已准备好击退进攻。

Sense.DEF: to keep something or someone away from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lotion that repels mosquitoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驱蚊液

Sense.DEF: if two things repel each other, they push each other away with an electrical force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two positive charges repel each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个正电荷相互排斥。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人厌恶的﹐让人反感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found him physically repellent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得他的长相很讨厌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sight of blood is repellent to some people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人看到血会不舒服。

Sense.DEF: a substance that keeps insects away
to be sorry for something and wish you had not done it – used especially when considering your actions in a religious way
Sense.TRAN: 忏悔﹔懊悔﹐后悔〔尤用于从宗教角度看待自己的行为时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He repented of his sins before he died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他临死前为自己的罪过忏悔。

Sense.DEF: when you are sorry for something you have done
sorry for something wrong that you have done
the effects of an action or event, especially bad effects that continue for some time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不好的〕持续影响﹔反响﹔后果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The collapse of the company had repercussions for the whole industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的倒闭影响了整个行业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were serious repercussions on his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的事业受到了严重影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the repercussions of the crisis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 危机造成的后果

Sense.DEF: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个表演者或团体的〕全部剧目﹐常备节目

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group include some techno in their repertoire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组合的常备表演项目里包括高科技舞曲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wide repertoire of songs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰富的常备曲目

Sense.DEF: the total number of things that someone or something is able to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: the behavioural repertoire of infants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴幼儿的行为能力

Sense.DEF: a type of theatre work in which actors perform different plays on different days, instead of doing the same play for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧团〕选定节目轮演﹐保留剧目轮演
Sense.EXAMPLE: a repertory company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮演剧目剧团

Sense.DEF: a repertoire
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个表演者或团体的〕全部剧目﹐常备节目

Sense.DEF: doing or saying the same thing many times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job involved the constant repetition of the same movements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份活儿需要不断重复同样的动作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Children used to learn by repetition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去小孩子是通过背诵来学习的。

Sense.DEF: something that happens again, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 再次发生的事〔尤指不好的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a repetition of the same problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 同一问题的再次出现

Sense.DEF: involving the same actions or using the same words many times, in a way that is boring
Sense.TRAN: 重复的﹔一再的﹔反反复复的
Sense.EXAMPLE: repetitious work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重复的工作

Sense.DEF: done many times in the same way, and boring

GramExa.EXAMPLE: repetitive tasks like washing and ironing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗涤熨烫之类重复乏味的工作

Sense.EXAMPLE: The song was dreary and repetitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌又枯燥又重复。

Sense.DEF:
pains in your hands, arms etc caused by doing the same hand movements many times, especially by using a computer
keyboard
or
mouse
Sense.TRAN: 〔手﹑手臂等的〕重复劳损性损伤

Sense.DEF: to say or write something again using different words to express what you mean in a way that is clearer or more acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使意思更清楚或更可接受而〕重新措辞
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK. Let me rephrase the question .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐让我换个说法来提这个问题。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将接替队里的休。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from their job or something from its place, and put a new person or thing there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the tyres had to be replaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中两个轮胎必须得换下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They replaced the permanent staff with part-timers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用兼职人员来代替固定职员。

Sense.DEF: if you replace something that has been broken, stolen etc, you get a new one
Sense.TRAN: 更换〔已损坏之物﹑被盗的东西等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll replace the vase I broke as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽快换掉被我打碎的花瓶。

Sense.DEF: to put something back where it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: He replaced the book on the shelf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把书放回架子上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say put something back rather than replace something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示将某物放回原处﹐一般用 put back﹐而不用 replace
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to put the books back when you’ve finished.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 书看完后别忘记放回去。

Sense.DEF: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our old car is badly in need of replacement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的旧车急需更换。
Sense.EXAMPLE: replacement windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新换的窗户

Sense.DEF: an artificial knee etc that replaces a damaged one, given to people in a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 人工膝关节/人工髋骨/人工关节

Sense.DEF: someone or something that replaces another person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was difficult to find a replacement for Ted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难找到人来接替特德。

Sense.DEF: if a train is replatformed, passengers have to get on it in a different part of the station from the one they were originally told to go to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The replatformed 19:47 to Leeds will now leave from platform six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19点47分开往利兹的列车已改换站台﹐将由六号站台开出。

Sense.DEF: to play a game again because neither team won the first time
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于未决出胜负而〕重新举行〔比赛〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match will be replayed on Wednesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛将在星期三再进行一次。

Sense.DEF: to show again on television something that has been recorded
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视上〕重放﹐回放﹐重播〔录像〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Highlights of the race were replayed on the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛的精彩场面在新闻里重放。

Sense.DEF: a game that is played again because neither team won the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Milan won the semi-final replay 3-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米兰队在半决赛的重赛中以三比零取胜。

Sense.DEF: a part of a game of sport that has been recorded on video tape or film, and that is shown again, especially in order to examine it more clearly
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛部分镜头的〕重放﹐回放﹐重播
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can see on the replay that the goalkeeper was fouled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从回放镜头中可以看到有人对守门员犯规。

Sense.DEF: something that is done exactly as it was before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a replay of the same old mistakes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前犯过的同样错误的重演

Sense.DEF: to put new supplies into something, or to fill something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: More vaccines are needed to replenish our stocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还需要更多的疫苗来补充我们的储备。

Sense.DEF: full of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Literature is replete with tales of power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学作品里全是有关权力的故事。

Sense.DEF: very full of food or drink
an exact copy of something, especially a building, a gun, or a work of art
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指建筑﹑枪或艺术品的〕仿制品﹐复制品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exact replica of the Taj Mahal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 逼真的泰姬陵模型

Sense.EXAMPLE: replica guns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿真枪

Sense.DEF: if you replicate someone’s work, a scientific study etc, you do it again, or try to get the same result again
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a need for further research to replicate these findings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要进一步的研究来验证这些结果。

Sense.DEF:
if a
virus
or a
molecule
replicates, or if it replicates itself, it divides and produces exact copies of itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ability of DNA to replicate itself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱氧核糖核酸的自我复制能力

Sense.DEF: to answer someone by saying or writing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去﹐但他没有回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我过了这么久才回复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has Ian replied to your letter yet?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩给你回信了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mills replied that he was staying at his parents’ flat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔斯回答说他住在父母的公寓里。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Reply is used especially in written English. In everyday English, people usually say answer .
F2NBox.TRAN: reply 尤用于英语书面语。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用 answer
F2NBox.BADEXA: You haven’t replied to my question.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还没有回答我的问题。

Sense.DEF: to react to an action by doing something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rebel troops replied to government threats with increased violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军用更激烈的暴力活动来回应政府的威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The British replied by sending in troops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国以出兵作为回应。

Sense.DEF: something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着打电话去﹐但没有人接。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We still haven’t received a reply to our letter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的信还没有得到回音。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen made no reply .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬没有回答。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Reply is used especially in written English. In everyday English, people usually say answer .
F2NBox.TRAN: reply 尤用于英语书面语。 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用 answer
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I tried calling, but there was no answer .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着打电话去﹐但没有人接。

Sense.DEF: as a way of replying to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am writing in reply to your letter of 1st June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6月1日的来信收悉﹐现答复如下。

Sense.DEF:
if a sports team gets a number of points or
goal
s without reply, their opponents do not score
a reply-paid envelope is one which you can send back to an organization without a stamp because they have already paid for this

someone whose job is to
repossess take away
cars that have not been paid for
a written or spoken description of a situation or event, giving people the information they need

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Colleges have to provide a written report on the progress of each student during the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院必须出具每名学生一年学业进展的书面报告。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing in a newspaper about something that is happening, or part of a news programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to recent news reports , two of the victims are Americans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据近期的新闻报道﹐受害者中有两名是美国人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: media reports of the food shortages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于食物短缺的媒体报道

Sense.DEF: an official document that carefully considers a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recent report on child abuse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新近一份关于虐童问题的报告

Sense.DEF: information that something has happened, which may or may not be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police received reports of a bomb threat at the airport at 11:28 p.m.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方收到机场炸弹恐吓传言﹐时间是晚上11点28分。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Government officials have denied reports of rebel advances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员否认了有关叛军正在推进的传言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a report that he had been killed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说他已经被杀的传闻

Sense.DEF: a written statement by teachers about a child’s work at school, which is sent to his or her parents
someone who works for a particular manager
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only Gordon’s direct reports are attending the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有戈登的直接下属参加这个课程。

Sense.DEF: the noise of an explosion or shot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loud report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的爆炸声

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her social worker has written a report on the case.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责她这一案例的社工已就此写了份报告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We make regular progress reports to our manager.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们定期向经理汇报进展情况。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a report, usually a spoken one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He came to the office to give his report in person.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来到办事处﹐亲自作报告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The surveyor will view the property and prepare a full report.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 房产检视员会来察看房产并准备一份完整的报告。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give a written report to someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors will have to submit weekly reports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生必须每周提交报告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report said that it would cost another £250 million to repair the damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告称﹐要修复损坏将再花费2.5亿英镑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A full report will be prepared for the next committee meeting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 将准备一份完整的报告提交给下次委员会会议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Black graduates still face discrimination from employers, according to an official report.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据官方报告﹐黑人毕业生仍面临雇主的歧视。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mr Thomas asked me to send him a written report.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 托马斯先生要求我给他一份书面报告。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that only a few people see

Sense.DEF: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是加文·威廉斯﹐在纽约联合国总部为您报道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Times sent her to Bangladesh to report on the floods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《泰晤士报》派她去孟加拉报道水灾灾情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Journalists in Cairo reported that seven people had been shot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开罗的记者报道说有七人遭到枪击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Witnesses reported seeing three people flee the scene.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目击者称看到有三个人逃离现场。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a statement has been made about someone or something, but you do not know if it is true
Sense.TRAN: 据报道是某事物/做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stolen necklace is reported to be worth $57,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说被盗项链价值5.7万美元。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about what has been happening, or what you are doing as part of your job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve asked him to come back next week and report on his progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求他下星期回来汇报工作进展情况。

Sense.DEF: to officially give information to the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors have reported a 13% increase in the number of people with heart disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生公布患心脏疾病的人数增加了13%。

Sense.DEF: to tell the police or someone in authority that an accident or crime has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to report a theft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要报告一宗盗窃案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有事故都必须向安全员报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane was reported missing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报告﹐飞机失踪了。

Sense.DEF: to complain about someone to people in authority

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Polish referee Ryszard Wojoik reported two Leeds United players for violent conduct.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 波兰裁判理夏德·沃耀克告发利兹联队的两名队员行为粗暴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hadley’s drinking problem led co-workers to report him to the supervisor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈德利因酗酒问题被同事向主管举报了。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere and officially state that you have arrived

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All visitors must report to the site office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有来访者都必须向现场管理处报到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All soldiers were required to report for duty arrive and be ready for work on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有士兵都必须在星期五报到。

Sense.DEF: to officially tell your employers that you cannot come to work because you are ill
to give someone information about something that they asked you to find out about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee has 60 days to report back to Congress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会有60天时间向国会报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students were asked to report back on their results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生须报告他们的结果。

Sense.DEF: to be responsible to someone at work and be managed by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He will report to Greg Carr, Boston Technology's chief executive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将接受波士顿技术公司总裁格雷格·卡尔的领导。
